analyzed: yat kiṃcid subhūte rūpam audārikam vā sūkṣmam vā hīnam vā praṇītam vā yat atra kṣaṇikeṣu
translated: Whatever form there is, gross or subtle, inferior or exalted, in momentary dharmas,

original: dharmeṣu parikalpanayā grahaṇam eti / idam ucyate rūpanimittaṃ / katamac ca subhūte ārūpyanimittaṃ /
analyzed: dharmeṣu parikalpanayā grahaṇam eti idam ucyate rūpa nimittam katamat ca subhūte ārūpya nimittam
translated: which is grasped through imagination, this is called the causal sign of form. And what, Subhuti, is the causal sign of the formless?

original: yat kiṃcid arūpiṇāṃ parikalpya kleśo jāyate /
analyzed: yat kiṃcid arūpiṇām parikalpya kleśaḥ jāyate
translated: Whatever defilement arises through imagining the formless,

original: idam ucyate ārūpyanimittaṃ / tad bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann upāyakauśalena tato nimittād vivecya ānimitte dhātau niveśayati
analyzed: idam ucyate ārūpya nimittam tat bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran upāya kauśalena tatas nimittāt vivecya ā nimitte dhātau niveśayati
translated: this is called the causal sign of the formless. The Bodhisattva, the great being, coursing in the perfection of wisdom, through skill in means, having separated from these causal signs, establishes in the signless element,

original: tathā uca niveśayati / tathā pratiṣṭhāpayati yathā na dvaye patati / idaṃ nimittam idam ānimittam iti / evaṃ khalu subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ
analyzed: tathā uca niveśayati tathā pratiṣṭhāpayati yathā na dvaye patati idam nimittam idam ānimittam iti evam khalu subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: Thus, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being,

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ AdSPG II
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām adspg
translated: practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: carann upāyakauśalena sattvān nimittād vivecya ānimitte dhātau pratiṣṭhāpayati /
analyzed: caran upāya kauśalena sattvān nimittāt vivecya ā nimitte dhātau pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: with skillful means, having separated beings from signs, establishes them in the signless element.

original: āha / yadi bhagavann iyat paramā ete sarvadharmā yaduta nāmanimittaparamāḥ prajñaptimātrāḥ parikalpasamutthitāḥ /
analyzed: āha yadi bhagavan iyat paramāḥ ete sarva dharmāḥ yat uta nāma nimitta paramāḥ prajñapti mātrāḥ parikalpa samutthitāḥ
translated: He said: If, Blessed One, these are the highest of all dharmas, namely name and sign, mere designation, arisen from conceptualization,

original: kathaṃ bhagavaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann ātmanā ca viśeṣam
analyzed: katham bhagavam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran ātmanā ca viśeṣam
translated: how, Blessed One, does the Bodhisattva, the great being, practicing the perfection of wisdom, himself attain

original: adhigacchati / kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu / paraṃ ca viśeṣa adhigame pratiṣṭhāpayati kuśaleṣu
analyzed: adhigacchati kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu param ca viśeṣa adhigame pratiṣṭhāpayati kuśaleṣu
translated: distinction in wholesome dharmas, and how does he establish others in the attainment of distinction in wholesome

original: dharmeṣu / yaiḥ kuśalair dharmair bhūmyābhūmiṃ paripūrayati / sattvāṃś ca triṣu yāneṣu niyojayati /
analyzed: dharmeṣu yaiḥ kuśalaiḥ dharmaiḥ bhūmyā abhūmim paripūrayati sattvān ca triṣu yāneṣu niyojayati
translated: dharmas, by which wholesome dharmas he fulfills the stages and the [bodhisattva] levels, and connects beings to the three vehicles?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: sacet subhūte vastv abhaviṣyan na avastu nimittaṃ / nedaṃ subhūte prajñāpāramitāyāṃ🔽caran bodhisattvo mahāsattvo kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu viśeṣam adhyagamiṣyan na paraṃ ca
analyzed: saced subhūte vastu abhaviṣyat na avastu nimittam na idam subhūte prajñāpāramitāyām  caran bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu viśeṣam adhyagamiṣyat na param ca
translated: If, Subhūti, there were a thing, and not a signless non-thing, then, Subhūti, a Bodhisattva, a great being, practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: viśeṣādhigame niyojayiṣyat / yasmāt tarhy avastu nimittaṃ na vastu /
analyzed: viśeṣa adhigame niyojayiṣyat yasmāt tarhi avastu nimittam na vastu
translated: would not have attained distinction in wholesome dharmas, and would not have engaged others in attaining distinction. But because there is a signless non-thing,

original: tasmāt subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattva prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran dhyānapāramitāṃ paripūrayaty
analyzed: tasmāt subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva prajñāpāramitāyām caran dhyāna pāramitām paripūrayati
translated: therefore, Subhūti, a Bodhisattva, a great being, practicing the perfection of wisdom, fulfills the perfection of meditation

original: ānimittayogena vīryapāramitāṃ kṣāntipāramitāṃ śīlapāramitāṃ dānapāramitāṃ paripūrayaty
analyzed: ā nimitta yogena vīrya pāramitām kṣānti pāramitām śīla pāramitām dāna pāramitām paripūrayati
translated: through the yoga of signlessness, fulfills the perfection of energy, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving

original: ānimittayogena / catvāri dhyānāni paripūrayaty ānimittayogena / catvāry apramāṇāni
analyzed: ā nimitta yogena catvāri dhyānāni paripūrayati ā nimitta yogena catvāri apramāṇāni
translated: through the yoga of signlessness. He fulfills the four meditations through the yoga of signlessness, fulfills the four immeasurables

original: paripūrayaty ānimittayogena / catasra ārūpyasamāpattīn paripūrayaty ānimittayogena /
analyzed: paripūrayati ā nimitta yogena catasraḥ ārūpya samāpattīn paripūrayati ā nimitta yogena
translated: through the yoga of signlessness, fulfills the four formless attainments through the yoga of signlessness,

original: catvāri smṛtyupasthānāni paripurayaty ānimittayogena / yāvad āryāṣṭāṃgaṃ mārgaṃ paripūrayaty
analyzed: catvāri smṛti upasthānāni paripurayati ā nimitta yogena yāvat ārya aṣṭāṃgam mārgam paripūrayati
translated: fulfills the four establishments of mindfulness through the yoga of signlessness, up to fulfills the noble eightfold path

original: ānimittayogena / adhyātmaśūnyatāṃ paripūrayaty ānimittayogena / bahirddhāśūnyatāṃ paripūrayaty
analyzed: ā nimitta yogena adhyātma śūnyatām paripūrayati ā nimitta yogena bahirddhā śūnyatām paripūrayati
translated: He perfects the emptiness of internal phenomena by the yoga of signlessness. He perfects the emptiness of external phenomena by the yoga of signlessness.

original: ānimittayogena / adhyātmabahirddhāśūnyatāṃparipūrayaty ānimittayogena / yāvat svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāṃ
analyzed: ā nimitta yogena adhyātma bahirddhā śūnyatām paripūrayati ā nimitta yogena yāvat sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatām
translated: He perfects the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena by the yoga of signlessness. Up to he perfects the emptiness of defining characteristics by the yoga of signlessness.

original: paripūrayaty ānimittayogena / aṣṭau vimokṣān paripūrayaty ānimittayogena / navānupūrvasamāpattīn🔽paripūrayaty ānimittayogena / daśatathāgatabalāni paripūrayaty ānimittayogena / yāvad
analyzed: paripūrayati ā nimitta yogena aṣṭau vimokṣān paripūrayati ā nimitta yogena nava anupūrva samāpattīn  paripūrayati ā nimitta yogena daśa tathāgata balāni paripūrayati ā nimitta yogena yāvat
translated: He perfects the eight liberations by the yoga of signlessness. He perfects the nine serial absorptions by the yoga of signlessness.

original: aṣṭādaśāveṇikān buddhadharmān paripūrayaty ānimittayogena / sa imān kuśalān dharmān🔽f / paripūrya parān atraiva kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu niyojayaty ānimittayogena / sacet
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa āveṇikān buddha dharmān paripūrayati ā nimitta yogena saḥ imān kuśalān dharmān  paripūrya parān atra eva kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu niyojayati ā nimitta yogena saced
translated: He perfects the ten powers of the Tathagata by the yoga of signlessness. Up to he perfects the eighteen distinct attributes of a Buddha by the yoga of signlessness. Having perfected these wholesome dharmas,

original: punaḥ subhūte dharma nimittam abhaviṣyad antaśo vālāgrakoṭinikṣepamātram api /
analyzed: punar subhūte dharma nimittam abhaviṣyat antaśas vāla agra koṭi nikṣepa mātram api
translated: he engages others in these very wholesome dharmas by the yoga of signlessness. If, Subhuti, there were even a sign of a dharma, down to the tip of a hair,

original: nedaṃ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattva prajñāpāramitāyāṃ AdSPG II
analyzed: na idam subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: then, Subhuti, this would not be the perfection of wisdom of the Bodhisattva, the great being.

original: carann ānimittam asmṛtim amanasikāraṃ dharmam abhisaṃbhotsyata / sattvāṃś ca tathātve pratyupasthāpayiṣyati anāsraveṣu dharmeṣu /
analyzed: caran ā animittam a smṛtim a manasikāram dharmam abhisaṃbhotsyata sattvān ca tathātve pratyupasthāpayiṣyati anāsraveṣu dharmeṣu
translated: Practicing the signless, the wishless, the uneffected, the unarisen, the unborn, the unconditioned, he will fully awaken to the wisdom of the Buddhas. And he will establish beings in the same way, in the uncontaminated dharmas.

original: sarve hi subhūte anāsravā dharmā ānimittam asmṛtir amanasikāraḥ / evaṃ khalu subhūte
analyzed: sarve hi subhūte anāsravāḥ dharmāḥ ānimittam asmṛtiḥ amanasikāraḥ evam khalu subhūte
translated: For all uncontaminated dharmas are signless, wishless, uneffected, unarisen, unborn, unconditioned, and without mental engagement. Thus, Subhūti,

original: bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran sarvasattvānām arthaṃ karoty anāsravair dharmaiḥ /
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran sarva sattvānām artham karoti anāsravaiḥ dharmaiḥ
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom in this way benefits all beings through uncontaminated dharmas.

original: āha / yadi bhagavan sarvadharmā ānimittam asmṛtir amanasikāraḥ /
analyzed: āha yadi bhagavan sarva dharmāḥ ānimittam asmṛtiḥ amanasikāraḥ
translated: He said: If, Blessed One, all dharmas are signless, wishless, uneffected, unarisen, unborn, unconditioned, and without mental engagement,

original: kuto bhagavaṃ / gaṇanāṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: kutas bhagavan gaṇanām kariṣyāmi
translated: Blessed One, from where will I make the calculation:

original: ime sāsravā dharmā ime anāsravā dharmā ime sādhāraṇā dharmā ime asādhāraṇā dharmā ime śrāvakadharmā ime pratyekabuddhadharmā ime bodhisattvadharmā
analyzed: ime sa āsravāḥ dharmāḥ ime anāsravāḥ dharmāḥ ime sādhāraṇāḥ dharmāḥ ime asādhāraṇāḥ dharmāḥ ime śrāvaka dharmāḥ ime pratyekabuddha dharmāḥ ime bodhisattva dharmāḥ
translated: These are contaminated dharmas, these are uncontaminated dharmas, these are shared dharmas, these are unshared dharmas, these are the dharmas of the śrāvakas, these are the dharmas of the pratyekabuddhas, these are the dharmas of the bodhisattvas,

original: ime buddhadharmā /
analyzed: ime buddha dharmāḥ
translated: these are the dharmas of the Buddhas?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tat kiṃ manyase subhūte anyad ānimittam anye śrāvakadharmāḥ /🔽āha / no hīdaṃ bhagavan /
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte anyat ānimittam anye śrāvaka dharmāḥ  āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: What do you think, Subhūti, are the signless dharmas of the śrāvakas different from the signless?🔽He said: No, Blessed One.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tat kiṃ manyase subhūte anyad ānimittam anye pratyekabuddhadharmāḥ anyad ānimittam anye bodhisattvadharmā anyad ānimittam anye buddhadharmāḥ /
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte anyat ānimittam anye pratyekabuddha dharmāḥ anyat ānimittam anye bodhisattva dharmāḥ anyat ānimittam anye buddha dharmāḥ
translated: What do you think, Subhuti, is the signless something other than the fruits of a Streamwinner, Once-returner, Non-returner, and Arhatship, and the fruit of a Pratyekabuddha, and the attributes of a Buddha?

original: āha / no hīdaṃ bhagavan /
analyzed: āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: He said: No indeed, O Lord.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Lord said:

original: nanu subhūte ānimittam eva srotaāpattiphalaṃ / sakṛdāgāmiphalaṃ / anāgāmiphalam arhattvaṃ / pratyekabodhir bodhisattvadharmā buddhadharmāḥ /
analyzed: nanu subhūte ānimittam eva srotaāpatti phalam sakṛdāgāmi phalam anāgāmi phalam arhat tvam pratyeka bodhiḥ bodhisattva dharmāḥ buddha dharmāḥ
translated: Are not the fruits of a Streamwinner, Once-returner, Non-returner, and Arhatship, and the fruit of a Pratyekabuddha, and the attributes of a Buddha, just the signless?

original: āha / evam etad bhagavan evam etat sugata /
analyzed: āha evam etat bhagavan evam etat sugata
translated: He said: So it is, O Lord, so it is, O Sugata.

original: bhagavān āha /🔽tad anena te subhūte paryāyeṇaivaṃ veditavyam /
analyzed: bhagavān āha  tat anena te subhūte paryāyeṇa evam veditavyam
translated: The Lord said:

original: yaduta ānimittaṃ sarvadharmāḥ / atra hi subhūte śikṣamāṇo bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ ānimitteṣu sarvadharmeṣu vivardhate kuśalair dharmaiḥ /
analyzed: yat uta ānimittam sarva dharmāḥ atra hi subhūte śikṣamāṇaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ ānimitteṣu sarva dharmeṣu vivardhate kuśalaiḥ dharmaiḥ
translated: Therefore, Subhuti, you should know that all dharmas are signless. For here, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who trains in the signless, increases in wholesome dharmas,

original: yaduta ṣaḍbhiḥ pāramitābhiś caturbhir dhyānaiś caturbhir apramāṇaiś catasṛbhir ārūpyasamāpattibhiḥ
analyzed: yat uta ṣaḍbhiḥ pāramitābhiḥ caturbhiḥ dhyānaiḥ caturbhiḥ apramāṇaiḥ catasṛbhiḥ ārūpya samāpattibhiḥ
translated: namely in the six perfections, the four trances, the four Unlimited, the four formless attainments,

original: caturbhiḥ smṛtyupasthānaiś caturbhiḥ samyakprahāṇaiś caturbhir ṛddhipādaiḥ pañcabhir
analyzed: caturbhiḥ smṛti upasthānaiḥ caturbhiḥ samyakprahāṇaiḥ caturbhiḥ ṛddhipādaiḥ pañcabhiḥ
translated: with the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power, the five faculties,

original: indriyai / pañcabhir balaiḥ / ṣaḍbhir anusmṛtibhiḥ / saptabhir bodhyaṅgair / āryāṣṭāṅgena mārgeṇa /
analyzed: indriyaiḥ pañcabhiḥ balaiḥ ṣaḍbhiḥ anusmṛtibhiḥ saptabhiḥ bodhyaṅgaiḥ ārya aṣṭāṅgena mārgeṇa
translated: the five powers, the six recollections, the seven factors of awakening, the noble eightfold path,

original: yāvat sarvabuddhadharmaiḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: yāvat sarva buddha dharmaiḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: up to all the Buddha-dharmas. Why is that?

original: na hy anyatra śikṣitavyaṃ bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anyatra śūnyatā ānimitta apraṇihiteṣu dharmeṣu śikṣitavyaṃ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na hi anyatra śikṣitavyam bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anyatra śūnyatā apraṇihiteṣu dharmeṣu śikṣitavyam tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because the Bodhisattva-Mahāsattva should not train anywhere else, but should train in the dharmas of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness. Why is that?

original: atra hi triṣu vimokṣamukheṣu sarvakuśaladharmā antargatāḥ / tathā hi svalakṣaṇaśūnyaṃ🔽śūnyatāvimokṣamukhaṃ / nimittāpagama ānimittaṃ vimokṣamukhaṃ / anabhisaṃskāram apraṇihitaṃ
analyzed: atra hi triṣu vimokṣa mukheṣu sarva kuśala dharmāḥ antargatāḥ tathā hi sva lakṣaṇa śūnyam  śūnyatā vimokṣa mukham nimitta apagamaḥ ānimittam vimokṣa mukham an abhisaṃskāram a praṇihitam
translated: Because all wholesome dharmas are included in these three gates of liberation. Thus, emptiness

original: vimokṣamukhaṃ / AdSPG II
analyzed: vimokṣa mukha
translated: is the gate of liberation of the emptiness of intrinsic characteristics. The absence of signs is the gate of liberation of the absence of signs. The absence of wishes is the gate of liberation of the absence of wishes.

original: sa iha tṛṣu vimokṣamukheṣu śikṣamāṇo bodhisattvo mahāsattva pañcasu skandheṣu śikṣate /
analyzed: saḥ iha vimokṣa mukheṣu śikṣamāṇaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva pañcasu skandheṣu śikṣate
translated: The Bodhisattva-Mahāsattva who trains in these three gates of liberation trains in the five aggregates.

original: dvādaśasv āyataneṣu śikṣate / aṣṭādaśasu dhātuṣu śikṣate / caturṣv āryasatyeṣu śikṣate /
analyzed: dvādaśasu āyataneṣu śikṣate aṣṭādaśasu dhātuṣu śikṣate caturṣu ārya satyeṣu śikṣate
translated: He trains in the twelve sense fields, he trains in the eighteen elements, he trains in the four noble truths.

original: dvādaśāṃgike pratītyasamutpāde śikṣate / adhyātmaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate / bahirddhāsūnyatāyāṃ
analyzed: dvādaśa āṃgike pratītyasamutpāde śikṣate adhyātma śūnyatāyām śikṣate bahirddhā sūnyatāyām
translated: He trains in the twelve-limbed dependent origination, he trains in internal emptiness,🔽he trains in external emptiness,

original: śikṣate / adhyātmabahirddhāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate / yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate /
analyzed: śikṣate adhyātma bahirddhā śūnyatāyām śikṣate yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyām śikṣate
translated: he trains in the emptiness of both internal and external, up to he trains in the emptiness of own-being.

original: evaṃ yāvat ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu śikṣate / caturṣu smṛtyupasthāneṣu śikṣate / yāvad āryāṣṭāṃge
analyzed: evam yāvat ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu śikṣate caturṣu smṛti upasthāneṣu śikṣate yāvat ārya aṣṭāṃge
translated: Thus, up to he trains in the six perfections, he trains in the four establishments of mindfulness, up to

original: mārge śikṣate / daśasu tathāgatabaleṣu śikṣate / caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu catasṛṣu pratisaṃvitsu
analyzed: mārge śikṣate daśasu tathāgata baleṣu śikṣate caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu catasṛṣu pratisaṃvitsu
translated: he trains in the noble eightfold path, he trains in the ten powers of the Tathāgata, in the four confidences, in the four unhindered knowledges,

original: mahāmaitryāṃ mahākaruṇāyām aṣṭādaśasv āveṇikeṣu buddhadharmeṣu śikṣate /
analyzed: mahā maitryām mahā karuṇāyām aṣṭādaśasu āveṇikeṣu buddha dharmeṣu śikṣate
translated: in great love, in great compassion, in the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, in the thirty-two major marks of a great man, and in the eighty minor characteristics.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: yathā kathaṃ punar bhagavaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran pañcasu upādānaskandheṣu śikṣate /
analyzed: yathā katham punar bhagavam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran pañcasu upādāna skandheṣu śikṣate
translated: In what way, Blessed One, does a bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom train in the five aggregates subject to clinging?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: iha subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran rūpaṃ prajānāti / yathā ca rūpam utpadyate / yathā rūpaṃ nirudhyate / yathā rūpasya
analyzed: iha subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran rūpam prajānāti yathā ca rūpam utpadyate yathā rūpam nirudhyate yathā rūpasya
translated: Here, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, practicing the perfection of wisdom, knows form, how form arises, how form ceases, how the suchness of form is.

original: tathatā / kathaṃ rūpaṃ prajānāti iti /
analyzed: tathatā katham rūpam prajānāti iti
translated: How does he know form?

original: atyantacchidrataś ca atyantasuṣirataś ca / tadyathāpi nāma phenapiṇḍa asārakaḥ evaṃ rūpaṃ prajānāti / kathaṃ ca f / rūpasya utpādaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: atyanta chidrataḥ ca atyanta suṣirataḥ ca tat yathā api nāma phena piṇḍaḥ asārakaḥ evam rūpam prajānāti katham ca rūpasya utpādam prajānāti
translated: As utterly hollow and utterly insubstantial. Just as a lump of foam has no substance, so does he know form. How does he know the arising of form?

original: na rūpaṃ kutaścid āgacchati nāpi rūpaṃ kvacid gacchati ity akutaścid āgamanataś ca akvacid gamanataś ca rūpasya utpādaṃ prajānāti / yan na kutaścid
analyzed: na rūpam kutaścid āgacchati na api rūpam kvacid gacchati iti a kutaścid āgamanataḥ ca a kvacid gamanataḥ ca rūpasya utpādam prajānāti yat na kutaścid
translated: Form does not come from anywhere, nor does form go anywhere. Thus he knows the arising of form as not coming from anywhere and not going anywhere. What does not come from anywhere

original: āgataṃ na kvacid gataṃ /
analyzed: āgatam na kvacid gatam
translated: and does not go anywhere,

original: evaṃ hi subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattva rūpasya utpādavyayaṃ prajānāti / kathaṃ ca rūpasya tathatāṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: evam hi subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva rūpasya utpāda vyayam prajānāti katham ca rūpasya tathatām prajānāti
translated: Thus, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, knows the arising and ceasing of form. How does he know the suchness of form?

original: na tathatā utpadyate vā nirudhyate vā na āgacchati na gacchati / na saṃkliṣyate na
analyzed: na tathatā utpadyate vā nirudhyate vā na āgacchati na gacchati na saṃkliṣyate na
translated: The suchness does not arise or cease, does not come or go, is not defiled or purified,

original: vyavadāyate / ni hīyate na vardhate / evaṃ tathatāṃ prajānāti / avitathatā subhūte tathatā
analyzed: vyavadāyate ni hīyate na vardhate evam tathatām prajānāti avitatha tā subhūte tathatā
translated: It is not diminished and it does not increase. Thus he knows suchness. Suchness, Subhūti, is not otherwise.

original: tasmāt tathatāity ucyate / na sā vitatathā tena tathātety ucyate / evaṃ rūpasya tathatāṃ
analyzed: tasmāt tathatā iti ucyate na sā vitatathā tena tathātā iti ucyate evam rūpasya tathatām
translated: Therefore it is called suchness. It is not otherwise than that, therefore it is called suchness. Thus he knows the suchness of form.

original: prajānāti / kathaṃ ca vedanāṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: prajānāti katham ca vedanām prajānāti
translated: And how does he know feeling?

original: kathaṃ vedanāyā utpādaṃ kathaṃ vedanāyā vyayaṃ kathaṃ vedanāyāṃs tathatāṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: katham vedanāyāḥ utpādam katham vedanāyāḥ vyayam katham vedanāyāḥ tathatām prajānāti
translated: How does he know the arising of feeling? How does he know the cessation of feeling? How does he know the suchness of feeling?

original: tadyathāpi nāma udakabudbudā riktakā utpadyante ca nirudhyante ca / evaṃ vedanāṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma udaka budbudāḥ riktakāḥ utpadyante ca nirudhyante ca evam vedanām prajānāti
translated: Just as water bubbles arise and cease being empty, thus he knows feeling.

original: na kutaścid āgacchati na kvacid gacchati / evaṃ vedanāyā utpādavyayaṃ prajānāti / kathaṃ
analyzed: na kutaścid āgacchati na kvacid gacchati evam vedanāyāḥ utpāda vyayam prajānāti katham
translated: It does not come from anywhere and does not go anywhere. Thus he knows the arising and cessation of feeling. How then

original: ca vedanāyās tathatāṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: ca vedanāyāḥ tathatām prajānāti
translated: does he know the suchness of feeling?

original: avitathatātathatā / evaṃ vedanāyāṃs tathatāṃ prajānāti / kathaṃ ca saṃjñāṃ prajānāti / tadyathā AdSPG II
analyzed: avitathatā atathatāḥ evam vedanāyān tathatām prajānāti katham ca saṃjñām prajānāti tat yathā
translated: The suchness of non-otherwise-ness. Thus he knows the suchness of feeling. And how does he know perception? Just as

original: marīcikāyām udakam atyantatayā nopalabhyate / evaṃ saṃjñāṃ prajānāti / na kutaścid
analyzed: marīcikāyām udakam atyanta tayā na upalabhyate evam saṃjñām prajānāti na kutaścid
translated: in a mirage water is not found at all, thus he knows perception. It does not come from anywhere and does not go anywhere.

original: āgacchati na kvacid gacchati / evaṃ saṃjñāyā utpādavyayaṃ prajānāti / kathaṃ ca saṃjñātathatāṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: āgacchati na kvacid gacchati evam saṃjñāyāḥ utpāda vyayam prajānāti katham ca saṃjñā tathatām prajānāti
translated: It does not come from anywhere, and does not go anywhere. Thus he knows the arising and passing away of perception. How does he know the suchness of perception?

original: yathaiva vedanātathatā evaṃ saṃjñātathatāṃ prajānāti / kathaṃ saṃskārān prajānāti🔽tadyathāpi nāma kadalyāḥ sāram asāratayā patra patraṃ kṛtvā nopalabhyate evaṃ saṃskārān
analyzed: yathā eva vedanā tathatā evam saṃjñā tathatām prajānāti katham saṃskārān prajānāti  tat yathā api nāma kadalyāḥ sāram a sāra tayā patra patram kṛtvā na upalabhyate evam saṃskārān
translated: Just as he knows the suchness of feeling, so he knows the suchness of perception. How does he know volitional formations?

original: prajānāti / kathaṃ saṃskārāṇām utpādavyayaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: prajānāti katham saṃskārāṇām utpāda vyayam prajānāti
translated: Just as the pith of a plantain tree is not found when the leaves are removed, so he knows volitional formations. How does he know the arising and passing away of volitional formations?

original: akutaścid āgamanatayā akvacid gamanatayā saṃskārāṇām utpādavyayaṃ prajānāti / kathaṃ ca saṃskārāṇāṃ tathatāṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: akutaścid āgamana tayā a kvacid gamana tayā saṃskārāṇām utpāda vyayam prajānāti katham ca saṃskārāṇām tathatām prajānāti
translated: He knows the arising and passing away of volitional formations as not coming from anywhere and not going anywhere. How does he know the suchness of volitional formations?

original: vedanātathatayā saṃskāratathatāṃ prajānāti / kathaṃ vijñānaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: vedanā tathatayā saṃskāra tathatām prajānāti katham vijñānam prajānāti
translated: He knows the suchness of volitional formations as the suchness of feeling. How does he know consciousness?

original: tadyathāpi nāma māyākāranirmitaś caturaṅgo balakāya / evaṃ vijñānaṃ prajānāti / na
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma māyākāra nirmitaḥ catur aṅgaḥ balakāyaḥ evam vijñānam prajānāti na
translated: Just as a magician's creation of a four-divisioned army, so he knows consciousness.🔽It does not come from anywhere, and does not go anywhere. Thus he knows the arising and passing away of

original: kutaścid āgacchati na kvacid gacchati / evaṃ vijñānasya utpādavyayaṃ prajānāti / kathaṃ
analyzed: kutaścid āgacchati na kvacid gacchati evam vijñānasya utpāda vyayam prajānāti katham
translated: consciousness.

original: vijñānasya tathatāṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: vijñānasya tathatām prajānāti
translated: He knows the suchness of consciousness.

original: vedanātathatayā vijñānatathatāṃ prajānāti / kathaṃ ca dhātūn prajānāti /
analyzed: vedanā tathatayā vijñāna tathatām prajānāti katham ca dhātūn prajānāti
translated: He knows the suchness of consciousness through the suchness of feeling. How does he know the elements?

original: cakṣurdhātuś cakṣurdhātusvabhāvena śūnyaṃ / rūpadhātur rūpadhātusvabhāvena śūnyaṃ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ dhātuḥ cakṣuḥ dhātu svabhāvena śūnyam rūpa dhātuḥ rūpa dhātu svabhāvena śūnyam
translated: The eye element is empty of the nature of the eye element. The form element is empty of the nature of the form element.

original: cakṣuvijñānadhātuś cakṣuvijñānadhātusvabhāvena śūnyaṃ / evaṃ yāvan manodhātur dharmadhātur
analyzed: cakṣu vijñāna dhātuḥ cakṣu vijñāna dhātu svabhāvena śūnyam evam yāvat manaḥ dhātuḥ dharmadhātuḥ
translated: The eye consciousness element is empty of the nature of the eye consciousness element. Thus up to the mind element, the dharma element,

original: manovijñānadhātuḥ kartavyaḥ / kathaṃ ca āyatanāni prajānāti /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñāna dhātuḥ kartavyaḥ katham ca āyatanāni prajānāti
translated: and the mind consciousness element should be done. How does he know the sense bases?

original: ādhyātmikā dharmā ādhyātmikair dharmai śūnyāḥ /
analyzed: ādhyātmikāḥ dharmāḥ ādhyātmikaiḥ dharmaiḥ śūnyāḥ
translated: Internal phenomena are empty of internal phenomena.

original: bāhyā dharmāḥ bāhyair dharmaiḥ śūnyāḥ / evam āyatanāni prajānāti / kathaṃ ca āryasatyaṃ
analyzed: bāhyāḥ dharmāḥ bāhyaiḥ dharmaiḥ śūnyāḥ evam āyatanāni prajānāti katham ca ārya satyam
translated: External phenomena are empty of external phenomena. Thus he knows the sense bases. How does he know the noble truths?

original: prajānāti duḥkhaṃ prajānāti / satyaṃ prajānāti / āryasatyaṃ prajānāti / dvayatāvinirmuktam
analyzed: prajānāti duḥkham prajānāti satyam prajānāti ārya satyam prajānāti dvaya tā vinirmuktam
translated: He knows suffering. He knows the truth. He knows the noble truth. He knows the noble truth as being free from duality.

original: āryasatyam advayaṃ hi āryāṇāṃ satyam iti prajānāti / evaṃ samudayaṃ nirodhaṃ nirodhagāminīpratipadam
analyzed: ārya satyam advayam hi āryāṇām satyam iti prajānāti evam samudayam nirodham nirodha gāminī pratipadam
translated: The noble truth is non-dual. He knows that the truth of the noble ones is the truth of the noble ones. Thus he knows origination, cessation, and the path leading to cessation.

original: āryasatyaṃ prajānāti / kathaṃ duḥkhatathatāṃ prajānāti /🔽tathat /
analyzed: ārya satyam prajānāti katham duḥkha tathatām prajānāti  tathat
translated: He knows the suchness of suffering.

original: aiva duḥkhasya tathateti prajānāti / evaṃ samudayasya nirodhasya mārgasya / tathatāṃ prajānāti / kathaṃ ca pratītyasamutpādaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: ā eva duḥkhasya tathatā iti prajānāti evam samudayasya nirodhasya mārgasya tathatām prajānāti katham ca pratītyasamutpādam prajānāti
translated: He knows the suchness of suffering as it really is. Thus he knows the suchness of origination, cessation, and the path. How does he know dependent origination?

original: anutpādato pratītyasamutpādaṃ prajānāti / evam anirodhato 'nucchedato 'śāśvatato 'nekārthato
analyzed: anutpādataḥ pratītyasamutpādam prajānāti evam a nirodhataḥ śāśvatataḥ na ekārthataḥ
translated: He knows dependent origination as non-arising. Thus he knows dependent origination as non-cessation, non-annihilation, non-eternity, not one meaning,

original: 'nānārthato 'nāgamato na nirgamataḥ prapañcoparamataḥ śivaṃ pratītyasamutpādaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: nānārthataḥ na āgamataḥ na nirgamataḥ prapañca uparamataḥ śivam pratītyasamutpādam prajānāti
translated: not different meanings, not coming, not going, the cessation of mental proliferation, and peace.

original: evaṃ pratītyasamutpādaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: evam pratītyasamutpādam prajānāti
translated: Thus he knows dependent origination.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One:

original: yadi bhagavaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann ime parasparabhinnān AdSPG II
analyzed: yadi bhagavam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran ime paraspara bhinnān
translated: Blessed One, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom knows these mutually distinct phenomena,

original: dharmān evaṃ prajānāti / nanu bhagavan dharmadhātur vikopito bhavati /
analyzed: dharmān evam prajānāti nanu bhagavan dharmadhātuḥ vikopitaḥ bhavati
translated: Blessed One, is not the dharma-realm divided?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: vikopita subhūte syād yadi dharmadhāturvinirmuktaḥ anyaḥ /
analyzed: vikopita subhūte syāt yadi dharmadhātuḥ vinirmuktaḥ anyaḥ
translated: Subhūti, if there were any dharma whatsoever apart from the dharma-constituent,

original: kaścid dharmaḥ syād / na subhūte dharmadhātuvinirmukto 'nyaḥ kaścid dharma upalabhyate / yady upalabhyeta syād dharmadhātor vikopanā / tat kasya
analyzed: kaścid dharmaḥ syāt na subhūte dharmadhātu vinirmuktaḥ nyaḥ kaścid dharmaḥ upalabhyate yadi upalabhyeta syāt dharmadhātoḥ vikopanā tat kasya
translated: then, Subhūti, the dharma-constituent would be disturbed. But, Subhūti, no dharma whatsoever apart from the dharma-constituent is apprehended. If it were apprehended, then the dharma-constituent would be disturbed. Why is it so?

original: na hi subhūte tathāgatena vā bodhisattvena vā / pratyekabuddhena vā tathāgataśrāvakeṇa🔽vā dharma f / dhāturvinirmukto 'nyaḥ kaścid dharma upalabdhaḥ / anupalabhya
analyzed: na hi subhūte tathāgatena vā bodhisattvena vā pratyekabuddhena vā tathāgata śrāvakeṇa  vā dharma dhātuḥ vinirmuktaḥ nyaḥ kaścid dharmaḥ upalabdhaḥ an upalabhya
translated: Subhūti, no dharma whatsoever apart from the dharma-constituent is apprehended by a Tathāgata, or a Bodhisattva, or a Pratyekabuddha, or a Tathāgata's śrāvaka. Not apprehending🔽any dharma whatsoever apart from the dharma-constituent, he does not designate

original: na prajñapayati / dharmadhāturvinirmukto 'nyaḥ kaścid dharma upalabhyata iti / evaṃ
analyzed: na prajñapayati dharmadhātuḥ vinirmuktaḥ nyaḥ kaścid dharmaḥ upalabhyate iti evam
translated: any dharma whatsoever apart from the dharma-constituent as apprehended. Thus,

original: khalu subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caratā dharmadhātau śikṣitavyaṃ /
analyzed: khalu subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām caratā dharmadhātau śikṣitavyam
translated: Subhūti, a Bodhisattva, a great being, practicing the perfection of wisdom should train in the dharma-constituent.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: dharmadhātau bhagavaṃc chikṣamāṇena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena kvacic chikṣitaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: dharmadhātau bhagavan śikṣamāṇena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena kvacid śikṣitam bhavati
translated: Blessed One, when a Bodhisattva, a great being, trains in the dharma-constituent, in what does he train?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: dharmadhātau subhūte śikṣamāṇena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sarvadharmeṣu śikṣitaṃ bhavati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: dharmadhātau subhūte śikṣamāṇena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sarva dharmeṣu śikṣitam bhavati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains in the dharma-realm trains in all dharmas. Why is that?

original: tathā hi subhūte sarvadharmā dharmadhātuḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi subhūte sarva dharmāḥ dharmadhātuḥ
translated: Subhūti, it is because all dharmas are the dharma-realm.

original: āha / kena kāraṇena bhagavaṃ sarvadharmā dharmadhātuḥ /
analyzed: āha kena kāraṇena bhagavam sarva dharmāḥ dharmadhātuḥ
translated: He said, For what reason, Blessed One, are all dharmas the dharma-realm?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tathā hi subhūte utpādād vā tathāgatānām anutpādād vā tathāgatānāṃ sthita eva dharmāṇāṃ
analyzed: tathā hi subhūte utpādāt vā tathāgatānām anutpādāt vā tathāgatānām sthitaḥ eva dharmāṇām
translated: Subhūti, it is because whether Tathāgatas arise or whether Tathāgatas do not arise, the dharmas remain

original: dharmadhātur abhedayogena / yaduta saṃskṛtadhātur asaṃskṛtadhātur ca dharmadhātuḥ /
analyzed: dharmadhātuḥ abheda yogena yat uta saṃskṛta dhātuḥ a saṃskṛta dhātuḥ ca dharmadhātuḥ
translated: in the dharma-realm, abiding in the state of non-differentiation, namely, the constructed realm and the unconstructed realm are the dharma-realm.

original: evaṃ yāvat sarvadharmeṣu kartavyaṃ / evaṃ khalu subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena
analyzed: evam yāvat sarva dharmeṣu kartavyam evam khalu subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena
translated: This should be done in the same way up to all dharmas. Thus, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣamāṇena dharmadhātau śikṣitaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣamāṇena dharmadhātau śikṣitam bhavati
translated: who trains in the perfection of wisdom trains in the dharma-realm.

original: āha / yadi bhagavan sarvadharmā dharmadhātuḥ /
analyzed: āha yadi bhagavan sarva dharmāḥ dharmadhātuḥ
translated: He said, If, Blessed One, all dharmas are the dharma-realm,

original: kathaṃ punar bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitavyaṃ /
analyzed: katham punar bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: how then should a bodhisattva mahāsattva train in the perfection of wisdom?

original: samādhipāramitāyāṃ vīryapāramitāyāṃ kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ śīlapāramitāyāṃ dānapāramitāyāṃ śikṣitavyaṃ /
analyzed: samādhi pāramitāyām vīrya pāramitāyām kṣānti pāramitāyām śīla pāramitāyām dāna pāramitāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: One should train in the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity.

original: kathaṃ bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prathame dhyāne śikṣitavyaṃ /
analyzed: katham bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prathame dhyāne śikṣitavyam
translated: How should a bodhisattva mahāsattva train in the first concentration?

original: kathaṃ dvitīye tritīye caturthe dhyāne śikṣitavyaṃ /
analyzed: katham dvitīye tritīye caturthe dhyāne śikṣitavyam
translated: How should they train in the second, third, and fourth concentrations?

original: kathaṃ maitryāṃ karuṇāyāṃ muditāyām upekṣāyām ākāśānanyāyatane yāvan naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñāyatane śikṣitavyaṃ /
analyzed: katham maitryām karuṇāyām muditāyām upekṣāyām ākāśa an anya āyatane yāvat na eva saṃjñā na asaṃjñā āyatane śikṣitavyam
translated: How should they train in loving-kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity, in the sphere of infinite space, up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception?

original: kathaṃ caturṣu smṛtyupasthāneṣu yāvad āryāṣṭāṅge mārge śikṣitavyaṃ / kathaṃ AdSPG II
analyzed: katham caturṣu smṛti upasthāneṣu yāvat ārya aṣṭāṅge mārge śikṣitavyam katham
translated: How should they train in the four establishments of mindfulness, up to the noble eightfold path? How should they train in the four formless absorptions?

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihiteṣu śikṣitavyaṃ /🔽katham aṣṭādaśasu vimokṣeṣu navasv anupūrvasamāpattiṣu śikṣitavyaṃ /🔽kathaṃ daśasu tathāgatabaleṣu caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu catasṛṣu pratisaṃvitsu mahāmaitryāṃ mahākaruṇāyāṃ mahāmuditāyāṃ mahopekṣāyām aṣṭādaśasv
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihiteṣu śikṣitavyam  katham aṣṭādaśasu vimokṣeṣu navasu anupūrva samāpattiṣu śikṣitavyam  katham daśasu tathāgata baleṣu caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu catasṛṣu pratisaṃvitsu mahā maitryām mahā karuṇāyām mahā muditāyām mahā upekṣāyām aṣṭādaśasu
translated: How should they train in the emptiness, signless, and wishless [gates to liberation]?🔽How should they train in the eighteen distinctive abilities of a buddha, the ten powers of a tathāgata, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of unhindered knowledge, great loving-kindness, great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha?

original: āveṇikeṣu buddhadharmeṣu śikṣitavyaṃ /
analyzed: āveṇikeṣu buddha dharmeṣu śikṣitavyam
translated: How should they train in the four formless absorptions?

original: kathaṃ pañcābhijñāsu śikṣitavyaṃ /
analyzed: katham pañca abhijñāsu śikṣitavyam
translated: How should one train in the five higher knowledges?

original: kathaṃ dvātṛṃśadmahāpuruṣalakṣaṇapariniṣpattau śikṣitavyaṃ /
analyzed: katham dvātṛṃśat mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇa pariniṣpattau śikṣitavyam
translated: How should one train in perfecting the thirty-two marks of a great man?

original: katham aśīty anuvyañjanapariniṣpattau śikṣitavyaṃ /
analyzed: katham aśi iti anuvyañjana pariniṣpattau śikṣitavyam
translated: How should one train in perfecting the eighty minor marks?

original: kathaṃ kṣatriyamahāsālakulopapattau brāhmaṇamahāsālakulopapattau gṛhapatimahāsālakulopapattau śikṣitavyaṃ /
analyzed: katham kṣatriya mahā sāla kula upapattau brāhmaṇa mahā sāla kula upapattau gṛhapati mahā sāla kula upapattau śikṣitavyam
translated: How should one train in being reborn in a great kṣatriya family, in being reborn in a great brahmin family, in being reborn in a great householder family?

original: kathaṃ cāturmahārājakāyikānāṃ devānām upapattau trāyastriṃśānāṃ yāmānāṃ tuṣitānāṃ
analyzed: katham cāturmahārājakāyikānām devānām upapattau trāyastriṃśānām yāmānām tuṣitānām
translated: How should one train in being reborn as a god in the realm of the Four Great Kings, in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, in the Yāma Heaven,

original: nirmāṇaratīnāṃ paranirmitavaśavartināṃ brahmakāyikānām ābhāsvarāṇāṃ śubhakṛtsnānāṃ
analyzed: nirmāṇaratīnām paranirmitavaśavartinām brahmakāyikānām ābhāsvarāṇām śubhakṛtsnānām
translated: in the Tuṣita Heaven, in the Heaven of Delight in Creation, in the Heaven of Free Enjoyment of Manifestations by Others, in the Brahmā realm, in the Luminous Heaven, in the Heaven of Perfect Virtue,

original: vṛhaṇāṃ parīttavṛhanāṃ vṛhatphalānāṃ devānām upapattau śikṣitavyaṃ /
analyzed: vṛhaṇām parītta vṛhanām vṛhatphalānām devānām upapattau śikṣitavyam

translated: And they praise those who do so, welcoming them.🔽And they themselves cultivate wisdom, and they encourage others to cultivate wisdom,

original: samādāpayati prajñāyāś ca varṇaṃ bhāṣate / ye 'py anye prajñāṃ bhāvayanti / teṣāṃ ca varṇavādī bhavati /🔽samanujñaḥ /🔽VIII / ātmanā ca daśakuśalān karmapathān samādāya vartante paraṃ ca daśasu kuśaleṣu
analyzed: samādāpayati prajñāyāḥ ca varṇam bhāṣate ye pi anye prajñām bhāvayanti teṣām ca varṇa vādī bhavati  samanujñaḥ  ātmanā ca daśa kuśalān karma pathān samādāya vartante param ca daśasu kuśaleṣu
translated: and they praise wisdom. They praise those who cultivate wisdom, welcoming them.🔽And they themselves undertake and follow the ten wholesome courses of action, and they encourage others to undertake the ten wholesome courses of action,

original: karmapatheṣu samādāpayati / daśānāṃ ca kuśalānāṃ karmapatḥ ānāṃ ca varṇaṃ bhāṣate /
analyzed: karma patheṣu samādāpayati daśānām ca kuśalānām karma patḥ ca varṇam bhāṣate
translated: and they praise the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: ye 'py anye AdSPG II
analyzed: ye pi anye adspg ii
translated: And they praise those other beings

original: sattvā daśakuśalān karmapathān samādāya vartante teṣāṃ ca varṇavādī bhavati samanujñaḥ /🔽ātmanā ca aṣṭāṅgasamanvāgataṃ poṣadham upavasanti / paraṃ ca aṣṭāṅgasamanvāgate poṣadhe samādāpayati /
analyzed: sattvāḥ daśa kuśalān karma pathān samādāya vartante teṣām ca varṇa vādī bhavati samanujñaḥ  ātmanā ca aṣṭāṅga samanvāgatam poṣadham upavasanti param ca aṣṭāṅga samanvāgate poṣadhe samādāpayati
translated: who undertake and follow the ten wholesome courses of action, welcoming them.🔽And they themselves observe the poṣadha endowed with the eight parts, and they encourage others to observe the poṣadha endowed with the eight parts,

original: aṣṭāṅgasamanvāgatasya ca poṣadhasya varṇaṃ bhāṣate / ye ca anye sattvā aṣṭāṅgasamamanvāgataṃ
analyzed: aṣṭa aṅga samanvāgatasya ca poṣadhasya varṇam bhāṣate ye ca anye sattvāḥ aṣṭa aṅga samam anvāgatam
translated: and they praise the poṣadha endowed with the eight parts. And they praise those other beings🔽who observe the poṣadha endowed with the eight parts,

original: poṣadham upavasanti / teṣāṃ ca varṇavādī bhavati samanujñaḥ / ātamanā ca pañcaśikṣāpadāni
analyzed: poṣadham upavasanti teṣām ca varṇa vādī bhavati samanujñaḥ ātamanā ca pañca śikṣā padāni
translated: They observe the poṣadha. And they are a speaker of praise and an approver of those who observe the poṣadha. They themselves take up and follow the five precepts of training.

original: samādāya vartante / paraṃ ca pañcasu śikṣāpadeṣu samādāpayanti / pañcānāṃ ca śikṣāpadānāṃ🔽varṇaṃ bhāṣate / ye ca anye sattvā pañcaśikṣāpadāni samādāya vartante teṣāṃca varṇavādī
analyzed: samādāya vartante param ca pañcasu śikṣā padeṣu samādāpayanti pañcānām ca śikṣā padānām  varṇam bhāṣate ye ca anye sattvāḥ pañca śikṣā padāni samādāya vartante teṣām ca varṇa vādī
translated: And they cause others to take up the five precepts of training. And they speak in praise of the five precepts of training.

original: bhavati samanujñaḥ / evam ātmanā ca prathamaṃ dhyānaṃ samāpadyate yāva caturthaṃ maitrīṃ
analyzed: bhavati samanujñaḥ evam ātmanā ca prathamam dhyānam samāpadyate yāva caturtham maitrīm
translated: And they are a speaker of praise and an approver of those other beings who take up and follow the five precepts of training. In the same way, they themselves attain the first meditation, up to the fourth meditation, loving-kindness,

original: karuṇāṃ muditāṃ upekṣām ākāśānantyāyatanasamāpattiṃ yāvan naivasaṃjñanāsaṃjñāyatanasamāpattiṃ /
analyzed: karuṇām muditām upekṣām ākāśa ānantya āyatana samāpattim yāvat na eva saṃjña na asaṃjñā āyatana samāpattim
translated: compassion, joy, equanimity, the attainment of the sphere of infinite space, up to the attainment of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: ātmanā ca smṛtyupasthānāni bhāvayati / yāvad āryāṣṭāṃgaṃ mārgaṃ trīṇi vimokṣamukhāni
analyzed: ātmanā ca smṛti upasthānāni bhāvayati yāvat ārya aṣṭāṃgam mārgam trīṇi vimokṣa mukhāni
translated: They themselves cultivate the establishments of mindfulness, up to the noble eightfold path, the three doors to liberation,

original: aṣṭau vimokṣān navānupūrvasamāpattīr daśatathāgatabalāni / catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ
analyzed: aṣṭau vimokṣān nava anupūrva samāpattīḥ daśa tathāgata balāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ
translated: the eight liberations, the nine successive abodes, the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four confidences, the four kinds of🔽fearlessness,

original: pratisaṃvido mahāmaitrīṃ mahākaruṇām aṣṭādaśāveṇikān buddhadharmān aśītim anuvyañjanāni
analyzed: pratisaṃvidaḥ mahā maitrīm mahā karuṇām aṣṭādaśa āveṇikān buddha dharmān aśītim anuvyañjanāni
translated: He cultivates the analytical knowledges, great love, great compassion, the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, and the eighty minor marks,

original: bhāvayati / paraṃ ca aśītyām anuvyañjaneṣu samādāpayati / aśītir anuvyañjanānāṃ varṇaṃ
analyzed: bhāvayati param ca aśītyām anuvyañjaneṣu samādāpayati aśītiḥ anuvyañjanānām varṇam
translated: and he encourages others to take up the eighty minor marks. He speaks in praise of the eighty minor marks,

original: bhāṣate ye 'py anye sattvā aśītim anuvyañjanāni bhāvayanti / teṣāṃ ca varṇavādī bhavati samanujñaḥ /
analyzed: bhāṣate ye pi anye sattvāḥ aśītim anuvyañjanāni bhāvayanti teṣām ca varṇa vādī bhavati samanujñaḥ
translated: and he is a supporter and an encourager of other beings who cultivate the eighty minor marks.

original: VIII / yadi subhūte dharmadhātur yathā pūrvaṃ tathā paścāt tathā madhye nābhaviṣyat /
analyzed: yadi subhūte dharmadhātuḥ yathā pūrvam tathā paścāt tathā madhye na abhaviṣyat
translated: Subhūti, if the dharma-constituent were not to exist as it does in the beginning, as it does in the end, and as it does in the middle,

original: na bodhisattvo mahāsattva upāyakauśalena sattvānāṃ dharmadhātuṃ sūcayati / sattvāṃś
analyzed: na bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ upāya kauśalena sattvānām dharmadhātum sūcayati sattvān
translated: then the bodhisattva great being would not, through skillful means, point out the dharma-constituent to beings,

original: ca paripācayiṣyati / yasmāt tarhi subhūte dharmadhātur yathā pūrvaṃ tathā paścāt tathā madhye /
analyzed: ca paripācayiṣyati yasmāt tarhi subhūte dharmadhātuḥ yathā pūrvam tathā paścāt tathā madhye
translated: and would not bring beings to maturity. But because, Subhūti, the dharma-constituent does exist as it does in the beginning, as it does in the end, and as it does in the middle,🔽therefore the bodhisattva great being, practicing the perfection of wisdom through skillful means, points out the dharma-constituent to beings, and for the sake of beings,

original: tasmād bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann upāyakauśalena sattvānāṃ dharmadhātuṃ sūcayati / sattvānām arthāya bodhisattvacārikāṃ
analyzed: tasmāt bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran upāya kauśalena sattvānām dharmadhātum sūcayati sattvānām arthāya bodhisattva cārikām
translated: practices the bodhisattva practice,

original: carati / sattvāṃś ca paripācayati /
analyzed: carati sattvān ca paripācayati
translated: and matures beings.

original: sarvadharmasamatānirdeśaparivarttaḥ / // //
analyzed: sarva dharma samatā nirdeśa parivarttaḥ
translated: The chapter on the teaching of the equality of all dharmas.

original: parivarta / akopyanirdeśa
analyzed: parivarta
translated: The chapter on the teaching of non-anger.

original: athāyuṣmān subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Subhuti said this to the Blessed One:

original: yadi bhagavann atyantatayā sattvo nopalabhyate /
analyzed: yadi bhagavan atyanta tayā sattvaḥ na upalabhyate
translated: Blessed One, if a being is not apprehended at all,

original: na sattvaprajñaptiḥ /
analyzed: na sattva prajñaptiḥ
translated: and there is no designation of a being,

original: kasya arthāya bodhisattvo mahāsattva prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvayati /
analyzed: kasya arthāya bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva prajñāpāramitām bhāvayati
translated: for whose sake does a bodhisattva great being cultivate the perfection of wisdom?

original: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Venerable Subhuti:

original: bhūtakoṭiṃ subhūte pramāṇīkṛtya bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carati / yadi subhūte anyā bhūtakoṭir bhaved anyā sattvakoṭir AdSPG
analyzed: bhūtakoṭim subhūte pramāṇīkṛtya bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām carati yadi subhūte anyā bhūtakoṭiḥ bhavet anyā sattvakoṭiḥ
translated: Subhuti, taking the peak of reality as the standard, a bodhisattva great being practices the perfection of wisdom. If, Subhuti, the peak of reality were one thing and the peak of beings another,

original: na bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caret / yasmāt tarhi subhūte na anyā bhūtakoṭir anyā sattvakoṭis /
analyzed: na bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caret yasmāt tarhi subhūte na anyā bhūta koṭiḥ anyā sattva koṭiḥ
translated: a bodhisattva great being would not practice the perfection of wisdom. But because, Subhuti, the peak of reality is not one thing and the peak of beings another,

original: tasmād bodhisattvo mahāsattva sattvānām arthe prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carati / prajñāpāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: tasmāt bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva sattvānām arthe prajñāpāramitāyām carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: therefore a bodhisattva great being practices the perfection of wisdom for the sake of beings. In the perfection of wisdom

original: subhūte caran bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhūtakoṭyavikopanatayā sattvān bhūtakoṭyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpayati /
analyzed: subhūte caran bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhūtakoṭi avikopana tayā sattvān bhūtakoṭyām pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: Subhuti, a Bodhisattva, a great being, practicing thus, establishes beings in the reality-limit by not disturbing the reality-limit.

original: āha / yadi bhagavan bhutakoṭiḥ sattvakoṭis /
analyzed: āha yadi bhagavan bhuta koṭiḥ sattva koṭiḥ
translated: He said: If, Blessed One, the reality-limit is the limit of beings,

original: tat kiṃ bhūtakoṭir bhūtakoṭyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpayati /
analyzed: tat kim bhūtakoṭiḥ bhūtakoṭyām pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: then does the reality-limit establish the reality-limit?

original: f / yadi bhagavaṃ bhūtakoṭir bhūtakoṭyāṃ pratitiṣṭhet /
analyzed: yadi bhagavan bhūtakoṭiḥ bhūtakoṭau pratitiṣṭhet
translated: If, Blessed One, the reality-limit were to stand in the reality-limit,

original: tataḥ svabhāvaḥ svabhāve pratitiṣṭhet / na ca bhagavaṃ svabhāva svabhāve pratitiṣṭhati /
analyzed: tatas svabhāvaḥ svabhāve pratitiṣṭhet na ca svabhāva svabhāve pratitiṣṭhati
translated: then an own-being would stand in an own-being, and an own-being, Blessed One, does not stand in an own-being.

original: kathaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattva prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran sattvān bhūtakoṭyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpayati /
analyzed: katham bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva prajñāpāramitāyām caran sattvān bhūtakoṭyām pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: How then, Blessed One, does a Bodhisattva, a great being, practicing the perfection of wisdom, establish beings in the reality-limit?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: na subhūte bhūtakoṭir bhūtakoṭyāṃ pratitiṣṭhate / na svabhāva svabhāve pratitiṣṭhate /
analyzed: na subhūte bhūtakoṭiḥ bhūtakoṭyām pratitiṣṭhate na svabhāva svabhāve pratitiṣṭhate
translated: Subhuti, the reality-limit does not stand in the reality-limit, an own-being does not stand in an own-being.

original: api tu khalu subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann upāyakauśalena
analyzed: api tu khalu subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran upāya kauśalena
translated: But, Subhuti, a Bodhisattva, a great being, practicing the perfection of wisdom, through skillful means

original: sattvakoṭir bhūtakoṭyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpayati / na ca anyā bhūtakoṭir anyā sattvakoṭir /
analyzed: sattva koṭiḥ bhūta koṭyām pratiṣṭhāpayati na ca anyā bhūta koṭiḥ anyā sattva koṭiḥ
translated: establishes the limit of beings in the reality-limit, and the reality-limit is not one thing and the limit of beings another.

original: iti hi sattvakoṭiś ca bhūtakoṭiś ca advayam etad advaidhīkāraṃ /
analyzed: iti hi sattva koṭiḥ ca bhūta koṭiḥ ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Thus, the limit of existence and the limit of beings are non-dual, they are not divided into two.

original: āha / katamad bhagavan bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām upāyakauśalaṃ yena upāyakauśalena
analyzed: āha katamat bhagavan bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām upāya kauśalam yena upāya kauśalena
translated: He said: Blessed One, what is the skillful means of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, endowed with which skillful means

original: samanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattva prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran sattvān bhūtakoṭyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpayati
analyzed: samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva prajñāpāramitāyām caran sattvān bhūtakoṭyām pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing the perfection of wisdom, establishes beings in the limit of existence

original: na ca bhūtakoṭiṃ vikopayati /
analyzed: na ca bhūtakoṭim vikopayati
translated: without disturbing the limit of existence?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: iha subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattva prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran prathamacittotpādam upādāya
analyzed: iha subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva prajñāpāramitāyām caran prathama citta utpādam upādāya
translated: Subhūti, here the bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing the perfection of wisdom, from the time of the first production of the thought of enlightenment

original: sattvān dāne pratiṣṭhāpayati / dāne pratiṣṭhāpya tasya dānasya pūrvāntāparāntamadhyam
analyzed: sattvān dāne pratiṣṭhāpayati dāne pratiṣṭhāpya tasya dānasya pūrva anta apara anta madhyam
translated: establishes beings in generosity. Having established them in generosity, he teaches them the beginning, end, and middle

original: ācaṣṭe / yathaiva tad dānaṃ pūrvāntataḥ śūnyam aparāntataḥ / śūnyaṃ madhayataḥ śūnyaṃ /
analyzed: ācaṣṭe yathā eva tat dānam pūrva antataḥ śūnyam apara antataḥ śūnyam madhayataḥ śūnyam
translated: of that generosity, just as that generosity is empty of the past, empty of the future, and empty of the present.

original: tathaiva dānaphalam api śūnyaṃ / dānapatir api śūnyaḥ / pratigrāhako 'pi śūnyaḥ / evaṃ kulaputrā /
analyzed: tathā eva dāna phalam api śūnyam dānapatiḥ api śūnyaḥ pratigrāhakaḥ śūnyaḥ evam kula putrāḥ
translated: Just so, the result of generosity is also empty, the giver is also empty, and the recipient is also empty. Thus, sons of good family,

original: sarva ete 'rthā bhūtakoṭyāṃ na saṃvidyante / mā ca anyad dānaṃ maṃsyase 'nyad dānaphalaṃ🔽mā ca anyad dānapatiṃ maṃsyase 'nyaṃ pratigrāhakaṃ / yadā tvaṃ kulaputra na anyad
analyzed: sarve ete rthāḥ bhūtakoṭyām na saṃvidyante mā ca anyat dānam maṃsyase nyat dāna phalam  mā ca anyat dānapatim maṃsyase pratigrāhakam yadā tvam kula putra na anyat
translated: All these meanings do not exist in the reality-limit. Do not think of the gift as one thing and the fruit of the gift as another,

original: dānaṃ maṃsyase 'nyad dānaphalaṃ / nānyad AdSPG II
analyzed: dānam maṃsyase dāna phalam na anyat
translated: and do not think of the donor as one thing and the recipient as another. When, son of good family, you do not think of the gift as one thing and the fruit of the gift as another,

original: dānapatiṃ maṃsyase 'nyaṃ pratigrāhakaṃ / tadā tavedaṃ dānam amṛtaṃ bhaviṣyaty amṛtaphalaparyavasānam /
analyzed: dānapatim maṃsyase pratigrāhakam tadā tava idam dānam amṛtam bhaviṣyati amṛta phala paryavasānam
translated: and do not think of the donor as one thing and the recipient as another, then this gift of yours will be immortal, ending in the fruit of immortality.

original: anena ca dānena mā rūpaṃ parigrahīr mā vedanāṃ saṃjñāṃ mā saṃskārān mā vijñānaṃ parigrahī / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: anena ca dānena mā rūpam parigrahīḥ mā vedanām saṃjñām mā saṃskārān mā vijñānam tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: And through this gift, do not grasp form, do not grasp feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness. What is the reason for that?

original: yathā hy etad dānaṃ śūnyaṃ dānena / asya phalaṃ śūnyaṃ phalena / dānapatir api śūnyo dānapatinā / pratigrāhako 'pi śūnya pratigrāhakeṇa /
analyzed: yathā hi etat dānam śūnyam dānena asya phalam śūnyam phalena dānapatiḥ api śūnyaḥ dānapatinā pratigrāhakaḥ u pi śūnya pratigrāhakeṇa
translated: Because this gift is empty of the gift, its fruit is empty of the fruit, the donor is empty of the donor, and the recipient is empty of the recipient.

original: na śūnyatāyāṃ dānam upalabhyate / na dānaphalaṃ na dānapatir na pratigrāhakaḥ upalabhyate / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na śūnyatāyām dānam upalabhyate na dāna phalam na dāna patiḥ na pratigrāhakaḥ upalabhyate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Emptiness is not perceived in the gift, the fruit of the gift is not perceived, the donor is not perceived, and the recipient is not perceived. What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hy atyantatayā ete dharmā svabhāvena śūnyā / punar aparaṃ subhūte bodhisattvo
analyzed: tathā hi atyanta tayā ete dharmāḥ svabhāvena śūnyā punar aparam subhūte bodhisattvaḥ
translated: Because these dharmas are absolutely empty of own-being.

original: mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann upāyakauśalena sattvān śīle pratiṣṭhāpayati /
analyzed: mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran upāya kauśalena sattvān śīle pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing the perfection of wisdom, through skillful means establishes beings in morality.

original: ehi tvaṃ kulaputra prāṇātipātaṃ prahāya prāṇātipātāt prativirama / yāvat mithyādṛṣṭiṃ prahāya /
analyzed: ehi tvam kula putra prāṇa atipātam prahāya prāṇa atipātāt prativirama yāvat mithyādṛṣṭim prahāya
translated: Come, son of good family, abandon killing living beings and refrain from killing living beings, up to abandon wrong view and refrain from wrong view.

original: mithyādṛṣṭiṃ prativirama / naiṣāṃ kulaputra dharmāṇāṃkaścit svabhāvaḥ saṃvidyate /🔽yathā te parikalpitaḥ /
analyzed: mithyā dṛṣṭim prativirama na eṣām kula putra dharmāṇām kaścid svabhāvaḥ saṃvidyate  yathā te parikalpitaḥ
translated: Son of good family, none of these dharmas has any own-being as imagined by you.

original: hanta tāvat kulaputra vyupaparīkṣasva /
analyzed: hanta tāvat kula putra vyupaparīkṣasva
translated: Well then, son of good family, investigate.

original: katama eṣa dharmaḥ prāṇīnām ayaṃ jīvitān vyaparopayiṣyasi / yena vā vyaparopayiṣyasi /
analyzed: katamaḥ eṣa dharmaḥ prāṇīnām ayam jīvitān vyaparopayiṣyasi yena vā vyaparopayiṣyasi
translated: Which of these dharmas will you deprive of life, by which will you deprive [them of life],

original: yāvan mithyādṛṣṭe kartavyaṃ / anena ca subhūte upāyakauśalena samanvāgato bodhisattvo
analyzed: yāvat mithyādṛṣṭe kartavyam anena ca subhūte upāya kauśalena samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ
translated: up to wrong view? In this way, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva endowed with this skillful means,

original: mahāsattva prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran sattvān paripācayati / sa tasya dānasya ca śīlasya
