original: yadi vā navasv anupūrvasamāpattiṣu / yadi vā daśasu tathāgatabaleṣu / yadi vā caturṣu
analyzed: yadi vā navasu anupūrva samāpattiṣu yadi vā daśasu tathāgata baleṣu yadi vā caturṣu
translated: or if you practice the nine successive abodes, or if you practice the ten powers of the Tathāgata, or if you practice the four

original: vaiśāradyeṣu yadi vā catasṛṣu pratisaṃvitsu /
analyzed: vaiśāradyeṣu yadi vā catasṛṣu pratisaṃvitsu
translated: fearlessnesses, or if you practice the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: yadi vā mahāmaitryāṃ yadi vā mahākaruṇāyāṃ mahāmuditāyāṃ mahopekṣāyāṃ yadi vā aṣṭādaśasv āveṇikeṣu buddhadharmeṣu /
analyzed: yadi vā mahā maitryām yadi vā mahā karuṇāyām mahā muditāyām mahā upekṣāyām yadi vā aṣṭādaśasu āveṇikeṣu buddha dharmeṣu
translated: or if you practice great loving kindness, or if you practice great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity, or if you practice the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha,

original: yadi vā dvātṛṃśatimahāpuruṣalakṣaṇeṣu yadi vā aśītyām anuvyaṃjaneṣu / yadi vā śrāvakamārge
analyzed: yadi vā dvātṛṃśati mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇeṣu yadi vā aśītyām anuvyaṃjaneṣu yadi vā śrāvaka mārge
translated: or if you practice the thirty-two marks of a great person, or if you practice the eighty minor marks, or if you practice the path of the śrāvakas,🔽or if you practice the path of the pratyekabuddhas, or if you practice the path of the bodhisattva, or if you practice the path of the Tathāgata,

original: yadi vā pratyekabuddhamārge / yadi vā bodhisattvamārge / yadi vā buddhamārge / yadi
analyzed: yadi vā pratyekabuddha mārge yadi vā bodhisattva mārge yadi vā buddha mārge yadi
translated: or in the path of the pratyekabuddhas, or in the path of the bodhisattvas, or in the path of the Buddhas,

original: vā srotaāpattiphale yadi vā sakṛdāgāmiphale / yadi vā anāgāmiphale / yadi vā arhattve /
analyzed: vā srotaāpatti phale yadi vā sakṛdāgāmi phale yadi vā anāgāmi phale yadi vā arhat tve
translated: or in the fruit of entering the stream, or in the fruit of the once-returner, or in the fruit of the non-returner, or in arhatship,

original: yadi vā pratyekabodhau / yadi vā sarvākārajñatāyāṃ / yadi vā sattvaparipāke yadi vā
analyzed: yadi vā pratyeka bodhau yadi vā sarva ākāra jña tāyām yadi vā sattva paripāke yadi vā
translated: or in individual enlightenment, or in omniscience, or in the development of beings,

original: buddhakṣetrapariśuddhau /
analyzed: buddhakṣetra pariśuddhau
translated: or in the purification of the Buddha-field,

original: tasya te / ime kuśalā dharmā alpakṛcchreṇa prādurbhaviṣyanti prakṛtiśūnyatāyāṃ caratah /
analyzed: tasya te ime kuśalāḥ dharmāḥ alpa kṛcchreṇa prādurbhaviṣyanti prakṛti śūnyatāyām carataḥ
translated: those wholesome dharmas will appear with little difficulty for him who practices the emptiness of essential nature.

original: evaṃ khalu subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattva prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann upāyakauśalena sattvānām arthaṃ karoti /
analyzed: evam khalu subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva prajñāpāramitāyām caran upāya kauśalena sattvānām artham karoti
translated: Thus, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, practicing the perfection of wisdom through skillful means, acts for the benefit of beings.

original: prathamacittotpādam upādāyajna jātv akarmako bhavati / kiṃ kuśalagaveṣī sattvānām
analyzed: prathama citta utpādam upādāya na jātu akarmakaḥ bhavati kim kuśala gaveṣī sattvānām
translated: From the first thought of enlightenment onwards he is never without action, always seeking what is wholesome, acting for the benefit of beings,

original: arthaṃ kurvaṃ / buddhakṣetrād buddhakṣetraṃ satatasamitaṃ saṃkrāmati / buddhāṃ bhagavataḥ paryupāsinah /
analyzed: artham kurvam buddhakṣetrāt buddhakṣetram satata samitam saṃkrāmati buddhām bhagavataḥ
translated: going from Buddha-field to Buddha-field, always attending on the Buddhas, the Lords.

original: yañ ca teśāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatām antikād dharmaṃ śṛṇoti / tasya jātivyativṛttasya
analyzed: yam ca teśām buddhānām bhagavatām antikāt dharmam śṛṇoti tasya jāti vyativṛttasya
translated: And whatever Dharma he hears from those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, even after he has passed away from that birth,

original: api na jātu vipraṇaśyati / yāvad anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate / dhāraṇīpratilabdhaś
analyzed: api na jātu vipraṇaśyati yāvat anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate dhāraṇī pratilabdhaḥ
translated: it never gets lost until he has attained supreme enlightenment. And he becomes one who has attained retention,

original: ca satatasamitaṃ bhavati / ahīnendriyo / yadi vā kāyendriyeṇa yadi vā vāgindriyeṇa /
analyzed: ca satata samitam bhavati ahīna indriyaḥ yadi vā kāya indriyeṇa yadi vā vāc indriyeṇa
translated: and he always has unimpaired faculties, whether it be the faculty of the body, the faculty of speech,

original: yadi vā manaindriyeṇa / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: yadi vā manā indriyeṇa tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: or the faculty of mind. Why is that?

original: tathā hi sarvākārajñatā satatasamitaṃ subhāvitā /
analyzed: tathā hi sarva ākāra jña tā satata samitam su bhāvitā
translated: Because the knowledge of all aspects has been well cultivated by him at all times.

original: tena anayā sarvākārajñatayā subhāvitayā sarvamārgā / subhāvitā bhavanti /
analyzed: tena anayā sarva ākāra jña tayā su bhāvitayā sarva mārgā su bhāvitāḥ bhavanti
translated: By that well-cultivated knowledge of all aspects, all paths are well cultivated,

original: yadi vā śrāvakamārgo yadi vā pratyekabuddhamārgo yadi vā bodhisattvamārgaḥ / tasya
analyzed: yadi vā śrāvaka mārgaḥ yadi vā pratyekabuddha mārgaḥ yadi vā bodhisattva mārgaḥ tasya
translated: whether it be the Śrāvaka path, the Pratyekabuddha path, or the Bodhisattva path.

original: abhijñā bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya satatasamitam upakārībhūtā bhavanty avipraṇāśayogena /
analyzed: abhijñāḥ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya satata samitam upakārībhūtāḥ bhavanti a vipraṇāśa yogena
translated: The higher knowledge of that Bodhisattva Mahāsattva always becomes helpful, without being lost.

original: sa tāsu vipākīyāsv abhijñāsu sthitvā sattvānām arthaṃ karoti / na ca parihīyate paṃcagatike
analyzed: sa tāsu vipākīyāsu abhijñāsu sthitvā sattvānām artham karoti na ca parihīyate paṃcagatike
translated: Abiding in those higher knowledges that are the results of actions, he works for the benefit of beings, and does not fall into the five destinies.

original: saṃsāre saṃsaran / evaṃ khalu subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran
analyzed: saṃsāre saṃsaran evam khalu subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran
translated: Transmigrating in cyclic existence. Thus, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: prakṛtiśūnyatāyāṃ sthito upāyakauśalena sattvānām arthaṃ karoti / sa tayā prajñāpāramitayā🔽subhāvitayā sattvān evam avavadaty evaṃ
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatāyām sthitaḥ upāya kauśalena sattvānām artham karoti sa tayā prajñāpāramitayā  su bhāvi tayā sattvān evam avavadati evam
translated: standing in the emptiness of inherent nature, through skillful means accomplishes the aims of beings. He, with that perfection of wisdom

original: anuśāsti / ehi tvaṃ kulaputra yad yad eva karma karoṣi / kāyena vā vācā vā manasā vā tat sarvaṃ prakṛtiśūnyam AdSPG II
analyzed: anuśāsti ehi tvam kula putra yat yat eva karma karoṣi kāyena vā vācā vā manasā vā tat sarvam prakṛti śūnyam
translated: well cultivated, instructs and teaches beings thus: 'Come, son of good family, whatever action you perform, whether by body, speech, or mind, all that is empty of inherent nature.

original: evaṃ pratyavekṣasva /
analyzed: evam pratyavekṣasva
translated: Contemplate it thus.

original: tasya te sarvaṃ karmāmṛtaphalaṃ bhaviṣyaty amṛtaparyavāsanaṃ / na ca prakṛtiśūnyatāyāṃ kaścid dharma upalabhyate / yo vinaśyed yo vā parihīyeta /
analyzed: tasya te sarvam karma amṛta phalam bhaviṣyati amṛta paryavāsanam na ca prakṛti śūnyatāyām kaścid dharmaḥ upalabhyate yaḥ vinaśyet yaḥ vā parihīyeta  /
translated: All that action of yours will have the fruit of immortality, the result of immortality. And in the emptiness of inherent nature, no dharma is apprehended that would perish or be subject to loss.'

original: f / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: na hi prakṛtiśūnyatā parihīyate nāpi prakṛtiśūnyatāyā kaścid dharmaḥ parihīyate / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na hi prakṛti śūnyatā parihīyate na api prakṛti śūnyatāyāḥ kaścid dharmaḥ parihīyate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: For the emptiness of inherent nature is not subject to loss, and in the emptiness of inherent nature, no dharma is subject to loss. Why is that?

original: tathā hi prakṛtiśūnyatā na bhāvo na abhāvaḥ / tat kim abhāvasvabhāveṣu dharmeṣu parihāsyate /
analyzed: tathā hi prakṛti śūnyatā na bhāvaḥ na abhāvaḥ tat kim abhāva svabhāveṣu dharmeṣu parihāsyate
translated: Thus, the emptiness of intrinsic nature is neither an existent nor a non-existent. So, is it to be lost in non-existent dharmas?

original: evaṃ khalu subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann upāyakauśalena
analyzed: evam khalu subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran upāya kauśalena
translated: Thus, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing the perfection of wisdom with skillful means,

original: sattvān avavadaty anuśāsti / evam avavadann evam anuśāsan na jātv akarmako bhavati /
analyzed: sattvān avavadati anuśāsti evam avavadan evam anuśāsan na jātu akarmakaḥ bhavati
translated: instructs and admonishes beings. Thus instructing and admonishing, he is never without action.

original: sa ātmanā ca daśakuśaleṣu karmapatheṣu satatasamitaṃ vartate / paraṃ ca daśakuśaleṣu
analyzed: saḥ ātmanā ca daśa kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu satata samitam vartate param ca daśa kuśaleṣu
translated: He himself always and constantly engages in the ten wholesome actions, and he also encourages others to engage in the ten wholesome actions.

original: karmapatheṣu samādāpayati / evaṃ paṃcasu śikṣāpadeṣv aṣṭāṅgasamanvāgate upavāse /
analyzed: karma patheṣu samādāpayati evam paṃcasu śikṣā padeṣu aṣṭāṅga samanvāgate upavāse
translated: Thus, in the five precepts, in the eight-part fasting observance,

original: ātmanā ca / prathamadhyānaṃ samāpadyate paraṃ ca prathame dhyāne samādāpayati / evaṃ
analyzed: ātmanā ca prathama dhyānam samāpadyate param ca prathame dhyāne samādāpayati evam
translated: and he himself enters the first concentration, and he also encourages others in the first concentration. Thus,

original: yāvac caturthe dhyāne / ātmanā ca satatasamitaṃ maitrīvihārī bhavati paraṃ ca satatasamitaṃ
analyzed: yāvat caturthe dhyāne ātmanā ca satata samitam maitrī vihārī bhavati param ca satata samitam
translated: up to the fourth concentration. He himself always and constantly dwells in loving-kindness, and he also encourages others to always and constantly dwell in🔽loving-kindness.

original: maitrībhāvanāyāṃ samādāpayati / evaṃ karuṇāyāṃ muditāyām upekṣāyāṃ yāvan / naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñāyatanasamāpattau /
analyzed: maitrī bhāvanāyām samādāpayati evam karuṇāyām muditāyām upekṣāyām yāvat na eva saṃjñā na asaṃjñā āyatana samāpattau
translated: He encourages [others] in the cultivation of loving-kindness, and similarly in compassion, sympathetic joy, and equanimity, up to the attainment of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: ātmanā ca smṛtyupasthānaṃ bhāvayati / paraṃ ca smṛtyupasthāneṣu samādāpayati / evaṃ
analyzed: ātmanā ca smṛti upasthānam bhāvayati param ca smṛti upasthāneṣu samādāpayati evam
translated: He himself cultivates the establishments of mindfulness, and he encourages others in the establishments of mindfulness. Similarly,

original: yāvad āryāṣṭāṅge mārge / ātmanā ca daśasu tathāgatabaleṣu śikṣate / paraṃ ca daśasu
analyzed: yāvat ārya aṣṭāṅge mārge ātmanā ca daśasu tathāgata baleṣu śikṣate param ca daśasu
translated: up to the noble eightfold path. He himself trains in the ten powers of the Tathāgata, and he encourages others in the ten powers of the Tathāgata,

original: tathāgatabaleṣu samādāpayati / niveśayati vinayati pratiṣṭhāpayati / evaṃ yāvad aśītyām anuvyañjaneṣu /
analyzed: tathāgata baleṣu samādāpayati niveśayati vinayati pratiṣṭhāpayati evam yāvat aśītyām anuvyañjaneṣu
translated: he establishes them, trains them, and establishes them. Similarly, up to the eighty minor marks.

original: ātmanā ca srotaāpattiphalajñānam utpādayati / na ca tatra avatiṣṭhate / paraṃ ca srotaāpattiphale pratiṣṭhāpayati / evaṃ yāvad arhattve pratyekabodhau /
analyzed: ātmanā ca srotaāpatti phala jñānam utpādayati na ca tatra avatiṣṭhate param ca srotaāpatti phale pratiṣṭhāpayati evam yāvat arhat tve pratyeka bodhau
translated: He himself produces the knowledge of the fruit of stream-entry, but does not abide in that [fruit]. He establishes others in the fruit of stream-entry. Similarly, up to [the fruit of] arhatship and individual enlightenment.

original: ātmanā ca anuttarasyām /
analyzed: ātmanā ca anuttarasyām
translated: He himself produces the path to unsurpassed,

original: samyaksaṃbodher mārgam utpādayati / paraṃ ca tatra mārge 'vadaty anuśāsti niveśayati /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodheḥ mārgam utpādayati param ca tatra mārge vadati anuśāsti niveśayati
translated: perfect enlightenment, and he teaches and instructs others in that path, and establishes them [in it].

original: vinayati pratiṣṭhāpayati / evaṃ khalu subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: vinayati pratiṣṭhāpayati evam khalu subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: He disciplines and establishes. Thus, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, in the perfection of wisdom,

original: carann upāyakauśalena na kadācit karma na karoti /
analyzed: caran upāya kauśalena na kadācid karma na karoti
translated: He trains and establishes. Thus, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, coursing in the perfection of wisdom through skill in means never fails to do any deed.

original: āha / yadi bhagavaṃ / prakṛtiśūnyāḥ sarvadharmāḥ na ca prakṛtiśūnyatāyāṃ sattvam upalabhyate /
analyzed: āha yadi bhagavam prakṛti śūnyāḥ sarva dharmāḥ na ca prakṛti śūnyatāyām sattvam upalabhyate
translated: He says: If, Blessed One, all dharmas are empty of own-marks, and in the emptiness of own-marks no dharma is apprehended,

original: na dharmo na adharmas /
analyzed: na dharmaḥ na adharmaḥ
translated: neither a dharma nor a non-dharma,

original: tat kathaṃ bhagavaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattva sarvākārajñatāyaiḥ saṃpratiṣṭhate /
analyzed: tat katham bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva sarva ākāra jña tā yaiḥ saṃpratiṣṭhate
translated: then how, Blessed One, does the Bodhisattva, the great being, stand in the knowledge of all modes?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evam etat subhūte evam etat /
analyzed: evam etat subhūte evam etat
translated: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.

original: tathā yathā vadasi /
analyzed: tathā yathā vadasi
translated: As you say.

original: prakṛtiśūnyāḥ sarvadharmāḥ /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyāḥ sarva dharmāḥ
translated: All dharmas are empty of own-marks.

original: na ca prakṛtiśunyatāyāṃ sattvam upalabhyate / AdSPG II
analyzed: na ca prakṛti śunya tāyām sattvam upalabhyate
translated: And in the emptiness of own-marks no dharma is apprehended,

original: na dharmo na adharmaḥ /🔽yadi punaḥ subhūte naprakṛtiśūnyā sarvadharmāḥ bhaveyur na bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ
analyzed: na dharmaḥ na adharmaḥ  yadi punar subhūte na prakṛti śūnyā sarva dharmāḥ bhaveyuḥ na bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: neither a dharma nor a non-dharma.🔽If, Subhuti, all dharmas were not empty of own-marks, the Bodhisattva, the great being, would not stand in the emptiness of own-marks, and would not fully know the supreme enlightenment.

original: prakṛtiśūnyatāyāṃ pratitiṣṭhet / na asya anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya prakṛtiśūnyān
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatāyām pratitiṣṭhet na asya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya prakṛti śūnyān
translated: Having fully known the supreme enlightenment, he would not demonstrate Dharma which is empty of own-marks.

original: dharmān deśayet / rūpaṃ subhūte prakṛtiśūnyaṃ /
analyzed: dharmān deśayet rūpam subhūte prakṛti śūnyam
translated: He should teach the Dharma. Form, Subhūti, is empty of intrinsic nature.

original: vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārāvijñānaṃ subhūte prakṛtiśūnyaṃ / tad bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskāra a vijñānam subhūte prakṛti śūnyam tat bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness, Subhūti, are empty of intrinsic nature. That bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: caran pañcaskandhāḥ prakṛtiśūnyā iti dharman deśayati / aṣṭādaśadhātavo dvādaśāyatanāni
analyzed: caran pañca skandhāḥ prakṛti śūnyāḥ iti dharman deśayati aṣṭādaśa dhātavaḥ dvādaśa āyatanāni
translated: teaches the Dharma that the five aggregates are empty of intrinsic nature. He teaches the Dharma that the eighteen elements, twelve sense fields,

original: prakṛtiśūnyā iti dharman deśayati / catvāri dhyānāni catvāry apramāṇāni catasraḥ ārūpyasamāpattīś
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyāḥ iti dharman deśayati catvāri dhyānāni catvāri apramāṇāni catasraḥ ārūpya samāpattīḥ
translated: four concentrations, four immeasurables, four formless attainments,

original: catvāri smṛtyupasthānāni yāvad āryāṣṭāṅgo mārga prakṛtiśūnya iti dharman deśayati /
analyzed: catvāri smṛti upasthānāni yāvat ārya aṣṭāṅgaḥ mārga prakṛti śūnyaḥ iti dharman deśayati
translated: four establishments of mindfulness up to the eightfold noble path are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: trīṇi vimokṣamukhāny aṣṭau vimokṣā navānupūrvasamāpattayo / daśatathāgatabalāni catvāri
analyzed: trīṇi vimokṣa mukhāni aṣṭau vimokṣāḥ nava anupūrva samāpattayaḥ daśa tathāgata balāni catvāri
translated: The three doors to liberation, eight liberations, nine successive abodes, ten powers of the Tathāgata, four

original: vaiśāradyāni / catasraḥ pratisaṃvido mahāmaitrī mahākaruṇā mahāmuditā mahopekṣā aṣṭādaśāveṇikā
analyzed: vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ mahā maitrī mahā karuṇā mahā muditā mahā upekṣā aṣṭādaśā āveṇikā
translated: fearlessnesses, four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, eighteen unique qualities of a buddha,

original: buddhadharmā dvātṛṃśan mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇāni aśītir anuvyañjanāni prakṛtiśūnyān iti
analyzed: buddha dharmāḥ dvātṛṃśat mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇāni aśītiḥ anuvyañjanāni prakṛti śūnyān iti
translated: thirty-two major marks of a great man, and eighty minor characteristics are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: dharman deśayati / srotaāpattiphalaṃ sakṛdāgāmiphalam anāgāmiphalaṃ / arhattvaṃ pratyekabodhiḥ
analyzed: dharman deśayati srotaāpatti phalam sakṛdāgāmi phalam anāgāmi phalam arhat tvam pratyeka bodhiḥ
translated: individual enlightenment,

original: sarvākārajñatā sarvavāsanānusandhikleśaprahāṇaṃ prakṛtiśūny f / am iti dharman🔽deśayati / yadi punaḥ subhūte 'dhyātmaśūnyatā na prakṛtiśūnyābhaviṣyan na bodhisattvo
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā sarva vāsanā anusandhi kleśa prahāṇam prakṛti śūnī iti dharman  deśayati yadi punar subhūte dhī ātma śūnyatā na prakṛti śūnyā bhaviṣyat na bodhisattvaḥ
translated: the knowledge of all aspects, the abandonment of all afflictions along with their residues, the emptiness of inherent nature, and so on.🔽If, Subhūti, the emptiness of internal phenomena were not the emptiness of inherent nature,

original: mahāsattvaḥ prakṛtiśūnyāḥ sarvadharmā iti dharman deśayiṣyan / evaṃ bahirddhāśūnyatā
analyzed: mahāsattvaḥ prakṛti śūnyāḥ sarva dharmāḥ iti dharman deśayiṣyan evam bahirddhā śūnyatā
translated: the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, would not teach the Dharma that all phenomena are empty of inherent nature. In the same way, the emptiness of external phenomena,

original: ādhyātmabahirddhāśūnyatā śūnyatāśūnyatā paramārthaśūnyatā saṃskṛtaśūnyatā asaṃskṛtaśūnyatā
analyzed: ādhyātma bahirddhā śūnyatā śūnyatā aśūnyatā paramārtha śūnyatā saṃskṛta śūnyatā asaṃskṛta śūnyatā
translated: the emptiness of external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena,

original: atyantaśūnyatā anavarāgraśūnyatā avakāraśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyatā sarvadharmaśūnyatā
analyzed: atyanta śūnyatā an avara agra śūnyatā avakāra śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyatā sarva dharma śūnyatā
translated: the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-disappearance, the emptiness of inherent nature, the emptiness of all phenomena,

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatā na prakṛtiśūnyā bhavet /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā na prakṛti śūnyā bhavet
translated: the emptiness of its own mark, would not be the emptiness of inherent nature.

original: tad vināśitā prakṛtiśūnyatā bhaven /
analyzed: tat vināśitā prakṛti śūnyatā bhavet
translated: That would be the inherent emptiness of destruction.

original: na ca prakṛtiśūnyatā vinaśyati / na kūṭastho bhavati / nāpi sā punar avakrāmati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na ca prakṛti śūnyatā vinaśyati na kūṭasthaḥ bhavati na api sā punar avakrāmati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: But the emptiness of inherent nature is not destroyed, it does not stand firm, and it does not move again. Why is that?

original: na hi sā deśasthā na pradeśasthā /
analyzed: na hi sā deśa sthā na pradeśa sthā
translated: For it is not located in a place or a region.

original: na hi sā kutaścid āgacchati na kvacid gacchati / eṣā sā dharmasthititā yatra na kasyacid🔽dharmasya ācayo vā apacayo vā upalabhyate / hānir vā vṛddhir vā utpādo vā nirodho
analyzed: na hi sā kutaścid āgacchati na kvacid gacchati eṣā sā dharma sthiti tā yatra na kasyacid  dharmasya ācayaḥ vā apacayaḥ vā upalabhyate hāniḥ vā vṛddhiḥ vā utpādaḥ vā nirodhaḥ
translated: For it does not come from anywhere or go to anywhere. This is the stability of dharmas, in which the accumulation or diminution,

original: vā saṃkleśo vā vayavadānaṃ vā / eṣā sā prakṛtir dharmāṇāṃ yatra sthitvā bodhisattvā🔽mahāsattvā anuttarasyai samyaksaṃbodhaye saṃpratiṣṭhante / na ca kasyacid dharmasya AdSPG II
analyzed: vā saṃkleśaḥ vā vayava dānam vā eṣā sā prakṛtiḥ dharmāṇām yatra sthitvā bodhisattvā  mahāsattvāḥ anuttarasyai samyaksaṃbodhaye saṃpratiṣṭhante na ca kasyacid dharmasya
translated: loss or gain, arising or cessation, defilement or purification of any dharma is not apprehended. This is the nature of dharmas, in which, being established,

original: prasthānaṃ samanupaśyati na aprasthānaṃ / asaṃprasthitā / asthitā hi sarvadharmāḥ / eṣā sā dharmāṇāṃ dharmasthitā /
analyzed: prasthānam samanupaśyati na a prasthānam a saṃprasthitāḥ a sthitāḥ hi sarva dharmāḥ eṣā sā dharmāṇām dharma sthitā
translated: bodhisattva-mahāsattvas aspire to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. And they do not see the setting out of any dharma, nor the not setting out. They do not set out, for all dharmas are unmoving. This is the stability of dharmas.

original: tad bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran sarvadharmān prakṛtiśūnyān dṛṣṭvā na pratyudāvarttate 'nuttarasyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ / tat
analyzed: tat bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran sarva dharmān prakṛti śūnyān dṛṣṭvā na pratyudāvarttate nuttarasyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ tat
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva, practicing the perfection of wisdom, seeing all dharmas as empty of inherent nature, does not turn back from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: kasya hetos /
analyzed: kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi sa na kasyacid dharmasya āvaraṇaṃ samanupaśyati / anāvaraṇān sarvadharmān
analyzed: tathā hi sa na kasyacid dharmasya āvaraṇam samanupaśyati anāvaraṇān sarva dharmān
translated: For he does not see any dharma as an obstruction. He sees all dharmas as unobstructed.

original: samanupaśyati / tat kiṃ vicikitsiṣyaty anuttarasyā samyaksaṃbodheḥ / yatra prakṛtiśūnyatāyāṃ
analyzed: samanupaśyati tat kim vicikitsiṣyati anuttarasyā samyaksaṃbodheḥ yatra prakṛti śūnyatāyām
translated: Then how will he doubt about unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, where there is the emptiness of essential nature,

original: na sattva upalabhyate na sattvaprajñaptiṃ na ātmā na jīvo na poṣo na pudgalo na jantur
analyzed: na sattvaḥ upalabhyate na sattva prajñaptim naḥ ātmā na jīvaḥ na poṣaḥ na pudgalaḥ na jantuḥ
translated: where a being is not apprehended, nor the designation of a being, nor a self, nor a soul, nor a person, nor an individual,

original: na manujo na mānavo na kārako na kārāpako na vedako na vedayitā na utthāpako na janako
analyzed: na manujaḥ na mānavaḥ na kārakaḥ na kārāpakaḥ na vedakaḥ na vedayitā na utthāpakaḥ na janakaḥ
translated: nor a man, nor a human, nor one who acts, nor one who makes others act, nor one who feels, nor one who causes others to feel, nor one who produces, nor one who generates,

original: na paśyaka upalabhyate / na rūpaṃ na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārā na vijñānam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na paśyakaḥ upalabhyate na rūpam na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārāḥ na vijñānam upalabhyate
translated: nor one who sees is apprehended. Form is not apprehended, feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness are not apprehended.

original: evam ādhyātmikabāhyā dharmāḥ kartavyāḥ yāvad aśītir anuvyañjanāni /
analyzed: evam ādhyātmika bāhyāḥ dharmāḥ kartavyāḥ yāvat aśītiḥ anuvyañjanāni
translated: In the same way, the internal and external dharmas should be made, up to the eighty minor marks.

original: VIII / tadyathāpi nāma subhūte tathāgatanirmito nirmitasya bhikṣor bhikṣuṇyā vā upāsakasya vā upāsikāyā vā anuprabandhaṃ kalpaniyutaṃ dharman
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte tathāgata nirmitaḥ nirmitasya bhikṣoḥ bhikṣuṇyāḥ vā upāsakasya vā upāsikāyāḥ vā anuprabandham kalpa niyutam dharman
translated: Just as, for example, Subhūti, a magically created monk, nun, layman, or laywoman created by a Tathāgata would, in succession, for a hundred thousand eons, for a hundred million eons, for a hundred thousand koṭi niyuta eons, teach the Dharma to the magically created assembly of monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen created by that Tathāgata.

original: tat kiṃ manyase subhūte api nu te nirmitā bhavyā srotaāpattiphalam anuprāptuṃ sakṛdāgāmiphalam
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte api nu te nirmitā bhavyā srotaāpatti phalam anuprāptum sakṛdāgāmi phalam
translated: What do you think, Subhuti, are those creations capable of attaining the fruit of a Streamwinner, the fruit of a Once-Returner,

original: anāgāmiphalaṃ vā arhattvaṃ vā pratyekabodhiṃ vā anuttarāṃ vā samyaksaṃbodhim anuprāptuṃ /
analyzed: anāgāmi phalam vā arhat tvam vā pratyeka bodhim vā anuttarām vā samyaksaṃbodhim anuprāptum
translated: the fruit of a Never-Returner, Arhatship, Pratyekabuddha-enlightenment, or the supreme enlightenment?”

original: āha / no hīdaṃ bhagavan / tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: āha no hi idam bhagavan tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: He said: “No, Lord. And why?

original: tathā hi teṣāṃ vastu nāsti /🔽bhagavān āha /🔽evam etat subhūte evam etat / avastukānāṃ sarvadharmāṇāṃ katama sa sattvo yam bodhisattvo
analyzed: tathā hi teṣām vastu na asti  bhagavān āha  evam etat subhūte evam etat avastukānām sarva dharmāṇām sa sattvaḥ yam bodhisattvaḥ
translated: Because they have no real basis.”

original: mahāsattvo niveśayet srotaāpattiphale vā sakṛdāgāmiphale vā anāgāmiphale vā arhattve
analyzed: mahāsattvaḥ niveśayet srotaāpatti phale vā sakṛdāgāmi phale vā anāgāmi phale vā arhat tve
translated: The Lord: “So it is, Subhuti, so it is. Of all dharmas which have no real basis, which is that being whom the Bodhisattva, the great being, should establish in the fruit of a Streamwinner, or in the fruit of a Once-Returner, or in the fruit of a Never-Returner, or in Arhatship,

original: vā pratyekabodhau vā anuttarāyāṃ vā samyaksaṃbodhau /🔽anyatra viparyāsaparyavanaddhaḥ prajñā aviparyāse niveśayati pratiṣṭhāpayati / ya eva viparyāsa sa eva aviparyāsa / kalpaniṣyandam upādāya / avikalpaś
analyzed: vā pratyeka bodhau vā anuttarāyām vā samyaksaṃbodhau  anyatra viparyāsa paryavanaddhaḥ prajñāḥ aviparyāse niveśayati pratiṣṭhāpayati yaḥ eva viparyāsa saḥ eva aviparyāsa kalpa nisyandam upādāya a vikalpaḥ
translated: or in the enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha, or in supreme enlightenment?🔽Except that he should establish him in the absence of error, in the absence of false imagination, in the absence of false discrimination, in the absence of false views.

original: ca aviparyāsa /
analyzed: ca aviparyāsa
translated: And that absence of error is itself the absence of false imagination, the absence of false discrimination, the absence of false views.

original: yatra viparyāso nāsti tatra na ātmā na sattvo yāvan na janako na paśyakaḥ /
analyzed: yatra viparyāsaḥ nā asti tatra na ātmā na sattvaḥ yāvat na janakaḥ na paśyakaḥ
translated: Where there is no error, there is no self, no sentient being, up to no one who sees.

original: tatra na rūpaṃ na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārā na vijñānaṃ yāvan na bodhiḥ /
analyzed: tatra na rūpam na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārāḥ na vijñānam yāvat na bodhiḥ
translated: There is no form, no feeling, no perception, no volitional formations, no consciousness, up to no enlightenment.

original: yatra na rūpaṃ na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārā na vijñānaṃ / yāvan na bodhiḥ /
analyzed: yatra na rūpam na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārāḥ na vijñānam yāvat na bodhiḥ
translated: Where there is no form, no feeling, no perception, no volitional formations, no consciousness, up to no enlightenment,

original: eṣā sā prakṛtiśūnyatā / yatra sthitvā bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran
analyzed: eṣā sā prakṛti śūnyatā yatra sthitvā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran
translated: this is the emptiness of inherent nature, in which the bodhisattva, the great being, abiding, practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: viparyāsāṃ sattvān sattvasaṃjñāyāṃ mocayati / evaṃ rūpasaṃjñāyāt arūpasaṃjñāyān mocayati /
analyzed: viparyāsām sattvān sattva saṃjñāyām mocayati evam rūpa saṃjñāyāt a rūpa saṃjñāyāt mocayati
translated: liberates beings from error, from the notion of a sentient being, and likewise from the notion of form, from the notion of formlessness.

original: yāvat sarvebhyaḥ sāsravebhyo dharmebhyo mocayati / AdSPG II
analyzed: yāvat sarvebhyaḥ sa āsravebhyaḥ dharmebhyaḥ mocayati
translated: He liberates from all dharmas with outflows,

original: ye 'pi te f / anāsravā dharmās tadyathā catvāri smṛtyupasthānāni / catvāri samyakprahāṇāni🔽catvārarddhipādā pañcendriyāṇi pañcabalāni saptabodhyaṃgāny āryāṣṭāṃgo mārga triṇi
analyzed: ye pi te anāsravāḥ dharmāḥ tat yathā catvāri smṛti upasthānāni catvāri samyakprahāṇāni  pañca indriyāṇi pañca balāni sapta bodhyaṃgāni ārya aṣṭāṃgaḥ mārga triṇi
translated: and also from those dharmas without outflows, namely the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts,

original: vimokṣamukhāni yāvad aṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmāḥ /
analyzed: vimokṣa mukhāni yāvat aṣṭādaśa āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ
translated: the four bases of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, the noble eightfold path, the three gateways to liberation, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: tad api na tathā paramārthaḥ /
analyzed: tat api na tathā paramārthaḥ
translated: That also is not so in the ultimate sense.

original: yaduta asaṃskṛtam anutpādaḥ abhāvaḥ aprādurbhāvaḥ eṣā sā prakṛtiśūnyatā /
analyzed: yat uta asaṃskṛtam anutpādaḥ abhāvaḥ aprādurbhāvaḥ eṣā sā prakṛti śūnyatā
translated: Namely, the unconditioned, non-arising, non-existence, non-appearance - this is the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: eṣā sā buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ bodhiḥ /
analyzed: eṣā sā buddhānām bhagavatām bodhiḥ
translated: This is the enlightenment of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

original: yatra na sattvo yāvan na janako na paśyakaḥ /
analyzed: yatra na sattvaḥ yāvat na janakaḥ na paśyakaḥ
translated: where there is no sentient being up to no knower.

original: na rūpaṃ na vedanā sa saṃjñā na saṃskārā na vijñānaṃ / evaṃ vistareṇa kartavyaṃ / yāvad
analyzed: na rūpam na vedanā sa saṃjñā na saṃskārāḥ na vijñānam evam vistareṇa kartavyam yāvat
translated: No form, no feeling, no perception, no volitional formations, no consciousness. Thus it should be done in detail up to

original: aśītir anuvyañjanāni / na hi bodhisattvo mahāsattvo mārgasya kṛte 'nuttarasyai samyaksaṃbodhaye
analyzed: aśītiḥ anuvyañjanāni na hi bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ mārgasya kṛte nuttarasyai samyaksaṃbodhaye
translated: the eighty minor marks. The Bodhisattva Mahasattva does not set out for the sake of the path to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,🔽other than for the sake of fully understanding intrinsic emptiness. That intrinsic emptiness is either

original: 'bhipratiṣṭhate / anyatraprakṛtiśūnyatāparijñāna arthe / sā api prakṛtiśūnyatā pūrve
analyzed: anyatra prakṛtiśūnyatā parijñāna arthe sā api prakṛtiśūnyatā pūrve
translated: in the past,

original: vā sā prakṛtiśūnyatā /🔽paścād vā sā prakṛtiśūnyatā / madhye vā sā prakṛtiśūnyatā /
analyzed: vā sā prakṛti śūnyatā  paścāt vā sā prakṛti śūnyatā madhye vā sā prakṛti śūnyatā
translated: or in the future, or in the present.

original: na sā jātu na prakṛtiśūnyatā / tad bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prakṛtiśūnyatāpāramitāsu
analyzed: na sā jātu na prakṛti śūnyatā tat bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prakṛti śūnyatā pāramitāsu
translated: It is never not intrinsic emptiness. The Bodhisattva Mahasattva, practicing the perfections of intrinsic emptiness,

original: caraṃ sattvānāṃ sattvasaṃjñīnāṃ sarvasaṃjñāpramokṣaṇa arthaṃ mārgākārajñātāyāṃ carati /
analyzed: sattvānām sattva saṃjñīnām sarva saṃjñā pramokṣaṇa artham mārga ākāra jñātāyām carati
translated: practices the knowledge of the aspects of the path for the sake of liberating all the notions of sentient beings who have the notion of sentient beings.

original: sa mārgākārajñatāyāṃ caran sarvamārgeṣu carati / yaduta śrāvakamārge pratyekabuddhamārge
analyzed: sa mārga ākāra jña tāyām caran sarva mārgeṣu carati yat uta śrāvaka mārge pratyekabuddha mārge
translated: He, practicing the knowledge of the aspects of the path, practices in all paths, namely the śrāvaka path, the pratyekabuddha path,

original: bodhisattvamārge / sa khalu punar bodhisattvo mahāsattva sarvamārgān paripūrya sattvāṃ
analyzed: bodhisattva mārge sa khalu punar bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva sarva mārgān paripūrya
translated: and the bodhisattva path. That bodhisattva mahāsattva, having fulfilled all paths, having brought beings to maturity,

original: paripācya buddhakṣetraṃ pariśodhya āyuhsaṃskārān adhiṣṭāya anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim
analyzed: paripācya buddhakṣetram pariśodhya āyuḥ saṃskārān adhiṣṭāya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim
translated: having purified the buddha-field, having controlled the life-formations, having attained supreme perfect enlightenment,

original: abhisaṃbudhyate / buddhanetriṃ na vyavacchinnatti yaduta prakṛtiśūnyatāṃ / eṣā sā buddhānāṃ
analyzed: abhisaṃbudhyate buddha netrim na vyavacchinnatti yat uta prakṛti śūnyatām eṣā sā buddhānām
translated: and having become a perfect buddha, does not cut off the eye of the buddhas, namely the emptiness of intrinsic nature. This is the eye of the buddhas,

original: bhagavatāṃ buddhanetri /🔽ye 'pi te 'bhūvann atīte 'dhvani buddhā bhagavantas teṣām api buddhānāṃ bhagavatām iyaṃ buddhanetrī yaduta prakṛtiśūnyatā /
analyzed: bhagavatām buddha netri  ye pi te bhūvan atīte dhvani buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ teṣām api buddhānām bhagavatām iyam buddha netrī yat uta prakṛti śūnyatā
translated: the lords.🔽For those buddhas, the lords, who were in the past, for those buddhas, the lords, this is the eye of the buddhas, namely the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: ye 'pi te anāgate 'dhvani bhaviṣyanti buddhā bhagavantas teṣām api buddhānāṃ bhagavatām iyaṃ buddhanetrī yaduta prakṛtiśūnyatā /
analyzed: ye pi te anāgate dhvani bhaviṣyanti buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ teṣām api buddhānām bhagavatām iyam buddha netrī yat uta prakṛti śūnyatā
translated: For those buddhas, the lords, who will be in the future, for those buddhas, the lords, this is the eye of the buddhas, namely the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: ye 'pi te etarhi daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhā bhagavantas tiṣṭhanti dhṛyante yāpayanti
analyzed: ye pi te etarhi daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti dhṛyante yāpayanti
translated: And those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, who are at present in the world systems of the ten directions, who are standing, supporting, and maintaining themselves,

original: teṣām api buddhānāṃ bhagavatām iyaṃ buddhanetri yaduta prakṛtiśūnyatā / na hy anyataḥ
analyzed: teṣām api buddhānām bhagavatām iyam buddha netri yat uta prakṛti śūnyatā na hi anyatas
translated: for those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, this is the eye of the Buddhas, namely, the emptiness of inherent nature. For it is not from anywhere else

original: prakṛtiśūnyatāyā lokaprādurbhāvo bhavaty anyatra buddhānāṃ bhagavatām antikāt /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatāyāḥ loka prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati anyatra buddhānām bhagavatām antikāt
translated: that the appearance of the world in the emptiness of inherent nature occurs, except from the presence of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: tathā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prakṛtiśūnyatāpāramitāsu caritavyaṃ /
analyzed: tathā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prakṛti śūnyatā pāramitāsu caritavyam
translated: Thus, Subhūti, the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva should practice in the perfection of the emptiness of inherent nature.

original: yatra caraṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na parihīyate sarvākārajñatayā /🔽AdSPG II
analyzed: yatra caram bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na parihīyate sarva ākāra jña tayā  adspr2Im ii
translated: Practicing where, the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva does not fall away from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: āścaryam idaṃ bhagavaṃ / bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ yatra hi nāma evaṃ prakṛtiśūnyeṣu sarvadharmeṣu caranti / tāṃ ca prakṛtiśūnyatāṃ na vikopayanty /
analyzed: āścaryam idam bhagavam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām yatra hi nāma evam prakṛti śūnyeṣu sarva dharmeṣu caranti tām ca prakṛti śūnyatām na vikopayanti
translated: This is wonderful, Blessed One, of the Bodhisattva Mahāsattvas, that they practice thus in all dharmas which are empty of inherent nature, and do not disturb that emptiness of inherent nature.

original: anyad rūpam anyā prakṛtiśūnyatā / evam anyā vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārāvijñānam anyā prakṛtiśūnyatā / evaṃ vistareṇa sarvadharmāṇāṃ kartavyaṃ / yāvad
analyzed: anyat rūpam anyā prakṛti śūnyatā evam anyā vedanā saṃjñā saṃskāra a vijñānam anyā prakṛti śūnyatā evam vistareṇa sarva dharmāṇām kartavyam yāvat
translated: Another form, another emptiness of intrinsic nature. Thus, another feeling, another perception, another formation, another consciousness, another emptiness of intrinsic nature. In this way, it should be done in detail for all dharmas,

original: anyā bodhir anyā prakṛtiśūnyatā /
analyzed: anyā bodhiḥ anyā prakṛti śūnyatā
translated: up to another enlightenment, another emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: rūpam eva prakṛtiśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyataiva rūpaṃ /
analyzed: rūpam eva prakṛti śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyatā eva rūpam
translated: Form itself is the emptiness of intrinsic nature, the emptiness of intrinsic nature itself is form.

original: vedanaiva prakṛtiśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyativa vedanā / saṃjñaiva prakṛtiśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyataiva saṃjñā /
analyzed: vedanā eva prakṛti śūnyatā vedanā saṃjñā eva prakṛti śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyatā eva saṃjñā
translated: Feeling itself is the emptiness of intrinsic nature, the emptiness of intrinsic nature itself is feeling. Perception itself is the emptiness of intrinsic nature, the emptiness of intrinsic nature itself is perception.

original: saṃskārā eva prakṛtiśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyataiva saṃskārā /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ eva prakṛti śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyatā eva saṃskārāḥ
translated: Formations themselves are the emptiness of intrinsic nature, the emptiness of intrinsic nature itself is formations.

original: vijñānam eva prakṛtiśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyataiva vijñānaṃ / yāvad bodhir eva prakṛtiśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyataiva bodhiḥ /
analyzed: vijñānam eva prakṛti śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyatā eva vijñānam yāvat bodhiḥ eva prakṛti śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyatā eva bodhiḥ
translated: Consciousness itself is the emptiness of intrinsic nature, the emptiness of intrinsic nature itself is consciousness. Up to enlightenment itself is the emptiness of intrinsic nature, the emptiness of intrinsic nature itself is enlightenment.

original: bhagavān āha /🔽yadi subhūte anyad rūpaṃ bhaved anyā prakṛtiśūnyatā / anyā vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārāvijñānaṃ
analyzed: bhagavān āha  yadi subhūte anyat rūpam bhavet anyā prakṛti śūnyatā anyā vedanā saṃjñā saṃskāra a vijñānam
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽Subhūti, if form were one thing and the emptiness of intrinsic nature another, if feeling, perception, formations, and consciousness were one thing

original: bhaved anyā prakṛtiśūnyatā / yāvad anyā bodhir bhaved anyā prakṛtiśūnyatā / yadi subhūte
analyzed: bhavet anyā prakṛti śūnyatā yāvat anyā bodhiḥ bhavet anyā prakṛti śūnyatā yadi subhūte
translated: and the emptiness of intrinsic nature another, up to if enlightenment were one thing and the emptiness of intrinsic nature another, if, Subhūti,

original: rūpaṃ na prakṛtiśūnyaṃ bhaven na bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nuttarāṃsamyaksaṃbodhim
analyzed: rūpam na prakṛti śūnyam bhavet na bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim
translated: Form would not be empty of intrinsic nature, and a bodhisattva great being would not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: abhisaṃbuddhyeta / evaṃ vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārā /🔽yadi vijñānaṃ na prakṛtiśūnyaṃ bhaven na bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeta /🔽yāvad yadi bodhir na prakṛti f / śūnyatā bhaven na bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nyttarāṃ
analyzed: abhisaṃbuddhyā itas evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārā  yadi vijñānam na prakṛti śūnyam bhavet na bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeta  yāvat yadi bodhiḥ na śūnyatā bhavet na bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: Likewise, if feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness were not empty of intrinsic nature, a bodhisattva great being would not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.🔽If form were not empty of intrinsic nature, a bodhisattva great being would not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.🔽If feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness were not empty of intrinsic nature, a bodhisattva great being would not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeta / yasmāt tarhi subhūte rūpaṃ prakṛtiśūnyaṃ vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārāvijñānaṃ prakṛtiśūnyaṃ /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeta yasmāt tarhi subhūte rūpam prakṛti śūnyam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskāra a vijñānam prakṛti śūnyam
translated: If up to enlightenment were not empty of intrinsic nature, a bodhisattva great being would not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. But since, Subhūti, form is empty of intrinsic nature, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty of intrinsic nature,

original: yāvad bodhiḥ prakṛtiśūnyā /
analyzed: yāvat bodhiḥ prakṛti śūnyā
translated: up to enlightenment is empty of intrinsic nature.

original: tasmād bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prakṛtiśūnyān sarvadharmān viditvā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prakṛti śūnyān sarva dharmān viditvā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Therefore, a bodhisattva great being, having known all dharmas as empty of intrinsic nature, fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. Why is that?

original: na hy atra kaścid dharmo vinaśyati vā kūṭastho vā bhavaty avakrāmati vā /
analyzed: na hi atra kaścid dharmaḥ vinaśyati vā kūṭasthaḥ vā bhavati avakrāmati vā
translated: Because in this there is no dharma whatsoever that is destroyed or becomes fixed or passes away.

original: anyatra sadevako lokaḥ samārakaḥ sabrahmakaḥ so mūḍhaḥ idaṃ rūpam ahaṃ rūpaṃ mama rūpaṃ / yāvad idaṃ vijñānam ahaṃ vijñānaṃ mama vijñānaṃ /
analyzed: anyatra sa devakaḥ lokaḥ sa mārakaḥ sa brahmakaḥ saḥ mūḍhaḥ idam rūpam aham rūpam mama rūpam yāvat idam vijñānam aham vijñānam mama vijñānam
translated: Elsewhere, the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, being deluded, clings to this form, 'This form is mine,' 'This form is not mine.' Up to: 'This consciousness is mine,' 'This consciousness is not mine.'

original: te rūpam abhiniviśya yāvad vijñānam abhiniviśya ahaṃkāramamakārayoś caranti / ahaṃkāramamakārayor abhiniviśya adhyātmikabāhyeṣu AdSPG II 🔽vastuṣv abhiniviśyante /
analyzed: te rūpam abhiniviśya yāvat vijñānam abhiniviśya ahaṃkāra mamakārayoḥ caranti ahaṃkāra mamakārayoḥ abhiniviśya adhyātmika bāhyeṣu  vastuṣu abhiniviśyante
translated: Clinging to form up to consciousness, they engage in the notions of 'I' and 'mine.' Clinging to the notions of 'I' and 'mine,' they cling to internal and external things.

original: abhiniviśya upapadya āyataneṣu upādadāte / rūpaṃ vedanāṃ saṃjñāṃ saṃskārān vijñānaṃ /
analyzed: abhiniviśya upapadye āyataneṣu upādadāte rūpam vedanām saṃjñām saṃskārān vijñānam
translated: Clinging, they take rebirth in the sense bases. Form, feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

original: te na parimucyante jātijarāvyādhimaraṇaśokaparidevaduḥkhadaurmanasyopāyāsebhyo /
analyzed: te na parimucyante jāti jarā vyādhi maraṇa śoka parideva duḥkha daurmanasya upāyāsebhyaḥ
translated: They are not liberated from birth, old age, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair.

original: na parimucyante / pañcagatikāt saṃsārāt /
analyzed: na parimucyante pañca gatikāt saṃsārāt
translated: They are not liberated from the five destinies of saṃsāra.

original: tad bodhisattvo mahāsattva prakṛtiśūnyatāpāramitāsu caran rūpaṃ na vikopayati / śūnyaṃ vā na vāśūnyam iti / vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārān /
analyzed: tat bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva prakṛti śūnyatā pāramitāsu caran rūpam na vikopayati śūnyam vā na vā a śūnyam iti vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārān
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva, practicing the perfection of emptiness of intrinsic nature, does not disturb form, whether empty or not empty. Feeling, perception, volitional formations,

original: vijñānaṃ na vikopayati / śūnyaṃ vā na vāśūnyam iti / yāvad bodhiṃ na vikopayati śūnyaṃ vā na vāśūnyam iti / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: vijñānam na vikopayati śūnyam vā na vā a śūnyam iti yāvat bodhim na vikopayati śūnyam vā na vā a śūnyam iti tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Consciousness is not disturbed, whether it is empty or not empty. Up to: Awakening is not disturbed, whether it is empty or not empty. Why is that?

original: na hi rūpaśūnyatā rūpaṃ vikopayati / idaṃ rūpam iyaṃ rūpaśūnyatā yāvad iyaṃ vijñānam
analyzed: na hi rūpa śūnyatā rūpam vikopayati idam rūpam iyam rūpa śūnyatā yāvat iyam vijñānam
translated: Subhūti, emptiness of form does not disturb form. This is form, this is the emptiness of form. Up to: this is consciousness,

original: iyaṃ vijñānaśūnyatā yāvad iyaṃ bodhir iyaṃ boddhiśūnyatā / tadyathāpi nāma subhūte
analyzed: iyam vijñāna śūnyatā yāvat iyam bodhiḥ iyam boddhi śūnyatā tat yathā api nāma subhūte
translated: this is the emptiness of consciousness. Up to: this is Awakening, this is the emptiness of Awakening. Just as, for example, Subhūti,

original: na ākāśam ākāśaṃ vikopayati / nādhyātmikam ākāśaṃ bāhyam ākāśaṃ vikopayati / na bāhyam
analyzed: na ākāśam ākāśam vikopayati na ādhyātmikam ākāśam bāhyam ākāśam vikopayati na bāhyam
translated: space does not disturb space, inner space does not disturb outer space, outer space

original: ākāśam ādhyātmikam ākāśaṃ vikopayati / evam eva subhūte na rūpaṃ śūnyatāṃ vikopayati /
analyzed: ākāśam ādhyātmikam ākāśam vikopayati evam eva subhūte na rūpam śūnyatām vikopayati
translated: does not disturb inner space. Just so, Subhūti, form does not disturb emptiness.

original: na vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārāvijñānaṃ śūnyatāṃ vikopayati / na śūnyatā vijñānaṃ vikopayati /
analyzed: na vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ vijñānam śūnyatām vikopayati na śūnyatā vijñānam vikopayati
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness do not disturb emptiness. Emptiness does not disturb consciousness.

original: yāvan na bodhiḥ śūnyatāṃ vikopayati / na śūnyatā bodhiṃ vikopayati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: yāvat na bodhiḥ śūnyatām vikopayati na śūnyatā bodhim vikopayati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Up to: Awakening does not disturb emptiness. Emptiness does not disturb Awakening. Why is that?

original: na hy eṣāṃ svabhāvo 'sti ya evaṃ vikopayed / idaṃ rūpam iyaṃ śūnyatā iyaṃ vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārāvijñānam iyaṃ śūnyatā yāvad iyaṃ bodhir iyaṃ śūnyatā /
analyzed: na hi eṣām svabhāvaḥ sti yaḥ evam vikopayet idam rūpam iyam śūnyatā iyam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskāra a vijñānam iyam śūnyatā yāvat iyam bodhiḥ iyam śūnyatā
translated: For these have no intrinsic nature that could be disturbed in this way. This is form, this is emptiness, this is feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness, this is emptiness, up to this is awakening, this is emptiness.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: yadi bhagavann abhedaḥ sarvadharmāḥ /
analyzed: yadi bhagavan abhedaḥ sarva dharmāḥ
translated: If, Blessed One, all phenomena are undifferentiated,

original: kuto bodhisattvo mahāsattva saṃprasthito 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsya iti /
analyzed: kutas bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva saṃprasthitaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsye iti
translated: from where has the bodhisattva mahāsattva set out, thinking I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: na ca bhagavan dvaidhīkāro bodhir na ca dvidhīkurvatā śakyam anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhuṃ /
analyzed: na ca bhagavan dvaidhīkāraḥ bodhiḥ na ca dvidhīkurvatā śakyam anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhum
translated: And, Blessed One, awakening is not dualistic, and one who acts dualistically is not able to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evam etat subhūte evam etad /
analyzed: evam etat subhūte evam etat
translated: It is so, Subhūti, it is so.

original: na dvaye carato bodhir na dvaidhīkāro bodhi /
analyzed: na dvaye carataḥ bodhiḥ na dvaidhīkāraḥ
translated: Awakening does not exist for one who acts dualistically, and awakening is not dualistic.

original: advayaṃ hi subhūte bodhir advaidhīkārā /
analyzed: advayam hi subhūte bodhiḥ a dvaidhīkārā
translated: For awakening is nondual, Subhūti, and not dualistic.

original: na subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bodhir dvaidhīkāre carati bodhir iti bodhisattva
analyzed: na subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bodhiḥ dvaidhīkāre carati bodhiḥ iti bodhisattva
translated: Subhūti, the awakening of the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not exist for one who acts dualistically, thinking this is awakening,🔽or this is a bodhisattva.

original: iti vā / sā ca bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bodhir na rūpe carati / na vedanāyāṃ na
analyzed: iti vā sā ca bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bodhiḥ na rūpe carati na vedanāyām na
translated: And that awakening of the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not exist in form, nor in feeling, nor in

original: saṃjñāyāṃ na saṃskāreṣu na vijñāne carati / yāvan na bodhau carati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: saṃjñāyām na saṃskāreṣu na vijñāne carati yāvat na bodhau carati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: He does not practice in perception, in volitional factors, or in consciousness, up to he does not practice in awakening. Why is that?

original: na hi bodhir aham iti vā mamaiti vā /
analyzed: na hi bodhiḥ aham iti vā mama eti vā
translated: Because awakening is not ‘I’ or ‘mine.’

original: ahaṃ rūpe careyaṃ mama rūpaṃ /
analyzed: aham rūpe careyam mama rūpam
translated: I would practice in form, my form.

original: ahaṃ vedanāyāṃ saṃjñāyāṃ saṃskāreṣv ahaṃ vijñāne careyaṃ mama vijñānaṃ / AdSPG II
analyzed: aham vedanāyām saṃjñāyām saṃskāreṣu aham vijñāne careyam mama vijñānam
translated: I would practice in feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, my consciousness, up to

original: yāvad ahaṃ bodhau careyaṃ mama bodhiḥ / na ca bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bodhir ugṛhṇe vā anudgṛhṇe vā carati /
analyzed: yāvat aham bodhau careyam mama bodhiḥ na ca bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bodhiḥ vā an udgṛhṇe vā carati
translated: I would practice in awakening, my awakening.’ And the awakening of a bodhisattva great being does not practice in grasping or not grasping.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said,

original: yadi bhagavaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bodhir na udgṛhṇe carati na anudgṛhṇe / kuha bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bodhiś carati /
analyzed: yadi bhagavam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bodhiḥ na udgṛhṇe carati na an udgṛhṇe kuha bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bodhiḥ carati
translated: “If, Blessed One, a bodhisattva great being’s awakening does not practice in grasping or not grasping, where does a bodhisattva great being’s awakening practice?”

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: tat kiṃ manyase subhūte kuha tathāgatasya nirmitasya bodhiś carati / udgṛhṇe vā anudgṛhṇe vā carati /🔽āha / no hīdaṃ bhagavan /
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte kuha tathāgatasya nirmitasya bodhiḥ carati udgṛhṇe vā an udgṛhṇe vā carati  āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti? Where does the awakening of a thus-gone one’s magical creation practice, in grasping or not grasping?”🔽He said, “Not so, Blessed One.”

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: tat kiṃ manyase subhūte arhataḥ svapnāntaragatasya buddhi / kuha carati / udgṛhṇe vā anudgṛhṇe vā /
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte arhataḥ svapna antara gatasya buddhi kuha carati udgṛhṇe vā an udgṛhṇe vā
translated: What do you think, Subhuti, where does the thought of an Arhat who is in a dream operate, in grasping or in non-grasping?

original: āha / no hīdaṃ bhagavann /
analyzed: āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: He said: No, Blessed One.

original: api tu khalu bhagavan yady atyantato 'rhan na svapiti kuta punar asya svapne buddhiś cariṣyaty udgṛhṇe vā anudgṛhṇe vā /
analyzed: api tu khalu bhagavan yadi atyantatas rhan na svapiti kuta punar asya svapne buddhiḥ cariṣyati udgṛhṇe vā an udgṛhṇe vā
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, if an Arhat does not sleep at all, how much less would his thought operate in a dream, in grasping or in non-grasping?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evam eva subhūte na bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bodhiś caraty udgṛhṇe va anudgṛhṇe vā /
analyzed: evam eva subhūte na bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bodhiḥ carati udgṛhṇe an udgṛhṇe vā
translated: Just so, Subhuti, the enlightenment of the Bodhisattva, the great being, does not operate in grasping or in non-grasping.

original: āha / yadi bhagavaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bodhir na udgṛhṇe carati na anudgṛhṇe carati / na rūpe carati / yāvan na sarvākārajñātāyāṃ carati /
analyzed: āha yadi bhagavam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bodhiḥ na udgṛhṇe carati na an udgṛhṇe carati na rūpe carati yāvat na sarva ākāra jñātāyām carati
translated: He said: If, Blessed One, the enlightenment of the Bodhisattva, the great being, does not operate in grasping or in non-grasping, not in form, up to not in the knowledge of all modes,

original: na punar bhagavan f / bodhisattvo mahāsattvo daśabhūmiṣu carati / ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu
analyzed: na punar bhagavan f bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ daśa bhūmiṣu carati ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu
translated: then, Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, the great being, does not course in the ten stages, in the six perfections,

original: saptatriṃśati bodhipakṣyeṣu dharmeṣu triṣu vimokṣamukheṣu caturdaśasu śūnyatāsu dhyānavimokṣasamādhisamāpattiṣu
analyzed: saptatriṃśati bodhi pakṣyeṣu dharmeṣu triṣu vimokṣa mukheṣu caturdaśasu śūnyatāsu dhyāna vimokṣa samādhi samāpattiṣu
translated: in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, in the three doors to liberation, in the fourteen emptinesses, in the concentrations, the liberations, the meditative stabilizations, and the absorptions,

original: daśasu tathāgatabaleṣu yāvad aśītyānuvyaṃjaneṣu pañcasv abhijñāsu sthitvā buddhakṣetraṃ
analyzed: daśasu tathāgata baleṣu yāvat aśītyā anuvyaṃjaneṣu pañcasu abhijñāsu sthitvā buddhakṣetram
translated: Having stood in the ten powers of a tathāgata, up to the eighty minor characteristics, and the five higher knowledges, he purifies a buddhafield

original: ca pariśodhayati sattvāṃś ca paripācayati / sarvākārajñatām abhisaṃbudhyate / na ca
analyzed: ca pariśodhayati sattvān ca paripācayati sarva ākāra jña tām abhisaṃbudhyate na ca
translated: and brings beings to maturity. He fully awakens to all aspects of knowledge. But,

original: bhagavann asthitvā daśasu bhūmiṣu ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu yāvat pañcasv abhijñāsu /
analyzed: bhagavan a sthitvā daśasu bhūmiṣu ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu yāvat pañcasu abhijñāsu
translated: Blessed One, without standing in the ten stages, in the six perfections, up to the five higher knowledges,

original: bodhisattvanyāmam anavakramya buddhakṣetram apariśodhya sattvān aparipācya śakyam anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhir abhisaṃboddhuṃ /
analyzed: bodhisattva nyāmam an avakramya buddhakṣetram a pariśodhya sattvān a paripācya śakyam anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ abhisaṃboddhum
translated: without entering the bodhisattva stage, without purifying a buddhafield, without bringing beings to maturity, it is not possible to fully awaken to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evam etat subhūte evam etad yathā vadasi /
analyzed: evam etat subhūte evam etat yathā vadasi
translated: So it is, Subhūti, so it is as you say.

original: na ṣakyam aparipūrya daśabhūmī ṣaṭpāramitāś catvāri dhyānāni catvāry apramāṇāni catasraḥ
