original: vā caṃkramyamāṇānāṃ vā / īdṛśī dharmadeśanā niścariṣyati / tatra buddhakṣetre 'nuttarāṃ
analyzed: vā caṃkramyamāṇānām vā īdṛśī dharma deśanā niścariṣyati tatra buddhakṣetre nuttarām
translated: or walking. Such a dharma teaching will issue forth in that buddha-field, when I have fully awakened to unsurpassed

original: samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasya / tasya khalu punas tathāgatasya arhata samyaksaṃbuddhasya
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasya tasya khalu punar tathāgatasya arhata samyaksaṃbuddhasya
translated: perfect enlightenment. And for that Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One,

original: ye daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhā bhagavantas te sarve varṇaṃ bhāṣante / ye khalu
analyzed: ye daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ te sarve varṇam bhāṣante ye khalu
translated: all the Blessed Buddhas in the worlds in the ten directions will proclaim his praise. And those who hear the name of that

original: punas tasya tathāgatasya nāmadheyaṃ śroṣyanti / sarve te niyatā bhaviṣyanty anuttarasyāṃ
analyzed: punar tasya tathāgatasya nāmadheyam śroṣyanti sarve te niyatāḥ bhaviṣyanti anuttarasyām
translated: Tathāgata will all be destined for unsurpassed

original: samyaksaṃbodhau / tasya khalu punas tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya anuttarāṃ AdSPG II
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau tasya khalu punar tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya anuttarām
translated: in perfect enlightenment. And for that Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One,

original: samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasya dharman deśayato na kasyacit sattvasya saṃśayo bhaviṣyaty ayaṃ dharmo 'yaṃ na dharma iti / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasya dharman deśayataḥ na kasyacid sattvasya saṃśayaḥ bhaviṣyati ayam dharmaḥ yam na dharmaḥ iti tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: when he has fully awakened to supreme perfect enlightenment, when he teaches the Dharma, no being will have any doubt, thinking 'This is the Dharma, this is not the Dharma.' Why is that?

original: yā khalu punar sarvadharmāṇāṃ dharmatā na tatra kaścid adharmaḥ sarva sa dharmaḥ /
analyzed: yā khalu punar sarva dharmāṇām dharma tā na tatra kaścid adharmaḥ sa dharmaḥ
translated: Whatever is the true nature of all dharmas, in that there is no non-Dharma, all that is Dharma.

original: tatra ye sattvā akuśalamūlagrastā anavaruptakuśalamūlā buddheṣu vā buddhaśrāvakeṣu
analyzed: tatra ye sattvāḥ akuśala mūla grastāḥ an avarupta kuśala mūlāḥ buddheṣu vā buddha śrāvakeṣu
translated: Among them, those beings who are seized by the roots of non-virtue, who have not planted the roots of virtue in the Buddhas or the Buddha's disciples,

original: vā / akalyāṇamitraparigṛhītā ātmadṛṣṭim ālīyante / yāvat sarvadṛṣṭigatāny ālīyante /
analyzed: vā akalyāṇa mitra parigṛhītāḥ ātma dṛṣṭim ālīyante yāvat sarva dṛṣṭi gatāni ālīyante
translated: who are taken hold of by bad friends, who cling to the view of self, up to who cling to all the views,

original: anteṣu tiṣṭhanti / ucchede śāśvate vā /
analyzed: anteṣu tiṣṭhanti ucchede śāśvate vā
translated: who stand at the extremes, in annihilation or eternalism,

original: te mithyāgrāheṇa gṛhītā asamyaksaṃbuddheṣu samyaksaṃbuddhasaṃjñinaḥ samyaksaṃbuddheṣu
analyzed: te mithyā grāheṇa gṛhītāḥ asamyaksaṃbuddheṣu samyaksaṃbuddha saṃjñinaḥ samyaksaṃbuddheṣu
translated: they, being seized by wrong grasping, regarding those who are not perfectly enlightened as perfectly enlightened, or regarding those who are perfectly enlightened

original: vā asamyaksaṃbuddhasaṃjñinaḥ / te adharmaṃ dharma iti vadanti / dharmaṃ vā adharma
analyzed: vā asamyaksaṃbuddha saṃjñinaḥ te adharmam dharme iti vadanti dharmam vā adharma
translated: as not perfectly enlightened, they declare what is non-Dharma to be Dharma, or what is Dharma to be non-Dharma,🔽or what is not the training to be the training, or what is the training to be not the training.

original: iti vadanti / te dharmaṃ pratikṣipanti /
analyzed: iti vadanti te dharmam pratikṣipanti
translated: Thus they speak. They reject the Dharma.

original: pratikṣipya kāyasya bhedāt paraṃ maraṇād apāyadurgativinipātān narakeṣu upapadyante /
analyzed: pratikṣipya kāyasya bhedāt param maraṇāt apāya durgati vinipātāt narakeṣu upapadyante
translated: Having rejected it, after the break-up of the body, at death, they are reborn in the lower realms, in bad destinies, in downfall, in the hells.

original: tatra buddhā bhagavanto 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya sattvān saṃsāraparyāpannān
analyzed: tatra buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya sattvān saṃsāra paryāpannān
translated: There the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, liberate beings who have fallen into the cycle of existence,

original: tataḥ pāpakād dṛṣṭigatān vivecayanti / vivecya aniyate f / rāśau pratiṣṭhāpayanti /
analyzed: tatas pāpakāt dṛṣṭi gatān vivecayanti vivecya aniyate rāśau pratiṣṭhāpayanti
translated: from that evil view. Having liberated them, they establish them in the undetermined heap.

original: tatra pratiṣṭhāpitā punar apāyeṣu upapadyante / evaṃ khalu subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo
analyzed: tatra pratiṣṭhāpitā punar apāyeṣu upapadyante evam khalu subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: Having been established there, they are reborn again in the lower realms. Thus, Subhūti, the Bodhisattva, the Great Being,

original: buddhakṣetraṃ pariśodhayati /
analyzed: buddhakṣetram pariśodhayati
translated: purifies the Buddha-field.

original: yasya pariśodhanāt sattvānāṃ na kvacin niketo bhavati / laukikeṣu vā dharmeṣu lokottareṣu
analyzed: yasya pariśodhanāt sattvānām na kvacid niketaḥ bhavati laukikeṣu vā dharmeṣu lokottareṣu
translated: By purifying it, beings have no abode anywhere, whether in worldly dharmas or supramundane dharmas,

original: vā dharmeṣu sāsraveṣu vā dharmeṣv anāsraveṣu vā dharmeṣu saṃskṛteṣu vā dharmeṣv asaṃskṛteṣu vā dharmeṣu /
analyzed: vā dharmeṣu sa āsraveṣu vā dharmeṣu anāsraveṣu vā dharmeṣu saṃskṛteṣu vā dharmeṣu asaṃskṛteṣu vā dharmeṣu
translated: whether in dharmas with outflows or dharmas without outflows, whether in conditioned dharmas or unconditioned dharmas.

original: yāvat sarvasattvā niyatā bhavanty anuttarasyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: yāvat sarva sattvāḥ niyatāḥ bhavanti anuttarasyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Up to all beings being destined for unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: parivarta /
analyzed: parivarta
translated: Chapter.

original: VIII / atha khalv āyuṣmān subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then at that time the venerable Subhuti said this to the Blessed One:

original: kiṃ punar bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo niyataḥ atha aniyataḥ /
analyzed: kim punar bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ niyataḥ atha aniyataḥ
translated: Again, Blessed One, is a bodhisattva great being definite, or indefinite?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: niyataḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na aniyataḥ /🔽AdSPG II
analyzed: niyataḥ subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na aniyataḥ  adspr2Im ii
translated: Subhuti, a bodhisattva great being is definite, not indefinite.

original: āha / katamatra rāśau niyata / śrāvakarāśau vā pratyekabuddharāśau vā buddharāśau vā /
analyzed: āha katamatra rāśau śrāvaka rāśau vā pratyekabuddha rāśau vā buddha rāśau vā
translated: He said: In which group is he definite - in the group of śrāvakas, in the group of pratyekabuddhas, or in the group of Buddhas?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: na subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ śrāvakabhūmau vā niyataḥ pratyekabuddhabhūmau vā /
analyzed: na subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śrāvaka bhūmau vā niyataḥ pratyekabuddha bhūmau vā
translated: Subhuti, a bodhisattva great being is not definite in the stage of śrāvakas or in the stage of pratyekabuddhas.

original: buddhabhūmau subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo niyataḥ /
analyzed: buddha bhūmau subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ niyataḥ
translated: Subhuti, a bodhisattva great being is definite in the stage of Buddhas.

original: āha / kiṃ punar bhagavan prathamacittotpādiko bodhisattvo mahāsattvo niyata utāho 'vaivartikaḥ utāho caramabhavikaḥ /
analyzed: āha kim punar bhagavan prathama citta utpādikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ niyataḥ uta aho vaivartikaḥ uta aho caramabhavikaḥ
translated: He said: Again, Blessed One, is a bodhisattva great being who has produced the thought of enlightenment for the first time definite, or is one who is irreversible, or is one who is in his last existence?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: prathamacittotpādiko bodhisattvo mahāsattvo niyata avaivartiko niyataś caramabhaviko niyataḥ /
analyzed: prathama citta utpādikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ niyata avaivartikaḥ niyataḥ caramabhavikaḥ niyataḥ
translated: A bodhisattva great being who has produced the thought of enlightenment for the first time is definite, one who is irreversible is definite, and one who is in his last existence is definite.

original: āha / kiṃ punar bhagavan niyato bodhisattvo mahāsattvo apāyeṣu upapadyate /
analyzed: āha kim punar bhagavat niyataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ apāyeṣu upapadyate
translated: He said, But, Blessed One, is a determined bodhisattva-mahāsattva reborn in the lower realms?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: no hīdaṃ subhūte / tat kiṃ manyase subhūte api nv aṣṭamako vā srotaāpanno vā sakṛdāgāmī vā anāgāmī vā arhan vā pratyekabuddho vā apāyeṣu upapadyate /
analyzed: no hi idam subhūte tat kim manyase subhūte api nu aṣṭamakaḥ vā srotaāpannaḥ vā sakṛdāgāmī vā anāgāmī vā arhan vā pratyekabuddhaḥ vā apāyeṣu upapadyate
translated: No, Subhūti. What do you think, Subhūti, is an eighth-stage [practitioner], a stream-enterer, once-returner, non-returner, arhat, or pratyekabuddha reborn in the lower realms?

original: āha / no hīdaṃ bhagavan /
analyzed: āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: He said, No, Blessed One.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evam eva subhūte yo bodhisattvo mahāsattva prathamacittotpādam upādāya dānaṃ dadañc
analyzed: evam eva subhūte yaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva prathama citta utpādam upādāya dānam dadan
translated: Just so, Subhūti, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who, from the first production of the thought of enlightenment, gives gifts,

original: chīlaṃ rakṣan kṣāntyā saṃpādayan vīryaṃ vārabhamāṇaḥ samādhiṃ samāpadyamānaḥ prajñāṃ
analyzed: śīlam rakṣan kṣāntyā saṃpādayan vīryam vā ārabhamāṇaḥ samādhim samāpadyamānaḥ prajñām
translated: guards morality, perfects patience, exerts vigor, enters into concentration, develops wisdom,

original: bhāvayaṃ / maitrīkaruṇāmuditāupekṣāṃ sarvasattveṣu bhāvayati sarva akuśaladharmaprahāṇāya
analyzed: bhāvayan maitrī karuṇā muditā aupekṣām sarva sattveṣu bhāvayati sarva akuśala dharma prahāṇāya
translated: and cultivates loving-kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity towards all beings in order to abandon all unwholesome dharmas,

original: tiṣṭhati / so 'pāyeṣu upapadyeta iti nedaṃ sthānaṃ vidyate / dīrghāyuṣkeṣu vā deveṣu
analyzed: tiṣṭhati saḥ u pāyeṣu upapadyeta iti na idam sthānam vidyate dīrgha āyuṣkeṣu vā deveṣu
translated: and abides [in those practices] - it is not possible that he would be reborn in the lower realms or among the long-lived gods.

original: upapadyeta iti nedaṃ sthānaṃ vidyate / yatra vā apracāraḥ kuśaladharmāṇām eḍamūkeṣu🔽vā janapadeṣu upapadyeta iti / nedaṃ sthānaṃ vidyate / dasyuṣu mleccheṣu pratyanteṣu
analyzed: upapadyeta iti na idam sthānam vidyate yatra vā a pracāraḥ kuśala dharmāṇām eḍamūkeṣu  vā janapadeṣu upapadyeta iti na idam sthānam vidyate dasyuṣu mleccheṣu pratyanteṣu
translated: It is not possible that he would be born in a place where wholesome dharmas do not circulate,🔽in border regions or among barbarians,

original: vā janapadeṣu upapadyeta iti / yatra agatiś catasṛṇāṃ parṣadan nedaṃ sthānaṃ vidyate /
analyzed: vā janapadeṣu upapadyeta iti yatra agatiḥ catasṛṇām na idam sthānam vidyate
translated: in a place where the four assemblies do not go,

original: mithyādṛṣṭikeṣu vā kuleṣu upapadyeta iti nedaṃ sthānaṃ vidyate / tatra ca upapadyeta
analyzed: mithyādṛṣṭikeṣu vā kuleṣu upapadyeta iti na idam sthānam vidyate tatra ca upapadyeta
translated: or in a family with wrong views, it is not possible. And he would be born there,

original: yatra na buddhaśabdo na dharmaśabdo na saṃghaśabda iti nedaṃ sthānaṃ AdSPG II
analyzed: yatra na buddha śabdaḥ na dharma śabdaḥ na saṃgha śabdaḥ iti na idam sthānam
translated: where there is no sound of the Buddha, no sound of the Dharma, no sound of the Sangha, it is not possible.

original: vidyate / akriyādṛṣṭiṃ vā pated iti nedaṃ sthānaṃ vidyate / api tu khalu subhūte prathamacittotpādam
analyzed: vidyate akriyā dṛṣṭim vā patet iti na idam sthānam vidyate api tu khalu subhūte prathama citta utpādam
translated: Or he would fall into the view of nihilism, it is not possible. But, Subhuti, from the first production of the thought

original: upādāya bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nuttarasyai samyaksaṃbodhaye saṃprasthitaḥ adhyāśayena /
analyzed: upādāya bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nuttarasyai samyaksaṃbodhaye saṃprasthitaḥ adhyāśayena
translated: onwards, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who has set out for the supreme enlightenment with a superior intention,

original: dasākuśalāḥ karmapathān adhyāpadyeta iti nedaṃ sthānaṃ vidyate /
analyzed: karma pathān adhyāpadyeta iti na idam sthānam vidyate
translated: it is not possible that he would take up the ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: āha / yadi bhagavam bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ evaṃ kuśalamūlasamanvāgataḥ yaduta apratirūpeṣu
analyzed: āha yadi bhagavam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam kuśala mūla samanvāgataḥ yat uta apratirūpeṣu
translated: He said: If, Blessed One, a bodhisattva mahāsattva is endowed with such wholesome roots, namely, in unsuitable🔽

original: sthāneṣu nopapadyate / tad yāni imāni tathāgatena ātmanas tiryaggatijātakāni nirdiṣṭāni /
analyzed: sthāneṣu na upapadyate tat yāni imāni tathāgatena ātmanaḥ tiryaggati jātakāni nirdiṣṭāni
translated: He said: If, Blessed One, a bodhisattva mahāsattva is endowed with such wholesome roots, namely, that he is not reborn in inappropriate places, then why did the Tathāgata, in regard to himself, indicate births in the animal realm?

original: imāni punas tatra kuśalamūlaṃ kva gatāni /
analyzed: imāni punar tatra kuśala mūlam kva gatāni
translated: Where have those wholesome roots gone?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: na punaḥ subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'śubhenakarmaṇā tiryaggatāv upadadyate / api
analyzed: na punar subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śubhena karmaṇā tiryaggatau upadadyate api
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva is not reborn in the animal realm due to unwholesome actions. Rather,

original: tu yena yena ātmabhāvena sattvānām arthaḥ kartavyaṃs taṃ tam eva ātmabhāvaṃ saṃcintya🔽sattvānām arthāya parigṛhṇāti / kiṃ punaḥ subhūte asty arhatāṃ vā pratyekabuddhānāṃ
analyzed: tu yena yena ātma bhāvena sattvānām arthaḥ kartavyaḥ tam tam eva ātma bhāvam saṃcintya  sattvānām arthāya parigṛhṇāti kim punar subhūte asti arhatām vā pratyekabuddhānām
translated: whatever form of existence is necessary for the benefit of beings, that very form of existence he deliberately takes up

original: vā tad upāyakauśalaṃ yena upāyakauśalena f / samanvāgatas upapannaḥ syāt /
analyzed: vā tat upāya kauśalam yena upāya kauśalena f samanvāgataḥ syāt
translated: for the benefit of beings. Moreover, Subhūti, do the Arhats or Pratyekabuddhas have that skillful means, endowed with which one would be reborn?

original: āha / no bhagavan /
analyzed: āha naḥ bhagavan
translated: He said: No, Blessed One.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tathāgatasya tad upāyakauśalam asti yena tatra upapannaḥ syād / ye 'sya vadhāya parākramanti
analyzed: tathāgatasya tat upāya kauśalam asti yena tatra upapannaḥ syāt ye vadhāya parākramanti
translated: The Tathāgata has that skillful means by which he would be reborn there, and those who attack him for the sake of killing him

original: tān anuttarāyāṃ kṣāntau samādāpayati vinayati pratiṣṭhāpayati / teṣāṃ sattvānām eva
analyzed: tān anuttarāyām kṣāntau samādāpayati vinayati pratiṣṭhāpayati teṣām sattvānām eva
translated: He encourages them, trains them, and establishes them in the supreme patience. For the sake of those very beings,

original: arthāya ātmānaṃ ca parityajati / na ca teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ viheṭhaṃ karoti / tad anena
analyzed: arthāya ātmānam ca parityajati na ca teṣām sattvānām viheṭham karoti tat anena
translated: he gives up his own self and does not harm those beings. By this

original: te subhūte paryāyeṇaivaṃ veditavyaṃ / yathā bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sattvānām arthāya
analyzed: te subhūte paryāyeṇa evam veditavyam yathā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sattvānām arthāya
translated: method, Subhūti, it should be known that the bodhisattva mahāsattva,

original: mahākaruṇāṃ paripūrayann anuttarasyai samyaksaṃbodhaye tiryagyonāv vyupapadyate /
analyzed: mahā karuṇām paripūrayan anuttarasyai samyaksaṃbodhaye tiryagyonau vyupapadyate
translated: in order to fulfill the great compassion for the sake of beings, is reborn in the animal realm for the sake of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: na ca tiryagyonigatair dosair lipyate /
analyzed: na ca tiryagyoni gataiḥ dosaiḥ lipyate
translated: And he is not tainted by the faults of the animal realm.

original: āha / katameṣu bhagavaṃ kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu sthitvā bodhisattvo mahāsattva imān evaṃrūpān ātmabhāvān parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: āha katameṣu bhagavan kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu sthitvā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imān evaṃrūpān ātmabhāvān parigṛhṇāti
translated: He said: In which wholesome dharmas should the bodhisattva mahāsattva stand in order to take on such forms?

original: bhagavān āha /🔽katamaṃ subhūte kuśalo dharmo yo bodhisattvena AdSPG II
analyzed: bhagavān āha  katamam subhūte kuśalaḥ dharmaḥ yaḥ bodhisattvena
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: mahāsattvena na paripūrayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: mahāsattvena na paripūrayitavyāḥ
translated: Subhūti, which wholesome dharma should not be fulfilled by the bodhisattva mahāsattva?

original: sarvakuśaladharmaparipūrir anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhi / tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena
analyzed: sarva kuśala dharma paripūriḥ anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhi tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena
translated: The fulfillment of all wholesome dharmas is unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. By that bodhisattva mahāsattva,

original: prathamacittotpādam upādāya yāvad bodhimaṇḍaniṣaṇṇena na kaścit kuśalo dharmo yo
analyzed: prathama citta utpādam upādāya yāvat bodhimaṇḍa niṣaṇṇena na kaścid kuśalaḥ dharmaḥ yaḥ
translated: From the production of the first thought up to sitting on the seat of awakening, there is no wholesome dharma

original: na paripūrayitavyaḥ / na hi sa kaścit kuśalo dharmo yena aparipūritena anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhir
analyzed: na paripūrayitavyaḥ na hi sa kaścid kuśalaḥ dharmaḥ yena a paripūritena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhiḥ
translated: that is not to be perfected by him. For there is no wholesome dharma that, if not perfected,

original: abhisaṃbudhyeta nedaṃ sthānaṃ vidyate / tasmāt tarhi subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena
analyzed: abhisaṃbudhyeta na idam sthānam vidyate tasmāt tarhi subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena
translated: he would awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. There is no such possibility. Therefore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva

original: prathamacittotpādam upādāya sarvakuśaladharmaparipūryaiḥ śikṣitavyaṃ / yatra śikṣitvā
analyzed: prathama citta utpādam upādāya sarva kuśala dharma paripūryaiḥ śikṣitavyam yatra śikṣitvā
translated: should train in perfecting all wholesome dharmas from the production of the first thought, having trained in which

original: sarvākārajñatām anuprāpnoti / sarvavāsanānusandhiṃ prahāsyati /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tām anuprāpnoti sarva vāsanā anusandhim prahāsyati
translated: he will attain the knowledge of all aspects and abandon all the latent tendencies.

original: āha / kathaṃ punar bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvas tāvac chukladharmasamanvāgataḥ āryeṇa anāsraveṇa dharmeṇa apāyeṣu upapadyate / tiryagyonau
analyzed: āha katham punar bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tāvat śukla dharma samanvāgataḥ āryeṇa anāsraveṇa dharmeṇa apāyeṣu upapadyate tiryagyonau
translated: He said: But how, Blessed One, can a bodhisattva mahāsattva endowed with such wholesome qualities, with an āryan, undefiled dharma, be reborn in the lower realms, in the animal realm,🔽or in the world of Yama?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kiṃ punar / subhūte tathāgata āryo 'nāsravaḥ /
analyzed: kim punar subhūte tathāgataḥ āryaḥ na āsravaḥ
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, is the Tathāgata āryan and undefiled?

original: āha / evam etad bhagavann evam etat sugataḥ / āryo 'nāsravas tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: āha evam etat bhagavan evam etat sugataḥ āryaḥ na āsravaḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: He said: Thus it is, Blessed One, thus it is, Sugata. The Tathāgata is āryan and undefiled.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kiṃ punas tathāgatas tairyagyonikaṃ prāṇinam abhinirmimītaḥ yam abhinirmāya buddhakāryaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: kim punar tathāgataḥ tairyagyonikam prāṇinam abhinirmimītaḥ yam abhinirmāya buddha kāryam kuryāt
translated: But would a Tathāgata create a being born as an animal, having created whom he would perform the activity of a Buddha?

original: āha / kuryād bhagavan /
analyzed: āha kuryāt bhagavan
translated: He said, Yes, Blessed One.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: kiṃ punas tathāgatas tairyagyoniko bhavet /
analyzed: kim punar tathāgataḥ tairyagyonikaḥ bhavet
translated: But would a Tathāgata become one born as an animal?

original: āha / no hīdaṃ bhagavan /
analyzed: āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: He said, No, Blessed One.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: kiṃ punas tathāgatas tairyagyonikaṃ duḥkhaṃ pratyanubhavet /
analyzed: kim punar tathāgataḥ tairyagyonikam duḥkham pratyanubhavet
translated: But would a Tathāgata experience the suffering of one born as an animal?

original: āha / no hīdaṃ bhagavan /
analyzed: āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: He said, No, Blessed One.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: evam eva subhūte āryeṇa anāsraveṇa dharmeṇa samanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ saṃcintya
analyzed: evam eva subhūte āryeṇa anāsraveṇa dharmeṇa samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ saṃcintya
translated: In just the same way, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva endowed with the noble, untainted Dharma deliberately

original: tathārūpam ātmabhāvaṃ parigṛhṇāti / yena ātmabhāvena sattvān paripācayati / yathārhaṃ yathāyogyaṃ /
analyzed: tathārūpam ātma bhāvam parigṛhṇāti yena ātma bhāvena sattvān paripācayati yathārham yathāyogyam
translated: takes on a body of such a kind, by which body he brings beings to maturity, as is appropriate and fitting.

original: āha / kiṃ punar bhagavann arhan nirmitam abhinirmiṇoti / yo 'bhinirmito 'rhankarma kuryād /
analyzed: āha kim punar bhagavan arhan nirmitam abhinirmiṇoti yaḥ bhinirmitaḥ rhan karma kuryāt
translated: He said, But, Blessed One, does an arhat create an emanation, having created whom the arhat would perform an action,

original: yena karmaṇā parasya prītiṃ jānayet /
analyzed: yena karmaṇā parasya prītim jānayet
translated: by which action he would cause another to experience joy?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: evam etat subhūte evam etat / evam eva bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ āryeṇa anāsraveṇa dharmeṇa samanvāgataḥ saṃcintya AdSPG II
analyzed: evam etat subhūte evam etat evam eva bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ āryeṇa anāsraveṇa dharmeṇa samanvāgataḥ saṃcintya
translated: Thus it is, Subhūti, thus it is. Just so, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, endowed with the noble, uncontaminated Dharma,

original: tathārūpam ātmabhāvaṃ parigṛhṇāti / yena ātmabhāvena sattvānāṃ buddhakāryaṃ karoti /
analyzed: tathārūpam ātma bhāvam parigṛhṇāti yena ātma bhāvena sattvānām buddha kāryam karoti
translated: intentionally takes on such a form, by which form he performs the Buddha's work for beings.

original: na ca tena tathārūpeṇa ātmabhāvena duḥkhito bhavati / na duḥkhāṃ vedanāṃ pratyanubhavati /
analyzed: na ca tena tathārūpeṇa ātma bhāvena duḥkhitaḥ bhavati na duḥkhām vedanām pratyanubhavati
translated: And he is not afflicted by that kind of form, he does not experience painful feeling.

original: tat kiṃ manyase subhūte yāṃ māyākāro māyān darśayati / hastivigrahāṃ vā aśvavigrahāṃ🔽vā balīvardavigrahāṃ vā anyāṃ vā vividhāṃ māyāṃ darśayati / api nu te hastivigrahā
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte yām māyākāraḥ māyān darśayati hasti vigrahām vā aśva vigrahām  vā balīvarda vigrahām vā anyām vā vividhām māyām darśayati api nu te hasti vigrahā
translated: What do you think, Subhūti, does the magician show illusions in the form of elephants,🔽or in the form of horses, or in the form of bulls, or in other various forms of illusions? Are those forms of elephants,

original: bhavanty aśvavigrahā vā valīvardavigrahā vā anyā vā vividhā prāṇijātaya /
analyzed: bhavanti aśva vigrahāḥ vā valīvarda vigrahāḥ vā anyāḥ vā vividhā prāṇi jātayaḥ
translated: horses, bulls, or other various kinds of living beings real?

original: āha / no hīdaṃ bhagavaṃ /
analyzed: āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: He said: No indeed, Blessed One.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evam eva subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattva āryeṇa anāsraveṇa dharmeṇa samanvāgato bhavati /
analyzed: evam eva subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ āryeṇa anāsraveṇa dharmeṇa samanvāgataḥ bhavati
translated: Just so, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva is endowed with the noble, uncontaminated Dharma.

original: saṃcintya tathārūpam ātmabhāvaṃ parigṛhṇāti / yathārūpeṇa ātmabhāvena sattvānām arthaṃ
analyzed: saṃcintya tathārūpam ātma bhāvam parigṛhṇāti yathārūpeṇa ātma bhāvena sattvānām artham
translated: He deliberately takes up a body of such a kind by which he can benefit beings with that kind of body,

original: karoti / na ca tathārūpāṃ vedanāṃ pratyanubhavati /
analyzed: karoti na ca tathārūpām vedanām pratyanubhavati
translated: and he does not experience that kind of feeling.

original: athāyuṣmān subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One:

original: mahopāyakauśalaṃ bhagavaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya yo hi nāma bhagavann āryeṇa
analyzed: mahā upāya kauśalam bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya yaḥ hi nāma bhagavan āryeṇa
translated: Blessed One, the bodhisattva mahāsattva has great skill in means, in that, Blessed One, endowed with the noble

original: jñānena samanvāgato yena yena ātmabhāvena śaknoti sattvānām arthaḥ kartuṃ taṃ tam
analyzed: jñānena samanvāgataḥ yena yena ātma bhāvena śaknoti sattvānām arthaḥ kartum tam tam
translated: knowledge, he takes up that very body by which he is able to benefit beings,

original: eva ātmabhāvaṃ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: eva ātma bhāvam parigṛhṇāti
translated: that very body.

original: VIII / katameṣu bhagavaṃc chukleṣu dharmeṣu sthitvā bodhisattvo mahāsattvo f / imāny evaṃrūpāny upāyakauśalāni karoti na ca tair
analyzed: katameṣu bhagavan śukleṣu dharmeṣu sthitvā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imāni evaṃrūpāni upāya kauśalāni karoti na ca taiḥ
translated: Blessed One, in which wholesome dharmas does the bodhisattva mahāsattva stand, and by which he performs these kinds of skillful means, and by which he does not fall

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ subhūte sthitvā bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ imāny evaṃrūpāny upāyakauśalāni
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām subhūte sthitvā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imāni evaṃrūpāni upāya kauśalāni
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, standing in the perfection of wisdom, performs these kinds of skillful means,

original: karoti / yair upāyakauśalai pūrvasyān diśi dakṣiṇāyāṃ paścimāyām uttarasyām adhastāt
analyzed: karoti yaiḥ upāya kauśalaiḥ diśi dakṣiṇāyām paścimāyām uttarasyām adhastāt
translated: by which skillful means in the eastern direction, in the southern, western, northern, below,

original: tiryak samantād daśasu dikṣv aikaikasyān diśi gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu lokadhātuṣu sattvānāṃ
analyzed: tiryak samantāt daśasu dikṣu ā ekaikasyān diśi gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu lokadhātuṣu sattvānām
translated: He performs deeds for the sake of beings in the ten directions, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, in each direction.

original: kṛtyaṃ karoti / na ca tena tatra kiṃcit saṃspṛśyate / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: kṛtyam karoti na ca tena tatra kiṃcid saṃspṛśyate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: And he is not at all touched by that. Why is that?

original: tathā hi sa bodhisattvo mahāsattva sarvathaiva dharmaṃ nopalabhate / yo vā saṃspṛśyeta yena vā saṃpṛśyeta yatra vā saṃspṛśyeta / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi sa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva sarvathā eva dharmam na upalabhate yaḥ vā saṃspṛśyeta yena vā saṃpṛśyeta yatra vā saṃspṛśyeta tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because that bodhisattva mahāsattva does not apprehend in any way at all the Dharma by which he would be touched, by which he would touch, or by which he would touch. Why is that?

original: tathā hi sarva ete trayo dharmāḥ svabhāvena śūnyāḥ / na ca śūnyatā śūnyatāṃ saṃspṛśati / na api śūnyatāṃ kaścid dharma saṃspṛśati / na api śūnyatā
analyzed: tathā hi sarve ete trayaḥ dharmāḥ svabhāvena śūnyāḥ na ca śūnyatā śūnyatām saṃspṛśati na api śūnyatām kaścid dharma saṃspṛśati na api śūnyatā
translated: Because all these three dharmas are empty of their own intrinsic nature. And emptiness does not touch emptiness. And no dharma touches emptiness. And emptiness

original: saṃspṛśyate / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: saṃspṛśyate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: is not touched. Why is that?

original: tathā hi śūnyatā śūnyatāyāṃ nopalabhyate / iyaṃ AdSPG II
analyzed: tathā hi śūnyatā śūnyatāyām na upalabhyate iyam
translated: Because emptiness is not apprehended in emptiness. This is

original: sā anupalaṃbhaśūnyatā yatra sthitvā bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate /
analyzed: sā anupalaṃbha śūnyatā yatra sthitvā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: the emptiness of non-apprehension, in which the bodhisattva mahāsattva, having stood, fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: āha / kiṃ punar bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyām eva sthitvā na anyeṣu dharmeṣu /
analyzed: āha kim punar bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyām eva sthitvā na anyeṣu dharmeṣu
translated: He said, But, Blessed One, does one abide in the perfection of wisdom alone, not in other dharmas?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: asti punaḥ subhūte kaścid dharmo yo na prajñāpāramitāyām antargataḥ /
analyzed: asti punar subhūte kaścid dharmaḥ yaḥ na prajñāpāramitāyām antargataḥ
translated: Subhūti, is there any dharma that is not included in the perfection of wisdom?

original: āha / yadi bhagavaṃ / prajñāpāramitā svabhāvena śūnyā kathaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sarvadharmā antargatā /
analyzed: āha yadi bhagavam prajñāpāramitā svabhāvena śūnyā katham prajñāpāramitāyām sarva dharmāḥ antargatā
translated: He said, Blessed One, if the perfection of wisdom is empty by its intrinsic nature, how are all dharmas included in the perfection of wisdom?

original: na ca bhagavaṃc chūnyatāyāṃ kaścid dharmo 'ntargato vā na vā antargataḥ /
analyzed: na ca bhagavan śūnyatāyām kaścid dharmaḥ ntargataḥ vā na vā antargataḥ
translated: And, Blessed One, in emptiness no dharma is included or not included.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: na punaḥ subhūte sarvadharmā sarvadharmaiḥ śūnyāḥ /
analyzed: na punar subhūte sarva dharmā sarva dharmaiḥ śūnyāḥ
translated: Subhūti, are not all dharmas empty of all dharmas?

original: āha / śūnyā bhagavaṃ /
analyzed: āha śūnyā bhagavan
translated: He said, Empty, Blessed One.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: yadi subhūte sarvadharmāḥ sarvadharmaiḥ śūnyā /
analyzed: yadi subhūte sarva dharmāḥ sarva dharmaiḥ śūnyā
translated: Subhūti, if all dharmas are empty of all dharmas,

original: na nu sarvadharmā śūnyatāyām antargatā /
analyzed: na nu sarva dharmā śūnyatāyām antargatā
translated: are not all dharmas included in emptiness?

original: āha / evam etad bhagavan /
analyzed: āha evam etat bhagavan
translated: He said, So it is, Blessed One.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tad anena subhūte paryāyeṇa evaṃ veditavyaṃ /
analyzed: tat anena subhūte paryāyeṇa evam veditavyam
translated: By this method, Subhūti, it should be known that

original: yat prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthitvā bodhisattvo mahāsattva idam evaṃrūpam upāyakauśalaṃ kurute /
analyzed: yat prajñāpāramitāyām sthitvā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ idam evaṃrūpam upāya kauśalam kurute
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva, having stood in the perfection of wisdom, performs this kind of skillful means.

original: VIII / athāyuṣmān subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Subhuti said this to the Blessed One:

original: kathaṃ bhagavaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattva prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran sarvadharmaśūnyatāyāṃ sthitvā abhijñāpāramitām abhinirmāti /
analyzed: katham bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva prajñāpāramitāyām caran sarva dharma śūnyatāyām sthitvā abhijñāpāramitām abhinirmāti
translated: Blessed One, how does a bodhisattva-mahāsattva, practicing the perfection of wisdom, abiding in the emptiness of all phenomena, manifest the perfection of the superknowledges?

original: yāsv abhijñāsu sthitvā pūrvasyān diśi gaṅgānadīvālukopamān lokadhātūn gacchati / tatra
analyzed: yāsu abhijñāsu sthitvā pūrvasyān diśi gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān lokadhātūn gacchati tatra
translated: In which superknowledges, abiding, he goes to the world systems in the eastern direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river,

original: lokadhātuṣu ye buddhā bhagavantas tiṣṭhanti dhṛyante yāpayanti dharmañ ca deśayanti
analyzed: lokadhātuṣu ye buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti dhṛyante yāpayanti dharmam ca deśayanti
translated: in those world systems, the Blessed Buddhas who are present, supporting, maintaining, teaching the Dharma,

original: tāṃ / paryupāste dharmaṃ ca śṛṇoti / tatra ca buddheṣu bhagavatsu kuśalamūlāny avaropayati /
analyzed: tām paryupāste dharmam ca śṛṇoti tatra ca buddheṣu bhagavatsu kuśala mūlāni avaropayati
translated: he attends on them, listens to the Dharma, and plants wholesome roots there in the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to the Venerable Subhuti:

original: iha subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattva prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran ye pūrvasyān diśi gaṅgānadīvālukopamān
analyzed: iha subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva prajñāpāramitāyām caran ye pūrvasyān diśi gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān
translated: Here, Subhuti, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva, practicing the perfection of wisdom, those world systems in the eastern direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river,

original: lokadhātavas tāṃ sarvāṃ śūnyā iti paśyati / ye 'pi tatra buddhā bhagavantas te 'pi
analyzed: lokadhātavaḥ tām sarvām śūnyāḥ iti paśyati ye pi tatra buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ te pi
translated: all of them he sees as empty, and those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones who are there,

original: buddhā bhagavantas anyatra nāmasaṃketena prajñaptim upādāya nirdiśyante /
analyzed: buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ anyatra nāma saṃketena prajñaptim upādāya nirdiśyante
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are designated by other names and conventional expressions.

original: sarvāḥ prajñapti svabhāvena śūnyāḥ /
analyzed: sarvāḥ prajñapti svabhāvena śūnyāḥ
translated: All conventional expressions are empty by nature.

original: yadi te lokadhātavo na svabhāvena śūnyāḥ abhaviṣyaṃs /
analyzed: yadi te lokadhātavaḥ na svabhāvena śūnyāḥ abhaviṣyan
translated: If those world systems were not empty by nature,

original: te 'pi buddhā bhagavanto na svabhāvena śūnyā abhaviṣyaṃs /
analyzed: te pi buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ na svabhāvena śūnyāḥ abhaviṣyan
translated: those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, would not be empty by nature.

original: te 'pi prajñaptisamudācārā na svabhāvena śūnyā AdSPG II 🔽abhaviṣyaṃs /
analyzed: te pi prajñapti samudācārāḥ na svabhāvena śūnyāḥ  abhaviṣyan
translated: Those conventional expressions would not be empty by nature.

original: tat prādesikī śūnyatābhaviṣyat / yasmān na prādeśikī śūnyatā tasmāt sarvadharmāḥ sarvadharmaiḥ śūnyāḥ /
analyzed: tat prādesikī śūnyatā abhaviṣyat yasmāt na prādeśikī śūnyatā tasmāt sarva dharmāḥ sarva dharmaiḥ śūnyāḥ
translated: That would be a limited emptiness. Since emptiness is not limited, therefore all dharmas are empty of all dharmas.

original: tad bodhisattvo mahāsattva upāyakauśalena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann abhijñāpāramitām
analyzed: tat bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ upāya kauśalena prajñāpāramitāyām caran abhijñāpāramitām
translated: That Bodhisattva Mahasattva, practicing the perfection of wisdom through skillful means, accomplishes the perfection of the higher knowledges.

original: abhinirharati / yāsv abhijñāsu sthitvā divyaṃ cakṣur abhinirharati / divyaśrotram ṛddhiṃ
analyzed: abhinirharati yāsu abhijñāsu sthitvā divyam cakṣuḥ abhinirharati divya śrotram ṛddhim
translated: Abiding in those higher knowledges, he accomplishes the divine eye, the divine ear,

original: paracittajñānaṃ / pūrve nivāsaṃ cyutopapattiṃ /
analyzed: para citta jñānam pūrve nivāsam cyuta upapattim
translated: the knowledge of others' minds, the recollection of past abodes, and rebirth.

original: na ca vinā abhijñābhir bodhisattvena mahāsattvena śakyam anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhir abhisaṃboddhuṃ / ///
analyzed: na ca vinā abhijñābhiḥ bodhisattvena mahāsattvena śakyam anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ abhisaṃboddhum
translated: And without the superknowledges, a Bodhisattva, a great being, is not able to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: b missing / / /
analyzed: b missing
translated: [missing text]

original: f / tasmād bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya abhijñāpāramitāyāṃ bodhir antargatā /
analyzed: tasmāt bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya abhijñāpāramitāyām bodhiḥ antargatā
translated: Therefore, in the perfection of the superknowledges, enlightenment is included for a Bodhisattva, a great being.

original: tebhir eva abhijñābhir bodhir mārgayitavyā /
analyzed: tebhiḥ eva abhijñābhiḥ bodhiḥ mārgayitavyā
translated: Enlightenment should be sought through just those superknowledges.

original: sa mārgayamāṇo divyena cakṣuṣā ātmanas tān kuśalān dharmān paśyati / paraṃ ca kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu niyojayati / na ca teṣu kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu abhiniveṣṭhate /
analyzed: sa mārgayamāṇaḥ divyena cakṣuṣā ātmanaḥ tān kuśalān dharmān paśyati param ca kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu niyojayati na ca teṣu kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu abhiniveṣṭhate  /
translated: While seeking, with the divine eye he sees those wholesome dharmas in himself, and he engages others in wholesome dharmas. And he does not settle down on those wholesome dharmas.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hi te sarve kuśalā dharmāḥ svabhāvena śūnyā / na hi śūnyatāyā kvacid abhiniviśate /
analyzed: tathā hi te sarve kuśalāḥ dharmāḥ svabhāvena śūnyāḥ na hi śūnyatāyāḥ kvacid abhiniviśate
translated: Because all those wholesome dharmas are empty of their own inherent nature. For emptiness does not settle down anywhere.

original: yad abhiniviśya āsvādayet / nirāsvādā hi śūnyatā / tad bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: yat abhiniviśya āsvādayet nirāsvādā hi śūnyatā tat bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: On what it might settle down and enjoy, since emptiness is without enjoyment. That Bodhisattva, that great being, practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: caran divyaṃ cakṣur abhinirharati / yena divyena cakṣuṣā sarvadharmāṃc chūnyā iti paśyati /
analyzed: caran divyam cakṣuḥ abhinirharati yena divyena cakṣuṣā sarva dharmān śūnyāḥ iti paśyati
translated: produces the divine eye, by which divine eye he sees all dharmas as empty.

original: tat punar bodhisattvo mahāsattvas tān dharmatām āgamya karma abhiniropayati / yayā
analyzed: tat punar bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tān dharmatām āgamya karma abhiniropayati yayā
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, having come to that dharmatā, performs actions.

original: karmābhiniruptyā sattvānān dharman deśayati / na punaḥ sattvaṃ na sattvaprajñaptim
analyzed: karma abhiniruptyā dharman deśayati na punar sattvam na sattva prajñaptim
translated: By performing those actions, he teaches the Dharma to beings, but he does not perceive a being or the designation of a being.

original: upalabhate / ity anupalaṃbhayogena bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ abhijñāpāramitām abhinirmāti /
analyzed: upalabhate iti an upalaṃbha yogena bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ abhijñāpāramitām abhinirmāti
translated: Thus, by the yoga of non-apprehension, the bodhisattva mahāsattva creates the perfection of the higher knowledges.

original: yābhir abhijñābhir ye 'bhijñākaraṇīyān dharmān tān karoti / tatra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo
analyzed: yābhiḥ abhijñābhiḥ ye bhijñā karaṇīyān dharmān tān karoti tatra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: By means of those higher knowledges, he performs those dharmas that are to be performed by the higher knowledges. There, the bodhisattva mahāsattva,

original: divyena cakṣuṣā viśuddhena atikrāntamānuṣyakeṇa pūrvasyāṃ diśi dakṣiṇasyāṃ paścimāyām
analyzed: divyena cakṣuṣā viśuddhena atikrānta mānuṣyakeṇa pūrvasyām diśi dakṣiṇasyām paścimāyām
translated: with the divine eye which is pure, surpassing that of men, sees in the eastern direction, in the southern direction, in the western direction,

original: uttarasyām adhastād diśi vidikṣv ūrdhvam tiryag lokadhātūṃ paśyati / sa tatra
analyzed: uttarasyām adhastāt diśi vidikṣu ūrdhvam tiryak lokadhātūm paśyati sa tatra
translated: in the northern direction, below, above, in the intermediate directions, in the world systems. He,

original: ṛdhyā gatvā sattvānām arthaṃ AdSPG II
analyzed: ṛdhyā gatvā sattvānām artham
translated: having gone there by his magical power, performs the welfare of beings.

original: karoti / yadi vā dānena yadi vā śīlena yadi vā kṣāntyā yadi vā vīryeṇa yadi vā samādhmā
analyzed: karoti yadi vā dānena yadi vā śīlena yadi vā kṣāntyā yadi vā vīryeṇa yadi vā samādhmā
translated: Whether by generosity, or by morality, or by patience, or by vigor, or by concentration,

original: yadi vā prajñāyā yadi vā saptatṛṃśatā bodhipakṣyair dharmaiḥ yadi vā dhyānāpramāṇārūpyavimokṣasamādhisamāpattibhir
analyzed: yadi vā prajñāyāḥ yadi vā saptatṛṃśatā bodhi pakṣyaiḥ dharmaiḥ yadi vā dhyāna apramāṇa ārūpya vimokṣa samādhi samāpattibhiḥ
translated: Whether it is through wisdom, or through the thirty-seven factors of awakening, or through the concentrations, immeasurables, liberations, meditative absorptions, and attainments,

original: yadi vā śrāvakadharmair yadi vā / pratyekabuddhadharmair yadi vā bodhisattvadharmair
analyzed: yadi vā śrāvaka dharmaiḥ yadi vā pratyekabuddha dharmaiḥ yadi vā bodhisattva dharmaiḥ
translated: whether it is through the dharmas of the disciples, or through the dharmas of the solitary buddhas, or through the dharmas of the bodhisattvas,

original: yadi vā buddhadharmais teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ kṛtyakaro bhavati / tatra ye sattvā matsariṇas
analyzed: yadi vā buddha dharmaiḥ teṣām sattvānām kṛtya karaḥ bhavati tatra ye sattvāḥ matsariṇaḥ
translated: or through the dharmas of the buddhas, he becomes one who accomplishes the aims of those beings. Among them, those beings who are stingy,

original: teṣām evan dharman deśayati / dadadhvad dānan /
analyzed: teṣām evan dharman deśayati dadadhvat dānan
translated: he teaches the Dharma to them like this: 'Give gifts!

original: duḥkhaṃ hi dāridryaṃ /
analyzed: duḥkham hi dāridryam
translated: Poverty is suffering.

original: na hi dāridryeṇa śakyam ātmano 'py arthaḥ kartuṃ / prāg eva parasya /
analyzed: na hi dāridryeṇa śakyam ātmanaḥ u pi arthaḥ kartum prāk eva parasya
translated: For one who is poor is unable to accomplish even one's own aims, let alone the aims of others.

original: tad yūyam ātmanā ca duḥkitā bhaviṣyathaḥ paraṃ ca duḥkhayiṣyatha /
analyzed: tat yūyam ātmanā ca duḥkitāḥ bhaviṣyathaḥ param ca duḥkhayiṣyatha
translated: Therefore, you will be miserable yourselves and will also make others miserable.

original: mā dāridryeṇa abhibhūtā anyonya māṃsāni khādanto na parimokṣyadhve tṛbhyo 'pāyebhyaḥ /
analyzed: mā dāridryeṇa abhibhūtāḥ anyonya māṃsāni khādantaḥ na parimokṣyadhve pāyebhyaḥ
translated: Do not, overcome by poverty, eating each other's flesh, be unable to escape from the three lower realms.'

original: ye duḥśīlā sattvās teṣām evan dharman deśayati / duḥkhaṃ hi bhoḥ puruṣā dauḥśīlyaṃ /
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ teṣām dharman deśayati duḥkham hi bhoḥ puruṣāḥ dauḥśīlyam
translated: Those beings who are of bad character, to them he teaches the Dharma like this: 'Oh men, bad character is suffering.

original: na hi duḥśīlena śakyam ātmano 'py arthaḥ kartuṃ /
analyzed: na hi duḥśīlena śakyam ātmanaḥ u pi arthaḥ kartum
translated: For one who is immoral is not able to accomplish even their own purpose,

original: prāg eva parasya / dauḥśīlyasya yo vipākaḥ sa narakā vā tiryagyonir vā yamaloko vā /
analyzed: prāk eva parasya dauḥśīlyasya yaḥ vipākaḥ sa narakāḥ vā tiryagyoniḥ vā yama lokaḥ vā
translated: let alone that of others. The result of immorality is rebirth as a hell being, an animal, or a ghost.

original: tad yūyaṃ tṛṣv apāyeṣu prapatitā / ātmānam eva na śakyā arthaṃ kartuṃ prāg eva param /
analyzed: tat yūyam tṛṣu apāyeṣu prapatitāḥ ātmānam eva na śakyāḥ artham kartum prāk eva param
translated: You have fallen into those three lower realms. You are not even able to accomplish your own purpose, let alone that of others.

original: tad yuṣmābhir ekadauḥśīlyasya cittasya apy avakāśo na dātavyo /
analyzed: tat yuṣmābhiḥ eka dauḥśīlyasya cittasya api avakāśaḥ na dātavyaḥ
translated: Therefore, you should not give an opportunity even for a single thought of immorality.🔽Do not be regretful later.

original: mā paścāt tāpino 'bhūt / ye sattvās parasparaṃ vyāpannacittās teṣām evan dharman deśayati /
analyzed: mā paścāt tāpinaḥ bhūt ye sattvāḥ parasparam vyāpanna cittāḥ teṣām evan dharman deśayati
translated: For those beings who have a mind of mutual ill will, he teaches the Dharma like this:

original: mā yūyam anyonyaṃ vyāpadyadhvaṃ / kṣubhitacittānāṃ satāṃ na kaścit kuśalo dharmaḥ prādurbhavati /
analyzed: mā yūyam anyonyam vyāpadyadhvam kṣubhita cittānām satām na kaścid kuśalaḥ dharmaḥ prādurbhavati
translated: You should not have ill will toward each other. For those with a disturbed mind, no wholesome dharma arises.

original: tad yuṣmākam anyonyakṣubhitacittānāṃ satāṃ sthānam etad vidyate / yan narakopapattir bhaved vā tiryagyonir vā yamaloko vā /
analyzed: tat yuṣmākam anyonya kṣubhita cittānām satām sthānam etat vidyate yat naraka upapattiḥ bhavet vā tiryagyoniḥ vā yama lokaḥ vā
translated: Therefore, for you who have a disturbed mind toward each other, it is possible that you will be reborn in hell, as an animal, or in the realm of ghosts.

original: haṃta yuṣmābhir ekacittam api na kṣobhayitavyaṃ /
analyzed: haṃta yuṣmābhiḥ ekacittam api na kṣobhayitavyam
translated: Therefore, you should not disturb even a single thought.

original: prāg eva anyeṣāṃ akuśalānāṃ cittānām avakāśo na dātavyaḥ iti / ye kusīdās tāṃ vīrye niyojayati /
analyzed: prāk eva anyeṣām akuśalānām cittānām avakāśaḥ na dātavyaḥ iti ye kusīdāḥ tām vīrye niyojayati
translated: and even less so for other unwholesome thoughts. Those who are lazy he engages in vigor.

original: evaṃ yāvad ye vikṣiptacittās tān samādhau niyojayati / ye duṣprajñās tān prajñāyāṃ
analyzed: evam yāvat ye vikṣipta cittāḥ tān samādhau niyojayati ye duṣprajñāḥ tān prajñāyām
translated: In the same way, up to those whose minds are distracted he engages in concentration, those who are unwise he engages in wisdom.

original: niyojayati / ye rāgacaritās tān aśubhāyāṃ niyojayati / ye dveṣacaritās tāṃ maitryāṃ
analyzed: niyojayati ye rāga caritāḥ tān aśubhāyām niyojayati ye dveṣa caritāḥ tām maitryām
translated: Those who are lustful he engages in the contemplation of foulness, those who are hateful he engages in friendliness,

original: niyojayati / f / ye mohacaritās tāṃ pratītyasamutpāde niyojayati / ye kumārge
analyzed: niyojayati ye moha caritāḥ tām pratītyasamutpāde niyojayati ye ku mārge
translated: those who are deluded he engages in dependent origination. Those who have set out on a bad path he engages in the path.

original: prasthitās tān mārge niyojayati / yadi vā śrāvakamārge yadi vā pratyekabuddhamārge
analyzed: prasthitāḥ tān mārge niyojayati yadi vā śrāvaka mārge yadi vā pratyekabuddha mārge
translated: Whether he engages them in the disciple's path or in the solitary buddha's path,

original: niyojayati / teṣām evan dharman deśayati /
analyzed: niyojayati teṣām evan dharman deśayati
translated: he teaches them the Dharma like this:

original: yatra yūyam abhiniviṣṭās te dharmāḥ svabhāvena śūnyā /
analyzed: yatra yūyam abhiniviṣṭāḥ te dharmāḥ svabhāvena śūnyā
translated: Those dharmas in which you are attached are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: na hi svabhāvena śūnyeṣu dharmeṣu śakyam abhiniveṣṭuṃ / anabhiniviṣṭā ca AdSPG II
analyzed: na hi svabhāvena śūnyeṣu dharmeṣu śakyam abhiniveṣṭum an abhiniviṣṭā ca
translated: For in dharmas that are empty of intrinsic nature, it is not possible to be attached. And emptiness is not attached,

original: śūnyatā / evaṃ khalu subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann
analyzed: śūnyatā evam khalu subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran
translated: Thus, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom

original: abhijñāsu sthitvā sattvānām arthaṃ karoti / nāsti subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo yena śakyam abhijñāsv asthitvā sattvānāṃ dharman deśayituṃ /
analyzed: abhijñāsu sthitvā sattvānām artham karoti na asti subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ yena śakyam abhijñāsu a sthitvā sattvānām dharman deśayitum
translated: Having stood in the superknowledges, he works the welfare of beings. There is no bodhisattva mahāsattva, Subhūti, by whom, not having stood in the superknowledges, it is possible to teach the Dharma to beings.

original: utpathaprasthitā vā sattvā mārgam avatārayituṃ nedaṃ sthānaṃ vidyate / yathā subhūte
analyzed: utpatha prasthitāḥ vā sattvāḥ mārgam avatārayitum na idam sthānam vidyate yathā subhūte
translated: It is not possible to lead beings who have gone astray onto the path. Just as, Subhūti,

original: pakṣī śakunir apakṣako na śaknoty ākāśena krāmitum evam eva subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattva
analyzed: pakṣī śakuniḥ apakṣakaḥ na śaknoti ākāśena krāmitum evam eva subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva
translated: a bird without wings is not able to fly through the sky, in the same way, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva

original: anāgamya abhijñā na śaknoti / dharman deśayituṃ / tasmāt tarhi subhūte bodhisattvena
analyzed: an āgamya abhijñā na śaknoti dharman deśayitum tasmāt tarhi subhūte bodhisattvena
translated: who has not come to the superknowledges is not able to teach the Dharma. Therefore, Subhūti, a bodhisattva

original: mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caratā abhijñā abhinirhartavyāḥ / sa ābhir abhijñābhir
analyzed: mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām caratā abhijñāḥ abhinirhartavyāḥ saḥ ābhiḥ abhijñābhiḥ
translated: mahāsattva who is practicing the perfection of wisdom should perfect the superknowledges. He, having perfected

original: abhinirhartābhir yam ākāṅkṣiśyati sattvānām arthaṃ kartuṃ taṃ sukhina kariṣyati /
analyzed: abhinirhartā ābhiḥ yam ākāṅkṣiśyati sattvānām artham kartum tam sukhina kariṣyati
translated: those superknowledges, will be able to do the welfare of beings wherever he wishes.

original: divyena cakṣuṣā gaṅgānādīvālukopamān lokadhātūn drakṣyati / tāṃś ca tatra sattvān
analyzed: divyena cakṣuṣā gaṅgā nādī vālukā upamān lokadhātūn drakṣyati tān ca tatra sattvān
translated: With the divine eye he will see as many world systems as there are sands in the Ganges, and the beings there,🔽and

original: upapannān drakṣyati / dṛṣṭvā ca tān sattvān ṛdhyā gatvā cetasaiva cittaṃ prajñāsyati /
analyzed: upapannān drakṣyati dṛṣṭvā ca tān sattvān ṛdhyā gatvā cetasā eva cittam prajñāsyati
translated: He will see those who have been reborn. Having seen those beings, having gone to them, he will know their minds with his own mind.

original: prajñāya tathaiva dharman deśayiṣyati / yadi vā dānakathāṃ yadi vā yāvan nairyānikīṃ
analyzed: prajñāya tathā eva dharman deśayiṣyati yadi vā dāna kathām yadi vā yāvat nairyānikīm
translated: Having known, he will teach the Dharma in just that way, whether it be a discourse on generosity or up to a discourse on the way out.

original: kathāṃ / sa divyena śrotradhātunā ubhau śabdau śroṣyati / yaduta divyāṃś ca mānuṣyakāṃś
analyzed: kathām sa divyena śrotra dhātunā ubhau śabdau śroṣyati yat uta divyān ca mānuṣyakān
translated: With his divine ear-element, he will hear both sounds, namely divine and human,

original: ca / tatra ye pūrvasyāṃ diśi yāvat samantād daśasu dikṣv ekaikasyān diśi gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu
analyzed: ca tatra ye pūrvasyām diśi yāvat samantāt daśasu dikṣu ekaikasyān diśi gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu
translated: among those in the eastern direction, and so on, up to all around in the ten directions, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river,

original: lokadhātuṣu buddhā bhagavanto dharmaṃ deśayanti / sa tena divyena śrotradhātunā tān
analyzed: lokadhātuṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ dharmam deśayanti sa tena divyena śrotra dhātunā tān
translated: in each of the ten directions, where the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are teaching the Dharma. He will hear those

original: dharmān śroṣyati / śrutvā ca tathātvāya udgrahīṣyati / tathātvāya udgṛhya ananyathātvāya
analyzed: dharmān śroṣyati śrutvā ca tathātvāya udgrahīṣyati tathātvāya udgṛhya an anyathātvāya
translated: dharmas with that divine ear-element. Having heard, he will take them up as they are. Having taken them up as they are, he will teach the Dharma as it is,

original: dharman deśayiṣyati / dānakathāṃ yāvan nairyāṇikakathāṃ / tasya cetaḥparyāyajñānaṃ
analyzed: dharman deśayiṣyati dāna kathām yāvat nairyāṇika kathām tasya cetaḥparyāya jñānam
translated: without distortion, whether it be a discourse on generosity or up to a discourse on the way out. And his knowledge of the mental activity of others

original: suviśuddhaṃ bhaviṣyati / sa tena cetaḥparyāyajñānena sattvānāṃ cittaṃ prajñāsyati /
analyzed: su viśuddham bhaviṣyati sa tena cetaḥparyāya jñānena sattvānām cittam prajñāsyati
translated: will be very pure. With that knowledge of the mental activity of others, he will know the minds of beings.

original: teṣān tathātvāya dharman deśayiṣyati / dānakathāṃ yāvan nairyāṇikakathāṃ / so 'nekavidhaṃ
analyzed: teṣām tathātvāya dharman deśayiṣyati dāna kathām yāvat nairyāṇika kathām saḥ nekavidham
translated: For them, he will teach the Dharma leading to liberation, from the discourse on generosity up to the discourse on liberation. He will remember in various ways

original: pūrvenivāsam anusmariṣyati anya ātmano 'pi parasya api / sa tena pūrvenivāsānusmṛtijñānena
analyzed: pūrvenivāsam anusmariṣyati anya parasya api sa tena pūrvenivāsa anusmṛti jñānena
translated: his own and others' previous lives. By that knowledge of the recollection of past lives,

original: evaṃ jñāsyaty evaṃnāmakās te 'bhūvan / paurvakās tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā saśrāvakās /
analyzed: evam jñāsyati evaṃnāmakāḥ te bhūvan paurvakāḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā sa śrāvakāḥ
translated: he will know thus: 'Those past Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, together with their disciples, had such and such names.'

original: tatra ye sattvā pūrvenivāsānusmṛtyadhimuktā bhaviṣyanti / teṣāṃ tathātvāya dharman
analyzed: tatra ye sattvāḥ pūrvenivāsa anusmṛti adhimuktāḥ bhaviṣyanti teṣām tathātvāya dharman
translated: Among those beings who are inclined towards the recollection of past lives, he will teach the Dharma leading to liberation,

original: deśayiṣyati / dānakathāṃ yāvan nairyāṇikakathāṃ / sa ṛddhyā anekān vividhāṃ lokadhātūṃ
analyzed: deśayiṣyati dāna kathām yāvat nairyāṇika kathām saḥ ṛddhyā anekān vividhām lokadhātūm
translated: from the discourse on generosity up to the discourse on liberation. By his psychic powers, he will go to many different world systems

original: gatvā buddhāṃ bhagavataḥ paryupāsiṣyate paryupāsya abhijñānena sattvānāṃ dharman
analyzed: gatvā buddhām bhagavataḥ paryupāsiṣyate paryupāsya abhijñānena sattvānām dharman
translated: and attend upon the Blessed Buddhas. Having attended upon them, he will teach the Dharma to beings by means of the higher knowledge,

translated: He said, If this is so, Blessed One, then enlightenment is non-existence.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evam etat subhūte evam etad / yathā vadasi / abhāvaś AdSPG II 🔽ca bodhiḥ / sā na buddhaiḥ kṛtā na pratyekabuddhair na arhadbhir nāpi tair bodhisattvair mahāsattvair /
analyzed: evam etat subhūte evam etat yathā vadasi abhāvaḥ  ca bodhiḥ sā na buddhaiḥ kṛtā na pratyekabuddhaiḥ na arhadbhiḥ na api taiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ
translated: This is so, Subhuti, this is so, as you say. Enlightenment is indeed non-existence.🔽It is not made by the Buddhas, not by the Pratyekabuddhas, not by the Arhats, nor by those Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas who practice here for enlightenment, except that beings do not know and do not see it as it really is.

original: ya iha bodhāya caranti / anyatra sattvā na jānanti na paśyanti yathātvaṃ / tad bodhisattvo mahāsattva prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann upāyakauśalena
analyzed: ye iha bodhāya caranti anyatra sattvāḥ na jānanti na paśyanti yathātvam tat bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva prajñāpāramitāyām caran upāya kauśalena
translated: Then the Bodhisattva-Mahasattva, practicing the perfection of wisdom, with skillful means,

original: sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: sattvānām dharmam deśayati
translated: teaches the Dharma to beings.

original: parivarta /
analyzed: parivarta
translated: Chapter.

original: VIII / athāyuṣmān subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Subhuti said this to the Blessed One:

original: yadi bhagavann abhāvasvabhāvā sarvadharmās /
analyzed: yadi bhagavan abhāva svabhāvā sarva dharmāḥ
translated: If, Blessed One, all dharmas are of the nature of non-existence,

original: te na buddhai kṛtā na pratyekabuddhair na arhadbhir na anāgāmibhir na sakṛdāgāmibhir
analyzed: te na buddhaiḥ kṛtāḥ na pratyekabuddhaiḥ na arhadbhiḥ na anāgāmibhiḥ na sakṛdāgāmibhiḥ
translated: They are not made by the Buddhas, nor by the Pratyekabuddhas, nor by the Arhats, nor by the Non-returners, nor by the Once-returners,

original: na srotaāpannair na pratipannakair nāpi tair bodhisattvair mahāsattvaiḥ kṛtā ya iha
analyzed: na srotaāpannaiḥ na pratipannakaiḥ na api taiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ kṛtāḥ ye iha
translated: nor by the Stream-winners, nor by those who are candidates for the fruit of the Stream-winners, nor by those Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas who course in perfect wisdom.

original: bodhāya caranti / tat kuta esān dharmāṇāṃ nānākaraṇaṃ vā vyavasthānaṃ vā prajñāyate /
analyzed: bodhāya caranti tat kutas dharmāṇām nānākaraṇam vā vyavasthānam vā prajñāyate
translated: How then can one apprehend any differentiation or definition of dharmas?

original: ime nairayikā ime tairyagyonikā ime yāmalaukikā ime devā ime manuṣyāḥ /
analyzed: ime nairayikāḥ ime tairyagyonikāḥ ime yāmalaukikāḥ ime devāḥ ime manuṣyāḥ
translated: These are the denizens of hell, these the animals, these the ghosts, these the gods, these the men.

original: anena vā karmaṇā narakās tiryagyonir yamalokaḥ anena karmaṇā devāḥ anena karmaṇā
analyzed: anena vā karmaṇā narakāḥ tiryagyoniḥ yama lokaḥ anena karmaṇā devāḥ anena karmaṇā
translated: By this action the hells, the animal kingdom, the world of Yama, by this action the gods, by this action

original: manuṣyāḥ anena karmaṇā brahmakāyikā devāḥ yāvan naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñāyatanā devāḥ /
analyzed: manuṣyāḥ anena karmaṇā brahmakāyikāḥ devāḥ yāvat na eva saṃjñā na asaṃjñā āyatanāḥ devāḥ
translated: the men, by this action the gods of the Brahma-world up to the gods of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: anena karmaṇā srotaāpannāḥ sakṛdāgāmy anāgāmy arhan pratyekabuddhāḥ anena karmaṇā
analyzed: anena karmaṇā srotaāpannāḥ sakṛdāgāmī anāgāmī arhan pratyekabuddhāḥ anena karmaṇā
translated: By this action the Streamwinners, the Once-returners, the Never-returners, the Arhats, the Pratyekabuddhas, by this action

analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nena karmaṇā tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ abhāvasya
translated: the Bodhisattva, the great being, by this action the Tathagata, the Arhat, the fully enlightened Buddha. The non-existence of an own-being

original: hi bhagavan na kācit kriyā yayā kriyā narakaṃ vā gacchet tiryagyoniṃ vā yamalokaṃ
analyzed: hi bhagavat na kācid kriyā yayā kriyā narakam vā gacchet tiryagyonim vā yama lokam
translated: Blessed One, there is no action whatsoever by which one would go to hell, or to the animal realm, or to the world of Yama,🔽or be reborn among gods or humans, up to the gods in the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception. One would attain

original: vā devamānuṣyaṃ vā yāvan naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñāyataneṣu vā deveṣu upapadyeta / srotaāpattiphalaṃ
analyzed: vā deva mānuṣyam vā yāvat na eva saṃjñā na asaṃjñāyataneṣu vā deveṣu upapadyeta srotaāpatti phalam
translated: the fruit of stream-entry,

original: vā anuprāpnuyāt sakṛdāgāmiphalaṃ vā anāgāmiphalaṃ vā arhattvaṃ vā pratyekabodhiṃ vā /
analyzed: vā anuprāpnuyāt sakṛdāgāmi phalam vā anāgāmi phalam vā arhat tvam vā pratyeka bodhim vā
translated: the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, or arhatship, or individual enlightenment.

original: bodhisattvo vā mahāsattvo bodhimārge caret tathāgato vā 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sarvākārajñatāṃ vā anuprāpnuyād yām anuprāpya sattvāṃ saṃsārāṃ
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ vā mahāsattvaḥ bodhimārge caret tathāgataḥ vā rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sarva ākāra jña tām vā anuprāpnuyāt yām anuprāpya sattvām saṃsārām
translated: Or a bodhisattva mahāsattva would practice on the path to enlightenment, or a Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One would attain omniscience, having attained which he would lead beings out of the cycle of rebirth in🔽the three lower realms.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evam etat subhūte evam etat tathā yathā vadasi /
analyzed: evam etat subhūte evam etat tathā yathā vadasi
translated: So it is, Subhūti, so it is! It is just as you say.

original: abhāvasya hi subhūte na karma na kriyā na phalaṃ / bālo hi subhūte AdSPG II
analyzed: abhāvasya hi subhūte na karma na kriyā na phalam bālaḥ hi subhūte
translated: For the non-existent has no action, no activity, no result. The foolish one, Subhūti,

analyzed: a śrutavān pṛthagjanaḥ ārya dharmeṣu a kovidaḥ abhāva svabhāvān dharmān na prajānāti
translated: the untrained worldling, unskilled in the noble dharmas, does not know the dharmas as having the nature of non-existence.

original: sa viparyāsasamutthitena cittena vividhaṃ karmābhisaṃskaroti / tasya tādṛśa eva ātmabhāvo
analyzed: sa viparyāsa samutthitena cittena vividham karma abhisaṃskaroti tasya tādṛśaḥ eva ātma bhāvaḥ
translated: With a mind arisen from error, he creates various actions. His body is produced in accordance with that,

original: abhinirvartate / yadi vā narakeṣu yadi vā tiryagyonau yadi vā yamaloke yadi vā yāvan
analyzed: abhinirvartate yadi vā narakeṣu yadi vā tiryagyonau yadi vā yama loke yadi vā yāvan
translated: whether in the hells, or in the animal realm, or in the world of Yama, or up to

original: naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñāyataneṣu f / deveṣu / yāvad abhāvasya na karma na kriyā na
analyzed: deveṣu yāvat abhāvasya na karma na kriyā na
translated: the gods in the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception. As long as there is non-existence, there is no action, no activity,

original: phalaṃ / yaḥ punar abhāvaḥ abhāva eva saḥ / yat punar subhūtir evam āha / abhāvasya
analyzed: phalam yaḥ punar abhāvaḥ abhāvaḥ eva saḥ yat punar subhūtiḥ evam āha abhāvasya
translated: and no result. But that which is non-existence is just non-existence. And when Subhūti says,🔽For non-existence has no activity whatsoever by which activity one could attain the fruit of stream-entry,

original: hi na kācit kriyā yayā kriyayā yāvat srotaāpattiphalaṃ vā anuprāpnuyāt / sakṛdāgāmiphalaṃ
analyzed: hi na kācid kriyā yayā kriyayā yāvat srotaāpatti phalam vā anuprāpnuyāt sakṛdāgāmi phalam
translated: the fruit of once-returning,

original: vā anāgāmiphalaṃ vā arhattvaṃ vā pratyekabodhiṃ vā /
analyzed: vā anāgāmi phalam vā arhat tvam vā pratyeka bodhim vā
translated: the fruit of non-returning, or arhatship, or individual enlightenment,

original: bodhisattvo vā mahāsattvo mārgākārajñatāyāñc caret tathāgato vārhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ vā mahāsattvaḥ mārga ākāra jña tāyām caret tathāgataḥ vā arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: or a bodhisattva great being could practice the knowledge of path aspects, or a Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One

original: sarvākārajñatām anuprāpnuyād iti / yām anuprāpya sattvān saṃsārān mocayet / tat kiṃ
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tām anuprāpnuyāt iti yām anuprāpya sattvān saṃsārāt mocayet tat kim
translated: could attain the knowledge of all aspects, having attained which he would liberate beings from saṃsāra, then,

analyzed: manyase subhūte na abhāvaḥ mārgaḥ abhāvaḥ srotaāpatti phalam abhāvaḥ sakṛdāgāmi phalam
translated: Subhūti, do you think that the path is a non-existent, that the fruit of entering the stream is a non-existent, that the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth is a non-existent,

analyzed: abhāvaḥ nāgāmi phalam abhāvaḥ rhat tvam abhāvaḥ abhāvaḥ yāvat sarva ākārajña tā
translated: that the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth is a non-existent, that arhatship is a non-existent, that individual enlightenment is a non-existent, up to that the knowledge of all aspects is a non-existent?

original: āha / abhāvo bhagavan mārgaḥ abhāva srotaāpattiphalam abhāvaḥ sakṛdāgāmiphalam abhāvo 'nāgāmiphalam abhāvo 'rhatvam abhāvaḥ pratyekabodhir abhāvo
analyzed: āha abhāvaḥ bhagavat mārgaḥ abhāva srotaāpatti phalam abhāvaḥ sakṛdāgāmi phalam abhāvaḥ nāgāmi phalam abhāvaḥ rha tvam abhāvaḥ pratyeka bodhiḥ
translated: He said: The path is a non-existent, Blessed One, the fruit of entering the stream is a non-existent, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth is a non-existent, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth is a non-existent, arhatship is a non-existent, individual enlightenment is a non-existent,

original: yāvat sarvākārajñatā /
analyzed: yāvat sarva ākāra jña tā
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects is a non-existent.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tat kiṃ manyase subhūte abhāvo dharmaḥ abhāvan dharmam anuprāpnoti /
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte abhāvaḥ dharmaḥ abhāvan dharmam anuprāpnoti
translated: What do you think, Subhūti, does a non-existent dharma attain a non-existent dharma?

original: āha / no bhagavan /
analyzed: āha naḥ bhagavan
translated: He said: No, Blessed One.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: iti hi subhūte / yaś ca abhāvo yaś ca mārga ubhāv etau dharmau na saṃyuktau na visaṃyuktauv arūpiṇāv anidarśanāv apratighāv ekalakṣaṇau yaduta
analyzed: iti hi subhūte yaḥ ca abhāvaḥ yaḥ ca mārgaḥ ubhau etau dharmau na saṃyuktau na visaṃyuktau arūpiṇau a nidarśanau a pratighau eka lakṣaṇau yat uta
translated: Thus, Subhūti, the path and the non-existent, these two dharmas are neither conjoined nor disjoined, they are formless, cannot be shown, do not obstruct, and have one mark, which is to say

original: tatra subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann upāyakauśalena sattvāṃś
analyzed: tatra subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran upāya kauśalena sattvān
translated: There, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom with skillful means, for the sake of beings,

original: caturbhir viparyāsair abhiniviṣṭāṃ pañcaskandheṣu anitye nityasaṃjñīno duḥkhe sukhasaṃjñīnaḥ
analyzed: caturbhiḥ viparyāsaiḥ abhiniviṣṭām pañca skandheṣu anitye nitya saṃjñīnaḥ duḥkhe sukha saṃjñīnaḥ
translated: Those who are attached to the four inversions, who in the five aggregates have the notion of permanence in the impermanent, the notion of happiness in suffering,

original: anātmāny ātmasaṃjñinaḥ / aśubhe śubhasaṃjñīno bhāvābhiviniṣṭās tato bhāvād vivecayati /
analyzed: ātma saṃjñinaḥ aśubhe śubha saṃjñīnaḥ bhāva abhiviniṣṭāḥ tatas bhāvāt vivecayati
translated: the notion of self in the non-self, and the notion of beauty in the ugly, he then separates them from those existences.

original: VIII / athāyuṣmān subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One:

original: kaccid bhagavan vastv asti bhūtaṃ bhāvaṃs tathatā avitathatā yatra sthitvā bālapṛthagjanā vastv ity abhiniviśante / bhūtaṃ bhāvas tathatā avitathatā / 🔽AdSPG II
analyzed: kaccit bhagavan vastu asti bhūtam bhāvan tathatā avitathatā yatra sthitvā bāla pṛthagjanāḥ vastu iti abhiniviśante bhūtam bhāvaḥ tathatā avitathatā  adspr2Im ii
translated: Blessed One, is there any existent thing, real, true, suchness, non-otherness, on which foolish ordinary beings are attached to as a thing, as real, true, suchness, non-otherness?

original: yadi nāsti kathaṃ karma abhisaṃskurvanti / yena karmaṇā pañcagatikāt saṃsārān na parimucyante /
analyzed: yadi na asti katham karma abhisaṃskurvanti yena karmaṇā pañca gatikāt saṃsārāt na parimucyante
translated: If not, how do they form actions by which they are not liberated from the five destinies of saṃsāra?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: nāsti subhūte antaśo balāgrakoṭīnikṣepamātram api vastu yatra sthitvā bālapṛthagjanā
analyzed: nā asti subhūte antaśas bala agra koṭī nikṣepa mātram api vastu yatra sthitvā bāla pṛthagjanā
translated: Subhūti, there is not even as much as the tip of a hair that is an existent thing on which foolish ordinary beings,🔽apart from delusion, form actions. Therefore, Subhūti, I will give you a simile

original: karmābhisaṃskurvanti anyatra viparyāsena / tena hi subhūte upamān te kariṣyāmi yāvad
analyzed: karma abhisaṃskurvanti anyatra viparyāsena tena hi subhūte upamān te kariṣyāmi yāvat
translated: for this matter, in order to make it clear.

original: eva asyaivārthasya bhūyasyāmātrayā paripūraye yathāpaṇḍitājānīyuḥ / tat kiṃ manyase
analyzed: eva asya eva arthasya bhūyasyā amātrayā paripūraye yathā paṇḍitāḥ jānīyuḥ tat kim manyase
translated: For the sake of fulfilling this meaning even more, as the wise would understand it. What do you think,

original: subhūte kaccit svapnadarśino vastv asti / yatra sthitvā svapnadarśī pañcabhiḥ kāmaguṇaiḥ paricārayet /
analyzed: subhūte kaccit svapna darśinaḥ vastu asti yatra sthitvā svapna darśī pañcabhiḥ kāmaguṇaiḥ paricārayet
translated: Subhuti, is there any real thing in a dream, on which the dreamer would stand and enjoy the five sense pleasures?

original: āha / svapna eva tāvan nāsti / kutaḥ punaḥ svapnadarśī /
analyzed: āha svapnaḥ eva tāvat na asti kutas punar svapna darśī
translated: He said: The dream itself does not exist, how much less so the dreamer,

original: tatra sthitvā pañcabhiḥ kāmaguṇaiḥ paricārayet /
analyzed: tatra sthitvā pañcabhiḥ kāma guṇaiḥ paricārayet
translated: on which he would stand and enjoy the five sense pleasures.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tat kiṃ manyase subhūte kaccit punar dharmo 'sti saṃskṛto vā asaṃskṛto vā sāsravo vā anāsravo vā yo na svapnopamaḥ /
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte kaccit punar dharmaḥ sti saṃskṛtaḥ vā asaṃskṛtaḥ vā sa āsravaḥ vā anāsravaḥ vā yaḥ na svapna upamaḥ
translated: What do you think, Subhuti, is there any conditioned or unconditioned, contaminated or uncontaminated dharma that is not like a dream?

original: āha / nāsti bhagavaṃ / kaścid dharma saṃskṛto vā asaṃskṛto vā sāsravo vā anāsravo vā yo na svapnopamaḥ /
analyzed: āha na asti bhagavam kaścid dharma saṃskṛtaḥ vā asaṃskṛtaḥ vā sa āsravaḥ vā anāsravaḥ vā yaḥ na svapna upamaḥ
translated: He said: Blessed One, there is no conditioned or unconditioned, contaminated or uncontaminated dharma that is not like a dream.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kaccit punaḥ svapne pañcagatikaḥ saṃsāro 'sti /
analyzed: kaccit punar svapne pañca gatikaḥ saṃsāraḥ sti
translated: Is there the five-path samsara in a dream?

original: āha / no hīdaṃ bhagavan /
analyzed: āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: He said: No indeed, Blessed One.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tat kiṃ manyase subhūte svapne mārgabhāvanā asti /
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte svapne mārga bhāvanā asti
translated: What do you think, Subhuti, is there the cultivation of the path in a dream?

original: yāṃ mārgabhāvanām āgamya na saṃkliśyeta na vyavadāyeta /🔽āha / no hīdaṃ bhagavann /🔽avastukaḥ sa bhagavan dharmaḥ aprajñaptikaḥ aprajñapanīyaḥ sarvavyāhārapadavyañjanaiḥ /
analyzed: yām mārga bhāvanām āgamya na saṃkliśyeta na vyavadāyeta  āha no hi idam bhagavan  avastukaḥ sa bhagavan dharmaḥ a prajñaptikaḥ a prajñapanīyaḥ sarva vyāhāra pada vyañjanaiḥ
translated: The cultivation of the path by which one would neither be defiled nor purified.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: He said, No, Blessed One.

analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte yadā ādarśa maṇḍale pratibimban dṛśyate kaccit tasya vastu
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti, what do you think? When a reflection is seen in a round mirror, is there any basis for that,

original: asti yat karmābhisaṃskuryāt yat karmābhisaṃskṛtya narakaṃ vā gacchet tiryagyoniṃ
analyzed: asti yat karma abhisaṃskuryāt yat karma abhisaṃskṛtya narakam vā gacchet tiryagyonim
translated: by which it would perform an action, having performed which it would go to hell, or to the animal realm,

original: vā yamalokaṃ vā devamanuṣyān vā /🔽āha / no hīdaṃ bhagavann /
analyzed: vā yama lokam vā deva manuṣyān vā  āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: or to the world of Yama, or to gods or humans?

original: avastukaṃ bhagavan pratibimbaṃ anyatra bālānām ullāpakaṃ /
analyzed: avastukam bhagavan pratibimbam anyatra bālānām ullāpakam
translated: He said, No, Blessed One. The Blessed One said, Subhūti, what do you think? Is that reflection a basis, other than for the amusement of fools?

original: tat kuto 'sya f / karma bhavisyati / AdSPG II
analyzed: tat kutas sya f karma bhaviṣyati adspr3In
